reviewText: This is the best way to travel in Bangkok It is underground and is not impacted by the notorious traffic jams in the streets It is very cheap and there are machines with instructions in English to buy tickets (also ticket offices are available) It is not as extensive as in other cities but it is very efficient Very clean air conditioned and very easy to use
A good cheap and uncomplicated way to get around Bangkok Great connections to the city sights and with a change to the airport
It is cheaper than BTS A lot comfortable than the public transportation like buses It linked with someone famous places

Always very clean punctual with security personnel on the platforms No fare dodging possible thanks to controlled chipping in and out  Very very cold though We caught a bad case of flu when you were cooled down from 35 degrees to a mere 5 degrees Cost for two people around 50 Bart for 45 stations

Great metro style Very easy to use with a Visa or Mastercard credit card To be used at entry and exit Please note one card per person‚Ä¶ we were unable to use one card for our couple‚Ä¶ but with two cards‚Ä¶ Awesome

The metro which is mostly underground in the center is only part of the city rail passenger transport system It consists of two lines with a length of 43 kilometers with 35 stations The first one is blue opened in 2004 The second Purple Line opened on August 6 2016 and on August 11 2017 the two lines were connected via an interchange station The city's plans include a very serious increase in the number of stations the length of lines and the addition of at least one more branch The metro is very clean The depth of the stations is small Spacious Clear ticket sales system So far I see one serious drawback  trains rarely run When there are a lot of people there are problems with traffic jams at ticket offices and on trains

reviewTitle: Access to the Royal Palace and Chinatown
reviewText: MRT I used to take a taxi to get from Suvarnabhumi International Airport to the city but the chances of getting ripped off are high in Bangkoküöï=Íí±‚Äß* On this trip I took the Airport Link to Makkasan Station and then changed to the MRTüöÉ¬≥‚ÇÉ I went from Phetchaburi Station to Sukhumvit Station (Asok Station) to access the hotel It was a bit of a walk to transfer but the fare was cheapüöÉ It was convenient because there was no traffic jam and it took a long timeüöóüööüöìüöô It's also easy to get to tourist spots so I recommend using it‚ú®

reviewTitle: Easy to use and get around
reviewText: Using the subway (MRT) is an easy and inexpensive way to travel around Bangkok Getting a card is less expensive than buying a token each time The staff are always very friendly and helpful There is no traffic and to save the time‚Ä¶

I went to the flower market in Pak Khlong and got on at the nearest Sanam Chai station It's fast and comfortable regardless of traffic jams I bought a token like in Korea and got on It was empty There are station name displays inside the car so it's easy to find the station where you get off
Unreliable time Sometimes the train leave a little early than it suppose to but I guess this isn‚Äôt Japan
The connection is very good and there is a lot of frequency and you don't have to wait long Train is very clean and efficient
Great experience systems are in place people and staff are friendly and accommodative  Saves time with bangkok traffic
Best way to get from the modern centre of Bangkok to old Bangkok ( palace wat pho etc) Can be busy at rush hour but same goes for the BTS too

reviewTitle: Cheap, Efficient, Easy to use Travel in Bangkok
reviewText: The Bangkok Metro system is a well designed and a safe form of transport Clear oral announcements are repeated in English The signage is clear and the automated ticket machines are easy to use There are ticket offices in every station if you are not confident in using the machines Good queuing systems operate at busy times It is only a pity that it does not cover more of the city
Clean and not overcrowded Quite quiet on a Sunday morning Pleasant ride cool environment and clean seat
Security are older than 60 not friendly like before face like drug user and treated the passengers like dog awfully

reviewTitle: Another example of how to do an Underground railway.
reviewText: Here is another example of how to do Mass Transit Systems The whole system is spotlessly clean estate and trains Typical journeys cost 28 THB (¬£075) short journeys 18 THB (¬£055) Compare this to the dirty and unreliable London Underground where the minimum charge is ¬£620 Sadiq Khan should visit the Far East and learn how a Underground system should be run
Cattle carriages with not enough seats available while ever worsening service  delays and increasing prices Not satisfactory operation

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: The MRT is the perfect way to travel around Bangkok You can  buy a token for your journey at the entrance to each metro station and they are very inexpensive The trains are clean and spacious for underground trains   There is even data

We were going out to the JJ weekend market which is quite away out of the center and we noticed there were two MRT stations right there This system was clean modern quicker than driving and very inexpensive When you come in there are vending machines for ride tokens in English The staff were very helpful and the signage is excellent We got to our destination quite easily and would definitely use the system again and recommend it to others

Great and cheap way to get around Bangkok we‚Äôve used it before when in Bangkok and obviously as long as the stations are near to where your going no problem We were out of town in Lat Krabang and linked into the MRT from the Airport train at Makkasan walking to Phetchaburi station As we were only here for one day before flying home we wanted to see the Royal Palace again so it‚Äôs the cheapest and easiest way into the city  Photos are of  Sanam Chai station which is the closest MRT to the Palace

reviewTitle: Easy to use.  Cheap, cheerful and efficient!
reviewText: I used this a few times only I mainly used the BTS The MRT services more local areas and some tourist attractions¬† Appears to be busier than the BTS as more locals use it Air conditioning is not as cold¬† Cheap to use and interchange should you also need to use the BTS¬† Staff are helpful and the self  service ticket machines are easy to use¬† Stations are clean and big¬† Follow the signs as there are many entrances  exits¬† The ticket mainly appears to be a token the size of a coin which is easy to loose so be careful¬† I just got single journey tickets¬† Not sure if you can get daily or multiple¬† You cannot purchase a combination ticket MRT  BTS¬† Totally separate¬† Average single journey is around THB 3000¬† Download an application from google play which will help you plan your journey and manage timings¬† Safe to use¬† You cannot eat or drink in stations or on trains¬† At the time of C19 masks must be worn¬† Taxis in Bangkok are awful¬† Expensive and drivers don't know the roads well¬† This is a cheap and cheerful way to commute around¬† Efficient and timely¬†
Not much difference from BTS except it goes under the ground The service is good as always The reliable mode of transportation in Bangkok to avoid the traffic jams

reviewTitle: Best way to travel around Bangkok
reviewText: I use the line under the airport straight into central Bangkok for 45 Thai bht that's just over a pound It misses all of the traffic jams and is quick clean and comfortable
We got lost but fortunately the staff was really helpful and we got to the right train in no time It's great to avoid traffic
Well designed and put together The trains are efficient and reasonably priced The stations are clean and wonderful to use The only way to improve the system is to include more trains

reviewTitle: Easy to use and get around.
reviewText: Using the subway (MRT) is an easy and inexpensive way to travel around Bangkok  Getting a card is less expensive than buying a token each time   The staff are always very friendly and helpful

Bangkok`s MRT is an excellent way to see this vast city Trains run a few minutes apart they get you to your destination quickly they are clean efficient and value for money Research before you travel will enhance your trip

reviewTitle: Easy to use and will get you there in air-conditioned comfort
reviewText: The new MRT extensions makes getting to Temples Chinatown etca breeze Seniors will save 50% off the low cost fare Train stations and trains are airconditioned Travel like a local and you will save a lot of time getting places

Ok so the MRT or metro to you and me is great Very cheap and easy to use It covers all the main island and links to the cable cars and the monorail  Only one thing it is cheap ($2 most trips )but it likes cash and will not give you more than $4 in change so don‚Äôt get court with only $10 bills as it will not play

reviewTitle: Very convenient and super easy to use, lots of English directions
reviewText: We had an MRT station 2 min from our hotel and used it to get everywhere It's very easy convenient and cheap as you only pay for as far as you go just pick you direction and stop Ticket machines offer English and some terminals have tellers
We took MRT from Asok (Sukhumvit MRT Station) to Chinatown ( Wat Mongkon MRT Station) on the Chinese New Year The Wat Mongkon MRT Station is beautiful The staff were friendly and helpful

reviewTitle: The best place for clean air in Bangkok
reviewText: Most users are glad we now have a reasonable subway running in Bangkok I agree with other comments that a common ticket with BTS would be helpful  I disagree with the problems with tokens  which is correct if just jusing it rarely  But everyone can buy a valuestore card  including rebates  with ease (and ID) Yet thousands of Thais prefer to cue every day instead of putting 100 Baht into a card (which is about 3 UDS)  The good news considering the horrible pollution in BBK's air we measured the particles namely the 25 ppm at the big exchange station AsokSukhumvit To our surprise at MRT level the air was 510 times CLEANER than at ground level So the air filtering and climatization there is excellent  A pity there are nearly no seats or benches to sit down and breathe clean air for longer  PS The optional questions about this "attraction" make nt alot of sense since we talk about a public transport system And asking about "Veterans" and discounts is rather an American gimmick  insulting for other countries even who have their own thinking about US Veterans  I strongly recommend asking for "Senior Citizen" discounts instead

reviewTitle: Need a Common Ticket with the BTS
reviewText: The MRT and BTS are the best ways to get around Bangkok  It is annoying that you can't buy a day pass or ticket good on both  Every time you switch from one to the other to get where you are going you have to stop and get another ticket  Other than that it is excellent

Whenever we go to the mrt there are sometimes lineups at the machine to get tokens Each rider has to purchase their own token separately  So if you have a group of 4 people all going to the same place it takes 4 times as long as it should as there are no places to select how many riders in your trip This creates huge lines at sometimes throughout the week Can't believe this has not been remedied yet Very simple fix

Don't be afraid of the Bangkok subway system  The toll vending machines are very intuitive the route maps are easy to understand and every station has a human being to sell tokens and help you if you need information  The easiest subway I have ever ridden
I would say almost as good as the BTS I guess the MRT is exclusively underground while the BTS is overground and so has views all around
We used google maps to work out the route and then got on Knowing where we were headed was helpful This train system is easy to navigate and tickets easy to purchase
All BTS and MRT stations are very convenient and accessible I like MRT even more especially during the very hot weather in BKK as there are ACs

reviewTitle: Best transport to avoid traffic jam. Always packed.
reviewText: If you are in Bangkok this is the best way to save money and time if your destination is along the limited line It is cheap clean and always full Buy a multiple fare card at the ticket counter in order to avoid long queuing  at vending machines during rush hour
Cheap and easy to use Best way for backpacking people to travel within the city Information center is very helpful and guided us to the right gate There is also security for a safe travel

Caught MTR a few times with my son his wife and 18 month old son what a nightmare always so crowded once we tried to catch for few stops six trains went by and were so crowded couldn't get on in the end we walked

reviewTitle: Blue Line extension is a godsend
reviewText: That the Bangkok Metro is continually being extended is testimony to its ready acceptance by locals and tourists alike  Its 2019 Blue Line extension past Hua Lamphong means Chinatown and the Chao Praya River boats are more accessible than ever  Trains are frequent clean reliable fast between stations and safe  Escalators and lifts make access easy  Station staff at fare gates are helpful  There is an easy connection at Phetchaburi to the Airport rail line  The newest stations are beautifully designed such as Sanam Choi  Fares are cheap THB42 from HL to Silom single  Why add to traffic congestion by using a taxi GRAB or auto rickshaw when the MRT is such a winner

The Bangkok tourist map should be updated to reflect the new MRT stations We needed to go visit the Golden Palace Wat Pho and Wat Arun Our map indicated Hua Lamphong as the last stop There is a wonderful new MRT station at Sanam Chai that seamlessly connects the three landmarks mentioned above plus Museum of Siam
Fast clean and comfortable Fares are reasonable If you are a senior buy your ticket from the cashier you will get 50% off the fare
Convenient and efficient  Was super crowded when we were on it literally packed sardines Clear signs and easy to transfer from MRT to BTS to airport rail
I love the mass transport of Bangkok and this is a great part of it  easy to use and well integrated to the sky train

reviewTitle: Good transport to move around the city
reviewText: This transport system is very good for roaming around the city with flexible and less cost the timing is good and easy to access

The MRT is newer and cleaner than the BTS and can be a good choice if you need to visit somewhere close to a station On the downside the network isn't so extensive and it can get very crowded Cheap and efficient way to travel around Bangkok though and is worthwhile using instead of land transport on crowded streets

reviewTitle: Not a place, but a service.
reviewText: This review is a little out of the ordinary in that I usually review a hotel or restaurant This concerns a service We‚Äôve used the tubesubway in Bangkok before but it was many years ago It still looks new and works well The stations that we used were clean and efficient The AC is a welcome relief in the heat of a Bangkok day Some stations are obviously busier than others but the folks that travel on the trains know rider etiquette  I hope other people give it a try On this visit we weren‚Äôt as close to the Skytrain but I‚Äôve found it to be a useful part of the Bangkok public transport system as well

I use the MRT daily to go from my home suburb to to nearest BTS station  The service is fast efficient and carriages clean  Trains usually arrive within 6 mins  The MRT is often packed with office workers between 730 and 10 am daily and in the evening from about 530 pm till around 8 pm  At those times one is squashed like a sardine

The MRT is not only faster cheap and less crowded but also recently serves tourist sites such as Chinatown Wat Pho the Grand Palais and a few minutes away the Museum Siam The suburb to Thonburi a station close to the Wat Arun Bang kae markets and Khlongs Some stations are nicely decorated and equipped with lift and all have escalators although benches on the platforms will be welcomeA 50% card discount for the senior aged 60 years Most of the station have a confortable mall and direction clearly marked signboards A TV screen show the waiting time for the next train and the staff are very kind   Smart card if you spend few days in Bangkok or token single journey vending machines or buy at ticket office Long queues at rush hour you can walk to the other side of the station it maybe better Fare indicated on a board in the stations

reviewTitle: Cheap and efficient travel by Rail.
reviewText: Nothing opens until after 10 am trains will be crowded from 10am to 1 pm Rail gets you quickly to all the best shopping centres  to exploreThere is some waling from one level to another after a day or so one gets to know what to do Buy a MRT rail pass for 200bht and then add another 100bht The pass will be valid for 7 years

Much of the MRT is underground so there are fewer opportunities to sightsee while under way  Stations are very good usually wellsigned (as in clocks that tell when the next train will arrive  Can buy tickets from machines or from MRT personnel  Highly recommended
The MRT is fantastic and the best way to travel in Bangkok once you work out the map and line (we travelled blue line every day) it is cheap convenient airconditioned and so easy Totally recommend

reviewTitle: smooth and clean - and on time
reviewText: Compared to other large cities in the world Bangkok has a relatively small network of MRT (underground) and BTS (above ground) But they are regularly extending the network Get one of the various travel cards from the counter  saves money

We loved this way of travel lots of new stations so you can get about easier The undergroiund is clean and air conditioned a real treat to get away from the heat Spotless and beautiful Cheap and easy to use
Similar to BTS it's wiser to choose MRT than taxi if you want to avoid the terrible traffic jam while travelling in the city

reviewTitle: MRT service is efficient. However pack even on weekends. Locals lack courtesy to give away priority seats to senio
reviewText: NET service is efficient with clean trains However still pack on weekends Locals still lack courtesy to give up seats to senior citizens

reviewTitle: Easy to Use and Beats the Slow Road Traffic
reviewText: We recently used the MRT in Bangkok and found the trains to be very clean and not too busy if you are traveling off peak Signs and Station Names were in Thai and English and the system is expanding and now goes close to many of the temples and attractions Prices were inexpensive Recommend getting accommodation in Bangkok close to a Metro or Skytrain Station if traveling on a tight budget

reviewTitle: Buy a ‚Äúcard‚Äù - have 1/2 price senior rate card
reviewText: This is a well run clean modern transportation subway system  It complements the sky train system but they are owned by different companies so you need different access cards  BUY one  It will save you from the long lines that occur on a regular basis to buy tokens  Very inexpensive and so easy to use  Highly recommended and thankful for it while traveling in Bangkok
The road traffic in Bangkok is terrible MRT and Sky Train are a great way to get around and relatively cheap

To get around bangkok traffic using the MRT and skytrain is the cheap and easy way to get around quickly and now with the expansion of the blue line the MRT gets you within 12 mile from the grand palace wat pho China town India markets wat arun golden mount Additional blue stations have opened across the river which was great for us since we went from wat po to wat arun and did not have to battle the tourist crowds on the ferry or the heat There is additional stations opening but new years and the planned completion of another line to make a complete circle route on both sides of the river Cheap travel we rode from isatrap station by wat arun to our Airbnb in sathorn for 28bht per person After a hot day of sightseeing it was nice to ride in air conditioning and our stop was 200mtrs from our bnb

Our favorite way to roam around the city had to be the MRT Only a $1 or $2 one way and depending on your final destination It was always on time very clean and super easy to use It also goes from point A to point B without the crazy chaotic Bangkok traffic
We really liked to explore the city with the MRT The ticket system has to be optimize but in all everything fine

Reasonably priced modern rail service in Bangkok  Paper tickets can be purchased by I recommend purchasing an MRT Card for convenience  Network is slowly expanding to cover more areas in the city  Recommended

Mrt is a recommended mode of transportation to get to and fro in Bangkok It's an easy and fast way to get aroundtraffic in Bkk can be a nightmare so please dont be timid to use the Mrt One factor that stood out for me was that people actually queue up to board Which this can be practise throughout the world

On a recent trip to Bangkok I used the MRT to get around I found it very user friendly safe and the stations and trains spotlessly clean Trains are very frequent  They do get crowded in peak hours and if buying the rechargeable card or recharging  try to avoid those times  An amazing public transport system

reviewTitle: Clean, efficient, easy to use, inexpensive
reviewText: We traveled all over Bangkok via MRT It's a terrific system  easy to use with friendly helpful Englishspeaking personnel  It's safe well marked inexpensive and quite easy to use by tourists It's a great new system

post competitive rival to bts for public transport only it is underground type compare to the latter which is a raise public transport fare wise is almost same like bts whilst the routes is pending on the destination as sometimes it might take longer or shorter

It is one of the best systems in the worldAlthough it is not cheap it is so much faster than taxi due to the traffic in Bangkok Very efficient and always clean and people actually queue in an organised line to board and let the passengers off first not like in MelbourneAlso it is very easy to use
With the MRT stations getting around Wat Pho  Yaowarat  Do alight at Wat Mangkon or Sanam Chai to the the beautiful interior design of the platform

reviewTitle: lines can be really long but it is a good mode of transportation
reviewText: We didn't get a re loadable card for this since i thought we'd only use the BTS The ticketing system is easy to use understand though although the touchscreen can be a bit tricky The lines can be very long but it moves fast
Wow found a new station near main temple area on the river Very easy to use and clean Wish our at home were as great

reviewTitle: Crowded but a great public transportation
reviewText: Our guesthouse receptionist suggested us to ride the Skytrain and MRT to Siam Niramit because of the sudden flood occurred at our area due to heavy rain We were a bit lost at first on how to get to the train station however the ticket counter attendant the train staff and Thai people were very good and helped us to lead our way for a smooth transfer from Siam station Skytrain to MRT Sukhumvit I love travelling to Thailand (have been travelling in Thailand for so many time already) because this country is really a tourist friendly country WELL DONE THAILAND

The MRT in Bangkok is one of the simplest public transport systems to use even for non Thai speaking users Definitely recommend grabbing a MRT card and load it up The stations well sign posted and easy to navigate Once in train announcements are both in Thai and English Very clean inside train and stations Staff very helpful and welling to assist It interlinks with the BTS and buses at some stations Cheap way to get to point A to B

The MRT is very easy to use with most everything being in two languages Thai and English Purchasing a ticket is easy as the first option on the ticket machines allows users to select English which is followed by a prompt to select your destination on the route map and then payment is made Most of the station machines I have used have machines that accept both bills and coins but the one station that had a machine that only accepted coins also had a manned ticket counter The stop announcements are made in English as well The stations and train cars are easy to use convenient have friendly helpful staff and are very clean  something some western cities should take note of when reviewing their own public transportation

reviewTitle: Good way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: The lines are very limited but the government are trying to extend them to the suburb of Bangkok Yet it is still a good way to travel in the inner Bangkok but one should avoid the rush hours which is not as bad as in certain cities during rush hours

This brand new metro system makes the London Underground look positively archaic notwithstanding the recent improvements It is clean efficient and simple to navigate New lines are in the pipeline (pun intended)
Best way to travel around Bangkok to avoid crazy traffic in Bangkok Take you mostly every where and clean  safe
we wanted to take the MRT from sukhumvit to Silom at 6pm and we went into the station and the queues were around 100 deep they could not cope with the amount of people so we left and took a taxi
Frequent trains inexpensive tickets and clean carriages  This is a fast way to travel around a busy city

reviewTitle: Easy to hop on and off to Landmark of Bangkok
reviewText: It is easy to commute to the Landmark of Bangkok within walking distance to the Emerald Buddha temple from Sanamchai Station Avoid traffic congestion of Bangkok by taking MRT from Sukhumvit area (Sukhumvit Station) it would be easier if plan the route ahead and travel during off peak hours After long day from Ratanakosin islands I stopped at China Town to enjoy street food (Wat Mungkorn station)

reviewTitle: Simple and a must use to get arojdn
reviewText: Just like the sky train I was worried about using this as I cannot speak Thai But the ticket machines translate to English all signage is in English and they translate as you approach each station too   Very simple to use so clean and good air con too Would definitely recommend with the sky train as the means of travelling around in Bangkok
Loved this quick and easy transport system As with any big city its crowded but easy to use and get around Bangkok Not expensive either The trains are clean too

It‚Äôs good to see network expending further afield and new lines being open but this implies more people traveling and it seems that authorities don‚Äôt know how to handle crowds and how to maximize the traffic Trains arrive irregularly amount of compartments is the same for peak and off peak hours On top of that it pretty expensive service which is out of financial reach for quite a few locals
MRT is a great way to get around Bangkok The MRT links in with the BTS BTSMRT 3 days travel psses are available as well as top up cards

reviewTitle: New connection through China Town & Subway Art
reviewText: It is great that the MRT has been extended Going through China Town it now easier to get there AND the last stop before the river makes it evenevepossible possible to reach Wat Pho and the Palace dy walking   The station Wat Monkrut has great Art on the walls Theme coffee (probably sponsered by Nestl√©)   To not wait in the qeue to get a ticket pay with coins at the machines Goes faster

reviewTitle: Finally access to the heart of China Town
reviewText: I like visiting China Town in Bangkok but I was frustrated by its traffic jam and over priced taxi or tuk tuk cheating services However I discovered that MRT connects to the heart of China Town (Wat Mangkon station) following the instructions easy to find the way to main streets of China Town old market So no need to be cheated by taxi drivers or tuk tuk over charged I visit China town next time

reviewTitle: Great way to get about Bangkok
reviewText: The Bangkok metro is wonderful efficient comfortable with clean and easily negotiated stations and also Very cheap  At present there are two lines with the Blue Line being the most useful for visitors  It connects with the Airport BTS at Petchaburi and the BTS at Sukhumvit as well as Hua Lamphong train station  Also use for Lumpini Park and the eastern end of Silom Road  Fares are cheaper than the BTS on the Metro you are issued with tokens rather than cards but travel follows the same principles as on the BTS  Staff at ticket offices all seem to have a good command of English and English signage is available throughout  The line has been recently extended to the west beyond Hua Lamphong across the river and this is very useful to visitors  The stop at Sanam Chai is really really convenient to Wat Pho Museum Siam the river and everything in the Grand palaceRattonisokin area  Also if you are over 60 ask for senior tickets half price on an already cheap ticket

reviewTitle: Fast and efficient way to get around the city
reviewText: The MRT is a fast and efficient way to get around the city  I found the system very easy to navigate and ticket machines in English made travel easy

The MRT system is very good and new It goes around the city I used it a lot while I was in Bangkok It would be a lot more difficult for me to travel without this MRT However be prepared for the crowd on the weekend or rush hour
Very cheap and easy to use Sometimes crowded at the times people travel for work The network is reasonably extensive and is extending I believe

we wanted to go to chinatown so taking the MRT was quite stressful due to the long queues at the ticket booth maybe 100 people We got the tickets and waited for 3 trains as too bust Plus is the trains are new but we took a taxi back
An easy way to get round central Bangkok Clean stations Liftsexcalators for wasy access Tickets were cheaper than BTS A topup card made getting around simple
They were so fast that helped you go from places that far away from each other The station looked clean
Of course during peak hour it can be a bit crowd but other than that it was very efficient and the connect too was good
A very good service for travelling around Bangkok Often makes things a lot easier then travelling via moto or car
This is a very efficient mode of transport and once you master the various destination stops it is easy way to get around the metropolis of Bkk
We took terminal 21 and travelled all the way to the Wat Pho Temple and Wat Arun Temple in a short period of time Credit to Bangkok to have a metro system so efficient
The MRT is a great way to get around Bangkok  The system is easy to understand the trains are regular and they are clean

reviewTitle: MRT fast, efficient and on time
reviewText: The MRT was fast efficient and on time Very comfortable and cool with the heat outside A little difficult if you have not done your homework related to where it stops but staff is very helpful

The entire Mrt rail network system works very efficientlyThe smooth flow of passengers with directional guidance as the train doors openwhereby one who is entering the train waits aside while those exiting have first preferenceIn normal societythis should be the normhowever notTheir discipline is inspiring

The MRT is very important for you go around to Bangkok and have many distination too The station are convenient and comfortable when you wanna go All staff is very nice and helpful when guest have a problem For me MRT is very nice and have many ways for your connec to change to sky train So i very like it üöäüöÜüöÖüöÑüöàüöÉüöã

reviewTitle: A cheap and efficient mode of transport
reviewText: Bangkok's Underground system is a boon for travellers and tourists especially when the city streets are choked with traffic and smog on a daily basis Cleanliness is top notch and the service is consistent

It is clean safe and on time Basically a transport option that works Just wish that you could buy return tickets from the machines and the ticket system was integrated with Rabbit Card Not complaining just a suggestion )
Easy to access to and from almost anywhere in Bangkok Cheap way to travel  Stations and trains are kept very clean

reviewTitle: Just as in London or Paris
reviewText: I took the MRT a couple of times going to the train station Good and comfortable underground trains I use the MRT in rush hours mostly They are comfortable and there is also AC in all of them

Traffic in Bangkok is easily one of the worst in the world Using the MRT along with the skytrain (BTS) and the ferry services are the saner way to get around Bangkok without wasting hours stuck in a gridlock The MRT is well maintained everything is available in English it is easy to buy tickets tickets are reasonably priced and the trains frequency is very good Thoroughly recommend to use as a means of getting around the city
Another reliable option to travel within Bangkok to visit attractions and restaurants Get a card topup and travel with ease

reviewTitle: Good alternative to avoid the crazy traffic
reviewText: The metro is clean punctual and reliable to use  It is quite easy for foreigners to navigate through the mrt system  I wish it could have been more expansive it is very limited as of now

MRT stations are beautifully decorated especially new stations  from MRT Hualumphong to MRT Thapra It passes chinatown at Watmangkorn temple station MRT is the new choice to access central of Bangkok  Grand palace and Tha chang pier It's trustable and stricted transportation price Now it hasn't fully operated just opened between 10am to 4pm only After it has grand opening on September 2019 don't worried with cheated taxi fare anymore
Excellent way to travel around Bangkok in a quick manner  Cheap clean and efficient The only way to go
The MRT (Subway) is great but not an a good allround service as there is only one line at the time of writing

Between the MRT and BTS most of bkk is within reach One end of the link ends in China town where Wat Timet is This houses one of the largest gold buddhas in the world JJ market is on the other end of the loop for great shopping

I traveled from the Phrom Phong to Survarnabhumi Airport via the Airport Link and transfering at Praya Thai station I paid about 90 Baht per person total  This is great with 1 or 2 persons The trip took about 55 minutes with the walking involved  Consider a taxi if taveling with more or luggage which may run about 350 Baht
Everybody can go to Grand Palace by MRT train stopping at Sanam Chai Station Now is on trial from 10am to 4pm until 28 September 2019 and full operational hours from 29 Septembers onwards
Underground MRT connected to BTS connects to key main shopping areas and key developed areas with the airport link to center of towngreat and easy way for transportation to escape the traffics
A relatively new underground Puts London to shame as this is cheap  30 Bht most trips Air con great Very clean Orderely passengers who do not push around like London

While the Sky trains do a beautiful job outside over the congested streets of Bangkok the MRT which was built with amazing silence and efficiency connects long distances underground and heralded Bangkok's transition as a world class city Another cheap and quick public transport option for residents and tourists Very swish and easy to do it yourself with adequate signages and maps everywhere You can  figure out how to go anywhere without asking anyone Which for me is a very good indicator of a Visitor Friendly Destination
On our recent visit to Bangkok we made frequent use of the MRT  We found it safe inexpensive and efficient  We were pleasantly surprised by its cleanliness and order

Just as in any large city if your origination and destination points are close to a station or if you can easily take a cab or tuktuk to a station this is the most efficient way to get around  They are crowded but clean
This is a very good transport system to use here to avoid the traffic jams Its easy to use and clean

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Love travelling on the MRT Easy way to get around Undergound is cool and new shops around many of the stations make it  good place for a coffee I am p[leased to9 hear to system is being expanded

reviewTitle: Another way to wander around the city
reviewText: Less route than BTS but much more affordable with the 3 day ticket at a very reasonable price for tourists and friendly staffs

My family want to take train to a station that we have booked the restaurant However  there was a very long queue in ticket machines and also the platform It was so crowded and hot as the the train service was out of service I have been waiting the train for more than 45 minutes(we still couldn‚Äôt get on it when  the time of reservation was passed ) And we were not able to eat at that restaurant  Bad experience

Best easiest and quickest way to get around Bangkok during rush hour which is 247 Inexpensive easy to understand signs are also in English Staff is supper helpful with tourists AC and free WIFI throughout
get a day pass and get around quickly and easily Easy to find your way around The MRT staff are very helpful and the passengers as well

Took the MRT to the market transferred from the skytrain  Its easy to get around buy tickets and transfer Its also very affordable and you'll beat traffic The rails take a bit to get used to but easy to navigate

We used both the BTS Skytrain and the MRT yesterday getting around for the first time in Bangkok The MRT is a multi level subway colocated at some stops near the Skytrain so getting around is relatively easy however they do not use the same system of payment Skytrain is by tap onoff cards and the MRT is by black tokens the staff at each are very friendly and assisted us confused tourist with which level and platform to use no problems travelling around Bangkok we look forward to using the MRT again today

I took the MRT during the peak hour in the evening to avoid being caught in the traffic  The train was very packed and I had wait for a second train until I could board  Nevertheless it was a fast and convenient way to travel using the MRT
Thailand MRT is clean and had never seen anyone brought food or eating in train Enjoyed taking MRT in Bangkok because it also convenient form one point to another
Easy to use clean convenient reliable and safe  What more can I say  Guides available to ask questions and also signage in English  Great transport system  Oh and affordable so no complaints from me
Convenient subway  Connecting the erstwhile unconnected areas and Bangkok suburbs  Will be good when entire network is operational
we had to get about a fair bit on the MRT I found it very easy to use very clean and very prompt Signage is also in English so easy to understand where you are going to

For me it was the first time using the metro in Bangkok During all my visits to this city before I always forgot to try this means of transportation In general I think it is a good and cheap way to travel if you can reach your destination using it The airco however in the train(s) I used was not working properly or not capable to do so Pity

Clean efficient and frequent mass transit system  Staff can understand and speak fluent English  It's amazing that they offer fare concession (half price) to commuters over 60 whether they are locals or foreigners

If you are staying in town and wish to skip the traffic the MRT is a good solution Some stations above all in the center are aerial and not very clean but you also have some very modern and clean stations underground with air con and they were a good surprise It is cheap runs on time and is quite convenient We enjoyed our experience and recommend it

I suggest you purchase a transit card if you are here for a few days then you can avoid long lineups to pay for each trip and it's still a cheap way to get around Scooter taxis are the next best way to go from a to b
Always a joy to use and ride an efficient inexpensive and clean public service system Nothing beats it

Relatively new metro system that is not used as much as the Sky Train but still a good option depending on where you want to go Very efficient and superbly clean Definitely not so heavily used as the Sky Train Note that the Sky Train Rabbit Card (for multiple travel) is not good for the MRTyou need to buy a separate card or ticket Not very convenient but just be aware of this
One of the million ways to move around the city Used MRT thrice during our 10 day stay in Bangkok Very convenient service BTS tickets not valid on this system
Used the MRT a lotIt was clean and and fast with good connectionsWas never too crowded like the Sky train

reviewTitle: The best way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: It is unbelievable the efficiency and accessibility of this mode of transport Board it on the outskirts and out one pops in the center of the city like magic Clean fast efficient and reasonably cheap (much cheaper than a taxi for sure) this is the best way to get around Bangkok city Have been using this for more than a couple of years during my visits and I can say with authority that the service has remained true in terms of efficiency punctuality cleanliness and simplicity
Easy to use simple to understand fast cheap clean safe  what more can i say  We used this and the Skytrain all the time fantastic way to get around a busy city very fast and efficiently

The MRT subway is Bangkok's underground companion to the BTS Skytrain and it is a welcome addition The two systems complement each other and the MRT goes some places that BTS doesn't (and vice versa) The trains are fast and efficient and the stations are spotless and easy to navigate with highly reasonable fares There's some overlap with BTS but MRT is best for some destinations such as Chatuchak Weekend Market with the subway train delivering passengers right inside the market via Kamphaeng Phet station

reviewTitle: Very easy and convenient way to get around
reviewText: MRT is a cheap and convenient way to travel around Bangkok Actually because we visited during the coronation it was free travel for 2 days You cannot get cheaper than that  The MRT (underground) carriages are quite wide but it gets very busy We were packed in like sardines and not everyone got on At least it is air conditioned   You do get mobile signal which is very convenient because I was able to google my next intended destination whist travelling

reviewTitle: Good for travel to short distance
reviewText: Remember to carry exact change instructions are pretty clear for new comers  They ferry you to practically all places in Bangkok at reasonable rates  Aircon and cleanliness is good inside coaches  frequency of one every 10 mine unless you are traveling very late night Again traveling in a group of four for late night is recommended you may be approached by people soliciting business and important that you handle using the right verbiage

reviewTitle: Mrt cheap and easy to use
reviewText: The MRT is a cheap and easy transport option Easy to use Their are manned ticket booths so you dont have to use machines which we found much easier

reviewTitle: MRT,  BTS, Airport RailLink - all big importace
reviewText: The best way of traveling around bangkok is using those 3 public transportation ways and at the closest point to the destination change to taxi  Tuktuk or motorcycle (if you have the guts)

reviewTitle: Convenient mean of travelling within BKK!
reviewText: It‚Äôs punctual You can plan your daily schedule well by travelling with MRT   It‚Äôs going to be extended to greater BKK in several monthsI‚Äôm really looking forward to travel to more important places via MRT   Some of the new stations‚Äô appearance are spectacular I‚Äôd love to see the real station

reviewTitle: Efficient and a great way to get around
reviewText: Always efficient easy to navigate not expensive and clean We always travel via MRT on our visits to Bangkok No need to sit in traffic or look for parking

reviewTitle: Seniors Travel for half price on Bangkok MRT
reviewText: If you are aged 60 and over did you know that you can travel on any MRT or SKYTRAIN for half price No one will tell you at the ticket office but this a fact and we‚Äôve been using it throughout our stay in Bangkok it‚Äôs nice to get something a bit cheaper Even if it‚Äôs only a few Thai Baht
Unlike many underground trains this one is a great way of transportation in Bangkok and it stands out by being very clean and esthetic
Between using MRT and BTS getting around Bangkok is way quicker than being stuck in traffic Get route information and your ready to move about the city
Surprisingly  clean and punctual transportation in such a huge city People are nice and helpful if you ask for advice on how to reach someplace

reviewTitle: GOOD IN THIS BIG CITY - BUT ACCEPTS PRIMARILY CASH(NO CARDS)
reviewText: Like any big city this is a valuable way to get around but overwhelming with large number of stations with challengingly similiar names     I was surprized to find that most tickettoken machines DO NOT TAKE CREDIT CARDS   So try to arrive with BAHT small bills(100 or smaller) or coinage otherwise you will have to wait in lines just to get change  Another observation was that once you select a fare option and pay you will get your change PLUS A BLACK PLASTIC TOKEN   Whereas in most other cities you would get a paper ticket  At the ENTRY turnstile take the BLACK PLASTIC TOKEN and hold it over the display screen on the turnstile  At the EXIT turnstile deposit the token into the slot to exit  So again be sure to  grab your change AND black plastic token  ONE IMPORTANT SIDE NOTE   En route to a site I found that there are pocketsareas of the city that are not closeconvient to stations   So i reccomend you plan ahead as it may be prudent to go to a station and grab a cab to your destination otherwise it may involve some considerable walking
We took the train couple of times to go around but found it to be expensive for short travel However it was still much cheaper than tuktuks

reviewTitle: One of the best rapid transport systems in Bangkok
reviewText: Travelling around Bangkok by car makes me suffer  Travelling by MRT let you reach out to nice places not covered by the BTS and keep away from traffic jams

reviewTitle: A must to get round Bangkok
reviewText: We used the MRT many times during our stay in Bangkok  It was easy to use and very cheap  Staff were friendly and tickets easy purchased via ticket machines

There seems to be insufficient cars every time because the train is perpetually packed I stayed 3 days in Bangkok & has never had a chance to get a seat Always have to push my way in & end up at the edge near the door

Not sure if it is due to timing or just our luck the MRT is almost empty but no many seat are available as the train cabins are more for standing spaces Easy to get around thou did not know about it until skytrain office brought to our attention
We have used this service many times and would definitely recommend travels use it Fast efficient and easy
This mrt kinda like subway much better than bts and arport link not much people clean big space and definitly not packed

MRT is operated from Chatuchack park station to Hualumpong station in Chinatown The subway railway provides easy access to must see destinations in Bangkok and connects to BTS Sky Train and Airport Rail link as well Trains are operated on time and provide good transportation mode for tourists in Bangkok
It's one of the best way to commute in Bangkok It helps save a lot of time as one avoids the traffic jams

reviewTitle: excellent and so easy to use
reviewText: Excellent and so easy to use clean spotless and good value for money far exceeds london and other city service with sky train makes travel so easy
what can I say its a subway but its certainlty a great way to move about the city its clean cool and will get you to your destination quicky and safley

I used to use BTS every day I lived in Bangkok for the better part of eight years BTS was the quickest and cheapest way to get around town and avoid rush hour traffic Getting a seat can sometimes be a problem but you have to persevere and keep your eyes open and you will get a place at least for part of your trip As an older man however I found young people most often unwilling to give their seats to an elderly passenger especially if they are Caucasian

The MRT is essentially a mainly underground rail network throughout Bangkok and Metro Bangkok in contrast to the Sky Train or BTS which is essentially above ground The MRT network is being extended considerably to bring in more outlying areas which at present are plagued with traffic jams getting into work from 5 am onwards  That in turn will help to raise the value of properties in those areas
when you need to go somewhere the skytrain doesn't the MRT might get you there Only needed it a couple of times but very handy

Getting around in Bangkok in a car is such a pain especially during peak hours MRT definitely saves a lot of time and is cheap The trains are very clean and it‚Äôs quite quick to get to places Would definitely recommend

From Chatuchak weekend market to the old Hualamphong  railway station close to Chinatown the metro forms a big loop connecting 3 times with the skytrain track The journey can be quite crowded nobody feels obliged to give a seat for any reason the air conditioning is too cold for summer clothing Buy a token for single journey the Rabbit card doesn't work here
I also said this with the BTS and the Airport Rail Link Bangkoks rail systems are very fast reliable and very cheap you can get anywhere in the city in very little time
The underground version of the Sky train going to differing places  Easy to use and even gave us a senior discount without asking Gr8

This is a must if you are visiting Bangkok  It's cheap and avoids the CLUSTER of traffic that is at all hours   What should be a 15 minute drive is often 3045    The train is consistent and very frequentI'd recommend it over other modes if it's an option

reviewTitle: The only way to travel round Singapore
reviewText: It is a pleasure travelling on the MRT if only to escape the high humidity in the City The MRT is incredibly clean cool and efficient but do expect long walking distances when interchanging between lines  You can travel preactically anywhere for S$150 including to and from the airport  Tips  don‚Äôt buy a ticket book from the Seven 11s  don‚Äôt buy the three day S$39 tourist pass from the i  Do buy the S$20 three day pass (we made it pay on Day 1) from the selected ticket offices in the MRT stations (there is one at the airport station)
Subway Train is a popular vehicle to travel in short time against traffic jam on the roads Travelers will get happier and feel safety with valuable time and reasonable price

reviewTitle: Excellent transport service, clean and on time.
reviewText: The MRT and BTs in Bangkok are world class transport systems excellent and immacutely clean and on time in their performance
It was so clean I was very impressed Easy to get everywhere in Bangkok and avoid traffic I liked it very much and saved alot of time

My plan was to buy an MRT adult card  it was easy just line up in the information window in the MRT station and buy one BUT because on day1 I decided to just buy a point to point ticket I felt I lost that opportunity to buy the card since I won't be able to use the whole amount Buying point to point was very easy since the ticket machines accepted bills and coins (BTS machines coins only) the line to buy the tickets were sometimes long (In Siam Station) but it was fast moving Next time I'll definitely buy the adult card Note on the cards There is a separate card for MRT and BTS systems
More extensive in areas covered than the skytrain the MRT is easy to use (once you understand it) We used it several times without any issues at all
I find that the MRT is very easy to use It can get you to so many places in the city very quickly and very cheap too

reviewTitle: Good and easy way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: Good service Basically in time Train every 510 min  Easy to buy tickets at the display in English language  Very cheap

reviewTitle: An excellent way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: There is a good service and as there are platforms enclosed with doors the stations are air conditioned (a very good feature in steamy Bangkok

reviewTitle: Queue is shorter at manned counter
reviewText: If there is a long queue of tourists at the automated ticket machine proceed to the manned queue The tourists will struggle with the instructions on the machine and the machine often rejects coins and notes You are better off queueing at the manned counter where the staff is faster at selling the ticket token

reviewTitle: Grand Palace Visit by MRT on August 2019
reviewText: MRT Blue Line is the best tourism transportation in Bangkok Metropolitan passing Hua Lamphong Railways Station & Chinatown CBDs Chatuchak Market and Ratchada Train Night Market   Waiting for the extension to Grand Palace District at Sanamchai Station on August 2019 Avoid traffic jam and scam taxi

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: The MRT (subway) is a great way to avoid the notorious Bangkok traffic  Between the BTS and the MRT you get around much of inner Bangkok

The Bangkok MRT along with the BTS Skytrain and Airport Rail Link make up Bangkok's attempt to alleviate its horrendous traffic problems So far its extent is limited The trains are quick and smooth but crowded Lots of standing room at the expense of seating But these are three separate systems Ticketing is incompatible To get from Hua Lumpong to Ratchaprarop I had to use all three systems This involved standing in line for three different tickets Maybe a stored value card would avoid this Even the interchange stations have a different name on each line How could they make such a dog's breakfast of a system Why didn't the government knock some heads together and squash these ego problems

reviewTitle: favorite way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: We like MRT better than BTS as it is less crowded and way more organized The price is also not expensive compared to BTS But MRT is closed earlier than BTS though

What a great way to get around the capital if you can push your way into the crowded cabins Not sure why is has to be so cold in there but for certain this is the way to go to avoid the terrible bangkok traffic grid locks

Taxis can get stuck in Bangkok traffic at most times of the day After 9pm is ok but for all other journeys I would seek out a route using the Skytrain Get as near as you can to your destination and only then grab a cab Very cheap air conditioned convenient transportation

From the USA and it was super easy to use the sky train  figure out where you are going go up to the window and buy your ticket get on and go  Maps in the train make it easy to know when to get off  very clean and safe feeling

reviewTitle: Comodo e veloce!! Convenient and fast!!
reviewText: Abbiamo preso solo una volta la metropolitana per andare a chinatown (perch√© bene o male la maggior parte delle cose che abbiamo visto noi erano sulla linea dello skytrain) comodaveloce e pulita Sono un‚Äôappunto quanto siamo andati noi per fare i biglietti (alle ticket machine) ci abbiamo messo un sacco c‚Äôera una sacco di codaidem per i biglietti da fare alla biglietteria avremo trovato l‚Äôorario sbagliato Una cosa portatevi una felpa perch√© fa veramente freddo dentro la metrocio√® lo sbalzo termico tra fuori e dentro √® veramente tantoüòÖ  We took the subway only once to go to chinatown (because good or bad most of the things we saw were on the skytrain line) convenient fast and clean  I'm a note how we went to make tickets (ticket machine) we put a lot there was a lot of queueidem for tickets to do at the ticket office  we will have found the wrong time  One thing to bring a sweatshirt because it's really cold inside the meter  that is the thermal difference between outside and inside is really so  üòÖ
I love MRT much more than BTS personally No ugly structure on the ground Not hot too But limited destination due to infrastructure plan Very fast but can be crowded during rush hours

reviewTitle: can only reach limited tourist attraction
reviewText: forget about MRT I only use once in my a month stay in Bangkok BTS most of the time you have to buy separate ticket for BTS and MRT

The MRT meets the BKS at the Asoke station Both are wonderful means of transportation Nicely air conditioned and trains quite often this subway handles a lot of people Clean and dependable with fair prices

Bangkok's subway is a very convenient means of transportation where taxis spend hours in traffic jam Very clean sometimes very crowded The followed other cities' example taking seats out of the cars to squeeze more people in Anyhow I wouldn't want to miss it
Bangkoks underground system is not very large but the trains run on time everything is well organised air conditioned and clean

reviewTitle: The Bangkok "underground" is about to blossom
reviewText: The Bangkok underground the MRT is about to blossom with lines being finished new stations springing up and new rolling stock in the near future The existing trans provide the most rapid transport around the areas served already  a very civilised way to travel the trains and the stations are kept spotless and some of the stations are huge having been built to accommodate the future travellers in comfortIt takes about 2 years to build a train set and while some overcrowding is now being experienced the MRT commuter can soon expect some relief One of the quirky things about the MRT is that passengers of any nationality aged over 60 years can travel at half price all that is required is to show you passport when buying a stored value ticket Through 201920 a total of 4 lines will be completed making commuting easier Step on board and experience Bangkok's hidden gem

In conjunction with the BTS (skytrain) the MRT is a great way to get around Bangkok without getting caught in the often standstill congestion The trains comes often so even if you encounter one that's too crowded during rush hour you'll only have to wait a few minutes for the next one Buying a ticket is easy too   There are multiple MRT expansions and new lines being built so this system will only get more useful
A very useful transport system that is so easy to use and get you to your destination without the need to sit in a traffic jam

Need to get back to my Hotel at Sutthisan I took a ride on the MRT  from one of the mall Much more comfort faster and safer Considering I took an early taxi ride which took me 2 hours to reach due to traffic congestion

Clean and efficient However if you travel during peak times you may have to wait for 23 trains before you can squeeze onto one and it will be absolutely packed The saving grace is the incredible politeness of the Thai people Orderly queuing to get on the train and no pushing to jump ahead If you have luggage I would not recommend trying to use this service during the morning or evening busy times

reviewTitle: Reasonably useful, again crowded had to stay on platform as some MRTs were too full.
reviewText: Very crowded stations not actually near what their name suggests The Siam Cultural Centre for instance was a 20 minute walk from the station of the same name Lots of stairs need more escalators and lifts for anyone's use not just wheelchairs and a station assistants permission

reviewTitle: know your route! great alternative to BTS
reviewText: the mrt in bangkok is excellent if you know your routein the sukhumvit area which i will address as this is where most people are oriented runs in a general direction of the bts but offers stops that may be closer to an attraction of area that you wish to visitalso the mrt may be the faster less crowded choice to to areas such as SIAMcheck your mapif you see that the MRT is close to the area that you wish to visit you may want to choose the MRTalsoif you are in bangkok for a few daysget the MRT carddont que up with the locals who tend to buy point to point ticketsthose lines are LONGspend a few baht get the card top it offmuch easier and faster and a great keepsakesame with the BTSget the RABBIT card top it off and go to the automated gates

reviewTitle: Easy to use, fast, reliable, air conditioned!
reviewText: If travelling by public transport in a new city intimidates I am here to tell you to get your tokens and get onto the Bangkok MRT Fast clean air conditioned and so cheap It was a great way to move quickly around the city Staff at the ticket booths speak English there is lots of signage to help you out and the announcements on the train itself are informative Hope this helps

reviewTitle: Ride from Hua Lom Phong to Sukhumvit
reviewText: Had went to Yaowarat via Grab but thinking if its possible to take MRT from there back to our hotel since feeling abit adventurous Having staying in Phrom Phong we took from Hua Lompong to Sukhumvit at 1030PM it was very crowded and the stations wasn't very well maintained overall this is a scary ride haha
MRT is the quickest transport in Bankok It is not cheap but very effective Especially in rush hour It is crowded but effective

try to use mrt around 1720 at ask station nightmare the queues are horrendous trains are not frequent and too short although the platforms are very long trains are ful not even enough aircondition at the stations but the management know that you have no choice so they don't do anything about that unless you dont mind to stand in the traffic jam

I had downloaded a map before leaving and found it very easy to follow  Used the service several times during our stay in Bangkok  Used the service counter and machines to purchase tickets very easily

Cheap clean air conditioned and best of all civilised People que and don't push and pull you its so different from the tube back home If you have to travel around Bangkok its my favourite way to go so much better than getting stuck in traffic for ages

The MTR is an excellent and cheap way to travel in Bangkok What a delight is was to see people wait for those on the train to exit before entering the train very different from my daily elbowing nightmare on the MTR in Hong Kong
Travelling from Silom to the weekend market at Chatuchak this is by far the best way to travel Try it

Good system accept notes in the Vending machine The ticket was a bit strange not a card but a round chip  I advice you to download a map for MRT and BTS first in your phone so you can check which station easily Some stations like Asok (BST) can change to MRT (called Sukumvit)
used everyday of our time while in bangkok looking forward to its further development clean and efficient

Transport is THAILAND is being considered as one of the worst in ASIA every city and even small towns are jammed packed with cars motorbikes tuktukBANGKOK is the worst One can be stucked in the traffic for hours when the actual travel time should be minutes The MRT Transport is one of the most ideal way for both the locals and tourists The MRT serves most of the tourist spots The price is VERY Economical The carriage is aircon and NO TRAFFIC JAM STRONGLY RECOMMEND this MRT to all visitors VISITING BANGKOK

reviewTitle: It's much better than the BTS!
reviewText: The BTS management should take lessons from the MRT The cars are longer and wider thus much more comfortable And there are discount cards available for senior foreigners as is not the case with the shoddy BTS

Excellent comparable to ‚Äì¬†or even nicer (because it is so new) ‚Äì than the Singapore MRT system Professional staff and well run system entirely easy to get around on it even for first timers Future extensions to the existing system are much anticipated

The MRT  in Bangkok is an alternative to the BTS Sky train service and reaches out more extensively into Metro Bangkok  Mostly underground it is now expanding rapidly with new engineering works to the environs of BKK and will not only help commuters but will of course push up property prices too   Winwin situation except for impecunious first time buyers

btsÎäî Ïπ¥Îìú Ïù∏Îç∞ mrtÎäî ÎèôÍ∑∏ÎûÄ ÌÜ†ÌÅ∞Ïù¥ Ìã∞ÏºìÏù¥ÏóêÏöî btsÏôÄ Ïù¥Ïö©Î∞©Î≤ï ÎòëÍ∞ôÏäµÎãàÎã§ ÌÉùÏãúÎ≥¥Îã§ mrt Ï∂îÏ≤úÌï¥Ïöî Í∏∏ÎßâÌûàÎ©¥ ÌÉùÏãúÎäî ÎÑàÎ¨¥ Ïò§ÎûòÍ±∏Î†§Ïöî Îî∏ÎûèÎ°ØÌååÏù¥ÏïºÏãúÏû•2 mrtÏó≠Ïóê ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§  you can use easily mrt the same as bts I pefer mrt to taxi because of traffic jam Ratchada Rot Fai Night Market is located in Thailand cultural centre mrt station

MRT Bangkok Airport Rail Link  I started my first day of adventure in finding out how to reach Bangkok MRT by checking where the bus station is In short I got Bus #35 straight to Hua Lamphong and noticed it passes by the Chinatown  Upon reaching Hua Lamphong station my curiosity directed me to go to the last of the MRT station to complete its running details  In coming back I got off at Phetchaburi station where Bangkok Airport Rail Link a commuter rail line connecting Suvarnabhumi Airport to Phaya Thai (BTS) station via Makkasan Station  If only earlier I had the idea how to find this Bangkok Airport Rail Link I should have not spent that much and being scammed by the driver of the taxi from the airport If anyone asks me how to use the MRT and the Airport Rail Link I could save them lots of travel budget and time

Clean and efficient But the routes are confusing More English signs at the interchanges will be a big help No one fare or One card for all routes Some use cards some use casino like tokens Do a bit of homework before you travel Proper queue to enter trains Ticket booths attendants are helpful and smiley

Enjoyed our trip on the MRT Very clean stations and train Service excellent Would strongly recommend tourists to  atleast take a rideWith the sort of traffic in Bangkok would be a smart move to travel via MRT

If you use bangkoks MRT it is best to get a travel card so you don‚Äôt have to constantly look for change Once you have it getting around this very gridlocked city becomes easy It cleanefficient and user friendly If you travel out of the rush hours you are sometimes the only one on board

Allows take beats all the traffic the staff were great and very helpful get  a day pass or just a trip ticket all very easy and we managed to trap to all the sites with easy effort and as our hotel was across fro Asok wonderful

Used MRT for travel between Phetchaburi and Si Lom a number of times and found it easy to use (even with a large suitcase) cheap and very reliable Services were every 10 minutes or so starting at 0600 until midnight Station maps are inside and outside the train and there are regular announcements in English of the stops

Just like the BTS Skytrain I got myself a card for the MRT and once again got a senior citizen discount  Between these two services and the ease of interchanging at specified stations I could get practically all over Bangkok quickly easily and cleanly  They are truly a blessing for anyone visiting who plans to be adventurous and do one's own thing like me

reviewTitle: Most reliable way to get around Bangkok in conjunction with the BTS Skytrain
reviewText: Most reliable way to get around Bangkok in conjunction with the BTS Skytrain Covering many locations that the Skytrain does not access it is worth getting an MRT pass as well as your Skytrain pass   Obviously being the underground you do not get the views   Good for around Lumpini and Chatuchak market

reviewTitle: A very clean & efficient public transportation system in BKK
reviewText: Using the subway system in any unknown city can have its challenges but once you ‚Äútake the challenge ‚Äú you will find it a breeze to useThe MRT ( Note The subway not the Skytrain which is called BTS) in Bangkok is clean & usually not that crowded It is not a massive network so one is limited where you can go It is important to study the map ahead of time and best to get s day pass
Cheap and fast public transportation Not difficult to use even I using for the first time Just very busy during the peak hour

For a solo traveler it's easier to explore the city of Bangkok with Grab Bike than using MRT  LRT Time and energy are more efficient Between the costs of using MRT  LRT and Grab are only a small difference of + THB 58
Traffic is nothing but a nightmare in Bangkok  if you can combine walking and using the MRT it will probably be faster than a taxi

reviewTitle: Efficient way to get around Bangkok and connect to BTS/ARL
reviewText: Cheap efficient and clean transportation away from traffic travelling underground to avoid Bangkok's notorius gridlock  Vending machines produce token to insert into turnstile type gates into gates

reviewTitle: The fastest way to explore Bangkok
reviewText: Fast and very reasonable prices For eldery people some times difficult to climb up all the stairs sometimes lifts can be used but not all stations
Everywhere I go I love to use public transportation But here in Bangkok they didnt have a tourist pass like Singapore and Hongkong do So sad as we dont have a special card during the time there

reviewTitle: Safe way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: We always use MRT when we visit Bangkok It's a nice and safe way to get around Both my wife and I are retired and they do have discount for seniors

reviewTitle: This is what public transit should be in every city
reviewText: For a city of 8 million people the MRT and Sky Train systems are what every city should have and are really the only effective way to move about the city without being impacted by traffic congestion  The trains are quiet spacious (even at rush hours) public address and signage systems are excellent climate control is superb and everything works extraordinarily well  We saw no signs of pan handling crime hustling fare evasion or the filth that we encounter daily where we live We live in the San Francisco Bay Area where no public transit system comes anywhere close to the quality of Bangkok's two rail systems  The contrast is striking

reviewTitle: Easy Quick Way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Travelling on the MRT is a easy & quick way of travelling around Bangkok Trains are frequent quick air conditioned and clean they can be crowded at peak times

Bangkok has public transportation figured out  The subway system is a great way to get around The stations all seem to have escalators up and down unlike the Sky Train The cost is very inexpensive and the trains run at a great frequency

reviewTitle: A fast, clean & air conditioned way to travel
reviewText: This is by far the fastest way to travel It is clean & air conditioned (a BIG plus in tropical Bangkok) During rush hour it is often FULL  but the next train will be along in 10 minutes (but it also be full)

We caught a MRT underground train from Sukhimvit () Station to the Chatuchak markets We bought a tickettoken from the office went through the "turnstiles" and waited about 3 minutes for the train to come It wasn't too crowded was quick and simple We got off dropped the token into the exit turnstiles and followed the exit signs If i can do it anyone can Have a go

reviewTitle: Easy and very cheap to use
reviewText: Why bother with any other form of transport the roads are clogged and hot and this transport facility is clean  efficient and air conditioned It's a no brainer
We needed to get to other aid of Bangkok took the MRT to get to underground it was so easy and straightforward  Very civilised way to travel with the locals And cheap
i use this when i was in Bangkok it is very easy to use and helps getting around just like the BTS and the airport link if you need help the staff are very helpful and they will get you on your way

reviewTitle: Life Saver from Bangkok's Terrible traffic
reviewText: using the mrt to travel could be a life saver for you as bangkok has one of the terrible traffic of the world even though all the drivers are disciplined and it's economical too
The best way to travel around Bangkok cheap fast and very safe It‚Äôs also a great way of people watching

The MRT is as the name suggest a rapid transport system easy to use and cheap ( half price for over 60's) We stayed out of town and it cost us 19Bht each to get into the city This does not go into the old parts but it gets you near enough

reviewTitle: Bangkok, if you go anywhere near Asoke, Silom or Chinatown, this is the way!
reviewText: While in Bangkok if you go anywhere near Asoke Silom or Chinatown this is or Chatuchak or many more locations this is definitely the easier way‚Ä¶ very cheap very clean‚Ä¶ And if you are going with let's say a mile from the station anywhere you can take one of the motorcycle drivers with the orange jacket It's working

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Town
reviewText: No fuss way to traverse Bangkok Cheap efficient and connects with BTS canal water taxis and river taxis for even more destinations

reviewTitle: Streamlined and efficient method to get around Bangkok
reviewText: When I stayed at ibis Sathorn hotel this station was the closest and most convenient in the MRT system quick access to other stations clean and directions were easy to follow since it is displayed in both Thai and English Cool cold temperature inside the trains Nowhere near as complex as Paris New York or London underground system
Trains run very frequently so we were waiting for no more than 5 minutes at a time The onboard screen information is very helpful as are most of the ticket sellers

reviewTitle: take the MRT to Chatuchak Market
reviewText: Same system as in Singapore Quiet clean fast efficient safe modern clear So glad that Bangkok has this system  I remember the days before it was builtit has changed Bangkok for the better x 1000

reviewTitle: MRT and BTS are accessible and convenient but their interchange is separate
reviewText: Both MRT and BTS are convenient but please take note that their interchange stations are separate and some need to walk a distance in order to transfer between BTS and MRT and their cards are different too This is the hassle part other than that everything is acceptable
easy to use afforadable and frequent  you may wait a couple of trains at rush hour and be prepared to be stuffed in at such times by the train stuffers but it will get you where you need to go
Very clean and fast way to get to most parts of Bangkok It is a bit more expensive to get around compared with bus and ferry and cannot get to some of the attractions

Similar to the BTS system the MRT is an underground line that crosses the BTS in a couple of places and you get off and change systems The tickets are a separate system It starts at the Chatachuk Market area and goes to the Hua Lamphong station that also serves long distance trains

Very fast transit in Bangkok since traffic snarls are quite common Though a bit costly than the buses but is widely used by locals and tourists alike Very comfortable for the weather since its hot and humid outside
It's super fast and efficient even during rush hour It's kept clean and the air cons are refreshing First world service

The MRT makes getting around Bangkok very easy and inexpensive  It connects with other public transport options like the BTS and river ferries which generally drop you right at a station  It's a great way to get to a general area of Bangkok to skip the traffic and then catch a taxi a short distance to your final destination if it's too hot or your feet aren't up to it

reviewTitle: Good and cheap way to get around
reviewText: Buy single tickets it works out cheaper at the end However like the BTS they are becoming busier and need to add more trains to what they have
Get a MTR guide from your hotel and have them recommend the different lines to travel for your day trips traind are fast and clean but crowded
The MRT in Kuala Lumpur is up to date air conditioned yes clean safe punctual and inexpensive I wish we used the MRT the first day we got here instead of walking and sweating Use the MRT
Great mean of transportation to move around Bangkok ( with the BTS of course) It's always super clean and extremely well maintained cheap and easy to use
we stayed  in Four point by Sheraton next to the station it is so easy for us to take the MRT go for shopping

reviewTitle: Great way to get around most times less busy than the sky train
reviewText: If possible I prefer to use MRT  it can be less packed than the Skytrain ( except at peak times ) very easy to use machines have English language  just buy a token and go

Most tourists travelling to Bangkok have heard of or are familiar with Bangkok's Skytrain  The BTS But if you are not quite so familiar with the MRT  it is definitely worth checking up on Check the route and the stations It can save a lot of time between certain stations ASOK to SILOM for example So fast and not as full as the BTS  outside of rush hour The disadvantages It's a seperate system to the other rail services  the ARL & BTS You need another stored value ticket The stations don't have a direct link or bridge to the shopping malls  unlike the BTS The link between the BTS and the MRT can be a bit awkward I use Phetchaburi Station most of all It links via a walkway to the ARL Station  Makkasan And even with luggage is not too bad (I'm 63) BUT there is a luggage security check at the station entrance Not usually but once in a while I have to open one bag at least So if you plan on being in BKK for a few days it is worth buying a MRT stored value ticket along with your RABBIT card and try the MRT When you return to your home country you can always pas on the MRT ticket to a friend to use if you not planning on a return visit to BKK soon

It is safe you must go through the metal detectors and let you beg be inspected if needed there will be many people depending on the stations thus be mindful of your surrounding A lot of places of interest that you can go to via the train you can refer to the peak and normal times for frequency of train (13 minutes) The train is spacious & clean the guards & staff are helpful if you need any help The stations are located in the middle so be prepared on which exits do you want to go to (left or right)
Public transit is the way to go in Bangkok  MRT and BTS can take you pretty much anywhere in the city  Stops are announced in Thai and English

reviewTitle: More convenient travel option for the elderly than Sky train
