Locals were very friendly and helpful when we hesitated which way to go  Even though it was a busy time people took a moment to help us in two separate times  Safe good travel

Metal detectors and cursory bag inspection on entry a bit of a surprise but nice to know they care Fares seem cheap and you can buy a token for the trip or get something like London's Oyster Card  There are plenty of straps and poles if you don't get a seat at busy times The trains are quite frequent and were not crowded mid morning when I travelled to Hua Lamphong
Cheap fast and very convenient although the network is not very wide It can get very crowded at times
Best was to get to chaktuchak market as you get right into it The MRT IS clean efficient fast n smooth and among the smarter ways to get around Bangkok
Bangkok MRT is very convenient clean and reliable I am always using the MRT every time I visit Bangkok
I traveled on the MRT to Chinatown A very good transport service Easy to navigate easy to buy tickets
if you need to get somewhere fast use the MRT Its dirt cheap and easy to use Everyone station has English speakers

reviewTitle: Rush hour is horrible.  Trains run longer then said every 4minutes
reviewText: and many stations only have 24 entrances and exits  Staff become useless during this time and don't say or do anything just stand there Avoid rush hour
I used this on my most recent trip to Bangkok and it was everywhere and easy to use People are friendly and will help you if you get lost
Another great way to get around Bangkok highly recommended they are very clean and cheap and you can see alot whilst in the train

reviewTitle: Always clean, eonomical, efficient and safe
reviewText: Always clean economical efficient and safe  Unfortunately a limited network and crowded at busy times  a reflection of its success
Good way to get around town easy cheap clean and aircondition Just try to avoid major stations around the hours when workers are coming or going to work Can get very crowded at those times
Vending machin and train station in Thai and Englisha train every 3 minutes Simple to use cheap clean and safe
The MRT as well as the BTS and all Bangkok rapid transit trains are economical clean and safe to use  I have never felt unsafe and the service is very easy to access (handicap accessible as well)

reviewTitle: So simple and cheap to use
reviewText: We use this everyday it's quick cheap and easy to use station names announced in English helps a day pass is the cheapest way for less than¬£5 a adult
nice and clean trains excellent commute systemdo travel all around the city with its sister btswell done
Very crowded during rush hour  Also long que if you don't have prepaid ticket  the service is nice and stations are clean

reviewTitle: Easy to use and connect to other transportaion routes
reviewText: MRT was super clean and easy to use Perfect for getting around the outside of the "main" downtown areas with connection to the river boats and sky train

Uberclean modern fast Trains every few minutes The longest wait we had was six minutes The line is short but they are expanding it Expect to pay about 20 baht a trip You get your ticket from vending machines which are easy to use They do take notes (no credit cards) but only give change in coins Would be better if the MRT system was linked up to the BTS Sky Train ‚ÄúRabbit Card‚Äù but apparently that‚Äôs also in the works A great subway system Don‚Äôt be afraid to use it

I always love to travel by MRT whenever I stay around Rachadaphisek area This is the only option and most of the stations are nearby so whichever hotel you stay there will always be a MRT station around It connects to BTS Sky train at Sukhumvit which makes it easy to go around the tourist hub However avoid travelling around 56 pm towards Bang Sue as trains are very crowded and there are long lines at the platform However commuters are very disciplined and courteous

The MRT was very clean and easy to use It can get very busy and crowded during peak travel times for locals so keep that in mind I felt really safe and had no issues   Notes The MRT uses a "coindisk" system After paying for your trip you recieve a plastic disk Place the disk upon the activation pad which will upon the gate Keep the disk till you get to your destination When leaving your destination station slide disk into coin slot and the gate will open DO NOT THROW AWAY DISK

The Mass Rapid Transit network (MRT) is fast and efficient and serves 18 stations from Hua Lamphong in the South (near Chinatown) to Bang Sue in the north Trains are scheduled for every 57 minutes and connects to the BTS Skytrain at Sukhumvit and Silom stations   One of the MRT Stations Petchaburi Station is very close  to the Makkasan Interchange Station where one can get the Airport Rail link express train to Suvarnabhumi International Airport

Extremely clean and very very frequent Easy to use ticket machines Dont bother trying to learn names of stops as all are numbered with letter and a number So sit or stand close to a screen and its easy Be warned there is no public toilets any station

Well connected with all the attractions Travelling via MRT saves time and money you can meet locals here and see the file well maintained and good fare MRT map is available and you can find the place where to visit and which station to reach don't worry about the change there is a counter where change is available happy ride

The train network in Bangkok is poor and because of that and the many many people it doesn't save a lot of time unless there is too much traffic for taxi (very often it's like this) or if you have to go very far (about 10 stations) You have to stand in line to get a coin ticket and you can't buy a ticket that is good for the skytrain too Those two trains are organized totally independently from each other and can't give you information about the other train There are only I think about two stations that connect those two train networks How stupid is that

The MRT subway system is easy and convenient to use  It intersects the BTS skytrain in a number of places  The largest and most central intersection is probably Asoke Station  It's clean and air conditioned  Most stations have ATMs and convenience stores nearby  There is a metal detector you'll need to pass through but I find the security mostly perfunctory  Most locals just ignore the security if they're passing through with a small purseslingbag  If you carry a large backpack or bag be ready to open it to show the contents of the main compartment  It gets very crowded at rush hour (mornings and late afternoons)  There will be long queues of 15+ people at each egressentry point  Be prepared to be squeezed in tightly if you travel during that time  For first timers who don't speak Thai   Go up to a token machine select English and then select the stop you want  Insert cashcoins  Machine will dispense a dark blue plastic token as well as change (if any is due)  Go to the entry turnstile and touch the blue token to the sensor plate to pass through  Keep the blue token and continue to train waiting area board train and get off at your stop  Upon leaving through the exit turnstile insert the blue token in the coin slot and pass through
The MRT was pretty good  Ran regularly and wasn't overly crowded  There are not many stops and they are quite hard to find when you are above ground

reviewTitle: Very Bad morning and late afternoon
reviewText: Never use MRT before 930am and around 1700pmit's too much crowdedand you have to wait long time
During my stay I take this train every day to the shopping mall Very convient and fast as Bangkok trafic is very bad I recommend every one to use it Its safe and low cost and faster than the Taxi
One takes the MRT on visit to meet friends MRT connects with the Skytrain and is always Prompt clean & safe
One of the best ways to get around Bangkok without being stuck in the traffic jam The trains are very modern and they offer a nice view

Although this line has a limited number of stations it is a reliable and swift way of public transportation throughout (parts of the) city Low rates fast connections Can be crowded during rush hours of course

reviewTitle: My ride to go to work!
reviewText: Convenient to travelling around the city but crowned for rush hour in the morning and evening(after work)
Clean Fast Good for short distance Otherwise if u need to go to the other side of Bangkok it's better to get a taxi

reviewTitle: The same like by the BTS: Get a card, top it up, ride!
reviewText: Here applies the same review I made for the BTS "Thai are practical persons That is why I do not understand why so many of them do not obtain a card for multiple rides instead of queuing up to change money then again queuing up to buy the ticket and that multiple times a day It can be a nightmare during the rush hours I presume that now you visitors know what you have to do Get a card top it up ride There is an additional benefit in buying a travel card you do not have to search for the price of your fare it is automatically detracted from the credit of your card Before you enter a train consult the plan with the route After you get off consult the signs where to exit the station in order to go to your destination Most times your destination is mentioned‚Äù Only here you have one more benefit Children and older persons get the same discount Ask for it at the counter You get it in both by buying a ticket or by obtaining a special multi ride card

reviewTitle: The easiest way to go around bangkok
reviewText: If you are planning to travel in Bangkok MRT (underground) is the easiest transportation to take However you may need to take BTS (sky train) or taxi when travel to some part of Bangkok

Hi folks I've used the BTS in Bangkok each time I've visited mostly because of the convenience of the Rabbit card tag on  tag off system I found the MRT a little different The MRT doesn't use Rabbit  So of the two card based systems are yet to be integrated (They aren't as of the the time of writing this report) I use the MRT from time to time Mostly to get down to Ratchada for the massage services available down there  I take the Sukhumvit MRT and take it to Huay Kwang MRT station  From there it's a short walk to any one of the neon palaces

reviewTitle: A reliable way to get around
reviewText: One can overcome the frustrations of being stuck in traffic by taking the MRT provided the one's starting point and the desired destinations are served by the MRT  Fares are by no means low taking into consideration the cost of living in Bangkok but MRT is the way to go

reviewTitle: Easy to use and better then a tuk tuk or taxi,
reviewText: The MRT will get you to many places fast and reasonably It is overall clean and the staff are happy to guide you if you are not sure where to get off

We used Bangkok city MRT very often during Bangkok stay all passengers guideline with all maps inter exchange link for Sky train and other transport networks are so clear prices are so weorh with the service  one of the best MRT experience
The MRT was accessed by our hotels river taxi and was very easy to use and we were able to go to all the shopping centers we wanted to visit

reviewTitle: Bangkok's MRT is convenient and fast- but sometimes very crowded!
reviewText: If you're in Bangkok and stay in a hotel that is close to the MRT it's a convenient fast way to get to where you want to go (as taxi's have to fight the traffic and Bangkok's traffic is very bad)  But watch out when you take the MRT as peak times are very crowded

it is the fastest and easiest way to commute in Bangkok The routes are pretty simple and instructions are given very clearly The staff is helpful You get food and some shops to buy necessary items inside the stations there are usually two or more exits so make sure to choose your exit based on where you want to go Frequency is good and though it is crowded you can breath and stand

Bangkok is legendary for its traffic and there are times when you are in a taxi and believe you will never get out The traffic lights turn to green but you just don't move them out the way to another few minutes for them to change again  By far the best way around this is to use the MRT where ever possible It's one disadvantage is that you have to use the ticket machine to pay This can be timeconsuming as you need the right change and there are a lot of tourists who are not annoyed with how the machines work  Other than that it is very efficient The trains are regular clean and nicely airconditioned Again they do get very busy but it is infinitely better than trying to use the road network Even if you are going to somewhere not on the sky train network you are best to take it as far as you can and then use a taxi from there
Easy and cheap way to get around in Bangkok correspond with the BTS Skytrain too at some stations Recommended for everybody who wants to avoid the constant traffic jams in downtown Bangkkok

Inexpensive and easy to understand Good form of movement throughout the city We used the MRT to get to the train station which exits just across the street taking our luggage along with us with no problem

reviewTitle: Fast clean and oh so cool
reviewText: This is a great way to get around the city if only to cool down for a few minutes from the heat and humidity The link is a good way of getting to the railway station and the beginning of Chinatown to all the attractions in the Sukhumavit road area all the way down to Silom and Lumpini The stations all have ticket machines of ticket counters for change or tickets the signage is easy to follow and the station guides are very clear to use The security is a little tighter than it used to be since the terrorist attacks on Bangkok in 2015 but this only makes you feel safer There is a security gate you walk through and you may be asked to open your bags as a security officer is on duty at all stations
The MRT is a good way to travel if you are going somewhere in the city that it can be used It's cheap and efficient Along with the BTS is the way to travel in Bangkok

Easily accessible and most importantly map information provided is easy to understand and follow Safe to travel and especially one can avoid the heavy traffic of Bangkok in peak hours The staff is very helpful to foreigners Well maintained in terms of cleanliness  Recommended transport as it is also cheaper than TUK TUK at times )

reviewTitle: one of the worst transportation experiences ever!
reviewText: This was one of the worst transportation experiences ever We were trying to take the train from the airport to the hotel but after wasting 40 minutes standing at the platform without any kind of notification us and hundred of other stranded passengers were finally told that the train won't be coming after all and that we need to leave the platform and we can go and ask for our money back Horrible inefficiency
This is so quick clean and fast MRT doesn't make life just easier it even feel safe to use Bangkok MRT service Good job Thai people

reviewTitle: Good way to travel for city line
reviewText: I spent my trip during bangkok trip this is very good operating you can avoid bangkok traffic during rush hours highly recommend for all tourists

reviewTitle: Best travel type to avoid stuck in traffic!
reviewText: The MRT as as the BTS is the way to move in the city As theer is no integrated ticket system yet  will be launched soon you are required to buy your ticket at the machines which can be a kind of hassle special during rush hours as there are very very long queues to the machines So if you do not mind about some bucks and use the service frequently during your stay get a MRT card  topup amount touch and go Avoid services during rush hours

reviewTitle: Very practicle and easy to go around the town
reviewText: Its like any other MetroMRTTube in the world it is very simple and convinent  They do have a smart card as well they give you the coins( exchange for notes) to buy the ticekts from the machine We enjoyed our journes

A very quick way to move across Bangkok  being single traveler and then using a motor bike taxi at the other end to get to my final destination the trains are regular and save so much time you would other wise be stuck in the horrendous traffic congestion the added bonus of being able to connect with the sky Train is also a bonus  for a small anmount  of  baht  this service is one on the best ways to move around

Bangkok Thailand is really becoming a developed city with the existence of the MRT It is easy and connected to all the destination in the city even foreigner is able to utilize the MRT easily it's really helpful and affordable despite the traffic jam the MRT is really helpful safe fast and easy to access thumb up for the great MRT system in Bangkok Thailand

Took MRT twice during my visit to Or Tor Kor market and Ratchada Train Market the stations are located close to these markets It is used by locals and many of the tourist so during rush hours the crowd is really huge I waited for 6 trains but frequency was very good during the rush hours

reviewTitle: Very Efficient, Modern and CLEAN Subway System
reviewText: My only complaint about this system is the fact that if I want to bring a suitcase it has to be thoroughly inspected  BTS doesn't require it  Otherwise no complaints with how this system is operated and maintained  San Francisco could take some lessons here

reviewTitle: the most transportation we used in bangkok
reviewText: when we stay in bangkok thie fisrt decision for the hotel is is it near BTS or not because this is important also the fare is cheap even for the 45 people if the travel together is cheaper with taxi but when solo travel this is the chosen one
Extremely crowded you need to be comfortable with people well into your personal space VERY efficient tho

MRT is a blessing in Bangkok Getting around the city has never been so convenient and easy Fastest way to travel and reasonable Needless to say one can avoid the infamous traffic of Bangkok in Air Conditioned comfort However best to avoid during peak office hours or you will be crammed in like sardines
Efficient clean and good system and staff so helpful if needed  we used it a lot saves using the roads which can be congested

reviewTitle: An excellent way of getting around.
reviewText: Easy fast hassle free and cheap what more can you ask for It runs NorthSouth mostly and connects to the BTS so you cant really go wrong I stay in Huay kwang and i can be in the centre within 15 minutes Great service and they are quite often too

This very popular means of transport in Bangkok is always overcrowded  But looking at the road traffic conditions in this city skytrain is your only choice  Don't hesitate to get a Day Pass for unlimited rides (USD4) to save you time to line up from single tickets We also use it as "access pass" to walk through  stations from one end to another as short cuts

I took the train from Silom to Sam Yan to visit Ruamkatanyu Foundation (Bangkok) next to Wat Hua Lampong Temple to donate coffin The train is very clean and quiet Only thing is the connecting BTS station to the MRT is quiet a long walk on the overhead bridge weather was pretty hot Otherwise trip is pleasant

Staying near the Thailand Cultural Centre rail station makes this underground form of transport perfect for the tourist A trip to the end of the line at Hua Lamphong rail station which is next to Hua Lamphong Main State Railway Station was only 35 Bhat It connects with the Airport Rail Link at P(h)etchaburi rail station for the half hour train ride to the Suvarnabhumi Airport Modern rail stations with Platform doors and clear English also signage Easy to use English optioned electronic ticket machines or ticket office is your choice Tickets by single trip plastic token or day or multi day passes

reviewTitle: Like the BTS a great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Avoid weekday hours 7am to 10am and 4pm to 7pm when the service is crowded  Combined with BTS Skytrain you can easily and quickly reach many popular destinations in Bangkok

reviewTitle: Great transport in Bangkok highly recommend a visit to Khlong Toei
reviewText: Great transport to avoid traffic in Bangkok I recommend getting off at Khlong Toei station exit 2 turn left and 400 m away is a great local family run Pad Thai shop open for lunch or dinner Best I've had in Bangkok can be found on here Pad Thai Mae Am Also close by another 5 min walk is Khlong Teoi market worth a visit

reviewTitle: Convenience plus a senior discount and luggage storage lockers
reviewText: I find the MRT faster than the elevated BTS less costly and usually less crowded    Seniors including foreigners are eligible for halfoff fares  the BTS only grants discounts to Thai citizens  However you have to queue up for each token no multiple purchases are allowed  I wasn't asked to show any ID despite appearing under 60 years of aged  The Sukhumvit junction gets very crowded at rush hour with waits of up to 20 minutes for a carriage  Nevertheless I chanced it to make the Petachaburi connection to the Airport Railway Link for Suvarnabhumi Airport  You can't use the elevators if you have luggage be sure you can navigate your belongings on and off the escalators  Finally() Bangkok has installed yellow "Lockbox" storage luggage lockers at most BTS and MRT stations  These come in various sizes but only accept 20 and 50 baht bills and dispense no change  Maximum rate is 40 bahthour for the largest locker There aren't a lot of lockers so they can fill up quickly  Nevertheless these are a godsend for travelers who need a temporary storage locker while shopping
When you travel arroud you will see how terrible of it and they never change   In other country in peak time is mess but here is wrong you cannot mange the time here

reviewTitle: Swift, and a great way to avoid Bangkok's traffic congestion
reviewText: The MRT is a very convenient way to get around Bangkok It intersects with the BTS (Skytrain) in a number of stations so between them most places you want to go are covered Both the MRT and the BTS connect with the airport train at different stations

reviewTitle: Great form of transport, just a pity it is not MUCH bigger.
reviewText: The cleanest train system I have ever seen fast and always on time New lines opening soon Good to know that MRT offers a seniors discount while BTS will not  I use the service every week

reviewTitle: Best way to beat the traffic
reviewText: Bangkok traffic is really bad  I take the MRT and Skytraining around the city whenever I can  The people speak good English and are friendly and will tell you how to get to where you want  I loved it

reviewTitle: A very attractive option to escape the infamous traffic jams of Bangkok.
reviewText: Together with the BTS Skytrain light rail (which runs East to West) the fully underground MRT line links the Northern part of the city to the Southern districts Below are my thoughts about this transportation line  The GOOD  *  Tourists can easily buy a stored value ticket at the station ticket office The staff speak fluent English The refundable deposit is THB 80 and the first time purchase cost THB 180 So you would have THB 100 worth of stored value On average the fare for two stations costs about THB 19 one way The stored value ticket expires in 2 years  *  Clear English signage at station entrance concourse and platforms *  Orderly queues at platforms before boarding the train *  Good cleanliness and housekeeping of station and platforms *  Dual language announcements (Thai and English) in the train when a station is reached Also safety announcement on platform gap *  Clean air and environment and ambiance in the station and platform *  Many stations are directly linked to shopping malls  The BAD  *  Train is congested during peak hours *  Bag check and security gantries at all station entrances could be inconvenient if we are in a rush *  Location of underground MRT stations is sometimes not obvious when signage along the road is lacking For example the Sukhumvit station entrance is not obvious for the uninitiated  Overall a winner mode of transport in a gridlocked Bangkok An overall rating of 4 out of 5  Highly recommended for tourists

reviewTitle: Clean but crowded at peak times...
reviewText: If you can avoid peak times (office hours) do it because it can be quite messy and long to board a train but otherwise clean and relatively fast service (less MRT than BTS trains)  MRT cards expire after 2 years (contrary to BTS cards  and so far no combined cards as they are all independent transportation services Airport link has also another card Hope they will create a Bangkok transport card someday that works everywhere) Despite that it is worth it to have a card because even if there is no price incentive it enables people to avoid the queues
Very Safe and get you everywhere you want to go by train or by walking without being one the street itself

At first glance riding the MRT could appear to be a bit of a challenge It was an easy to use transportation system that was clean and fast The token system was a little strange to us but our tour guide from Gate One travel helped us and made it easy

When traveling in Bangkok Thailand  don't forget to check out their underground subway system  Not only is it a clean and safe way to get around Bangkok and the surrounding area  but it is a very inexpensive and enjoyable way to avoid the terrible Bangkok traffic  Any tourist that visits Bangkok will tell you that if they have one big complaint about the city  it is the traffic  During rush hour it is downright horrendous and during nonrush hour times it is simply just terrible Granted the MRT is only one of several ways to get around Bangkok  and it does get quite congested as well Trust me though  the congestion on the MRT is nothing compared to the city streets  Try the MRT you will not be disappointed

reviewTitle: MRT is a the underground subway in Bangkok
reviewText: Best way to move around the city Unlike the BTS wich is elevated the MRT is underground only Very clean an safe unlike many metropols subways All stations are equipped with escalators Very useful to avoid Bangkok's unfamous traffic especially at peak hours

reviewTitle: Good way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Clean and cheap Serves mainly the Central Business District  which can get very bad during peak hours

reviewTitle: Fast, frequent, inexpensive and easy to use.
reviewText: The MRT subway system is fast frequent inexpensive and easy to use Yes at peak hours it's crazy crowded and busy so try to avoid those times All stations have great signage making it easy to navigate and there are both self serve tickettoken machines and manned tickettoken kiosks The MRT has connections to the BTS skyway at Silom [BTS Sala Daeng] Asok [BTS Sukhumvit] and Chatuchak Park [BTS Mo Chit] There is a connection at Petchaburi for the Airport Link line Makkasan station and at Hua Lamphong station you can take the underground walkway to Bangkok railway station also known as Hua Lamphong for Northern line Northeastern line Eastern line and Southern line trains The MRT subway used in conjunction with BTS skyway and the Airport rail link delivers the fastest way to get from A to B in BKK
Since in my country this kind of transportation still on the making me and my friend try this and we look amazed

reviewTitle: Made sure we rode on the MRT
reviewText: Excellant and fast and it needs to be to cater for the thousands of people who ride the MRT on a daily basis

reviewTitle: good efficient safe travel in BKK
reviewText: used this quite a lot to get to places not covered by BTS   always seemed to be on time  cheap way to travel if you get a day pass

the MRT is an underground line but for an 'experience' try (or best not to ) an evening rush hour We got on at Sukhumvit (the interchange with the Asok BTS) and what an experience  It was 630pm  Lines of hundreds to get a small black token from either the machines or counters to then a massive amount of more lines downstairs on the platforms We waited for 9 trains before we were able to be squeezed onboard yes9 trains Trains arrived every 4 mins More carriages and frequency are urged needed  It's a pity that the same BTS Rabbit card can't be used on MRT

reviewTitle: Subway and skytrain are connected at Taopoon station, more convenience !
reviewText: This subway used to start from Bangsue to Hualumpong on the other end Right now it is extended from Bangsue station to Taopoon station which you can connected to skytrain purple line to Bangyai on the 4th floor platform You don't have to change train at Bangsue station to go to Hualampong if you are travelling from Taopoon station likewise if you are trabelling from Hualumpong towards Bangsue you don't have to change train to go yo Taopoon This is very convinience But they are getting popular among commutor if you are using are train at rush hour you may have to wait for the secod train or even the third one to get a seat though you are getting on the first station of the route MRT prepaid card can be used at Taopoon station for a blue line subway ride but I don't know about the purple line

reviewTitle: Clean, efficient & quick way to get around the MRT line's stations
reviewText: Took the MRT to Chatuchak weekend market instead of the BTS Tokens can be purchased via machines which you can select English if you can't understand Thai Touchscreen machines ‚Äì easy to use Train is modern clean not much waiting very stable can be a TINY little bit crowded on Saturday but nothing like the sardinekind of crowds you get during Singapore's peak hours on trains Most importantly you skip the constantly choked road traffic in Bangkok There are announcements in Thai and English before reaching each stop Very efficient way to get around if you're situated along this MRT line

MRT and BTS interchanges make this mode of mass transportation a must in Bangkok  Very convenient  Beats the heat  Give yourself plenty of time and avoid rush hour foot traffic  Best way to travel if you don't have your own car and probably the best even if you DO have a car  No need to find a parking space

reviewTitle: Limited area but links with skytrain and buses.
reviewText: The MRT is the subway or tube in Bangkok  It's very nice  At this point it basically only serves the Central Business district but it links well with other mass transit including the vast reach of the BST or skytrain system  One can get around quite easily in air conditioned comfort using mass transit in Bangkok  If you don't prefer walking to your final destination there are always car and motorcycle taxis available  Tuk Tuks are available at the tourist spots  I recommend them but you will be taken to shopping spots  Spend ten minutes in the store and the driver gets fuel credit  They usually charge less than a USD for 2 hours  If you just want to go somewhere ask for the "no shopping price"

Its a beautiful infrastructure Superclean and fully airconditioned TV screens show how many minutes to wait Token dispenser machines in thai and english that work At rush hours you might have lineups at the train doors But all very orderly Fares from 18 b for 1 2 station journey Up to 50 baht for long journeys If two people it will cost same as taxi But still worth it as you will bypass the traffic Runs from Hualumohong train station round the central area of city up to Tha Poon across the chao phrya river from Bang Sue

reviewTitle: Confusing route but it was a good choice.
reviewText: first time I use this public transportation and for me it was confusing me especially about the route after you done with your destinantion we should walk quite far to go up

Very convenient way to travel Bangkok although if it's 1 stop away I'd rather walk the streets as the stations are not too far apart Efficient and cost about 25 to 45 baht per journey   Downside unlike train systems in other countries when you switch from BTS to MRT you have to purchase a separate ticket   Note Do try other forms of transport if you wish to see more of bangkok as the MRT runs underground
Easy access to most of the Central Business District without the traffic chaos of the road system Very efficient and cheap travel
MTR is also a convenient way to travel in Bangkok you might as well try the sky train  to get around

reviewTitle: Effortless and easy transport to anywhere within BKK
reviewText: Absolutely love traveling throughout BKK with the MRT Its easy and all staff on the platforms are helpful and assist you if you get a little lost
I rode MRT at night on my way to BKK airport It was not crowded Very safe It is very easy to buy ticket
We have used MR T for a long time taking private travelers to and fro the airport and using the mini  bus transferring golf groups to Pattaya His vehicles are clean and well driven Never any hickups
Better choice in Bangkok along with BTS Clean and convenient Definitely better choice than other means of transportation such as Bangkok Taxi

Most westerners usually experience the BTS system when first getting around Bangkok and the BTS is world class as well  Having lived in Bangkok for nearly 4 years I now travel more on the MRT lines and must say I prefer them a little more than BTS   Both are totally safe clean and efficient with rare and minimal delays  Even during peak travel times when people are going to or leaving work is ok but be prepared for maybe a 10 minute wait (a few trains worth) and get crammed in during peak times  i actually enjoy peak time hehehe  Thais operate these travel system very well
used the MRT every day and it was regular convenient and clean  Unfortunately not many stations have liftsescalators and I had a hip injury so going updown the stairs was difficult

reviewTitle: Clean, Quick, Easy to Use Transport Bangkok
reviewText: Used many times to get to some places going in a taxi or other transport is just pot luck with traffic or ends up costing way too much MRT is easy to use on time cheap to get to the further out places in Bangkok and nice and cool inside )

The MRT is extremely to use to navigate around Bangkok   The signs are in Thai and English so getting on the right line is easy The trains come approximately every 10 mins so if you miss one there's another on the way

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: I always stay near an MRT or BTS station because apart from river transport they are by far the best way to get around in Bangkok

reviewTitle: Another Cool Mass Transit Alternative in Bangkok
reviewText: BTS Skytrain doesn't go where you need to go The MRT is just as good Clean inexpensive frequent service and most importantly good working ACs
Another adequate form of transportation between the MRT BTS and the boats you should be able to get to most anything
Where BTS goes above from you head MTR goes from below your feet Nice connectivity overall in Bangkok

An easy system to use and not expensive Surprisingly clean Great way to get around though as others have noted not as good as the Sky train system You rarely have to wait unlike in some European cities Maps are easy to read

reviewTitle: Clean, Safe and Efficient - Beware Rush Hours
reviewText: Compared to many countries  HK S Korea Bangkok subway system is very clean and safe and air conditioned  The ticket machines accepts bank notes so it's easier than the sky train which only accepts coins  All signage is in English and there are maps detailing exits  Very easy and helpful for tourisms  Staff there speak a level of english as well  Beware the rush hours  Asoke Rama 9 stations are extremely crowded

reviewTitle: I use it all the time when I'm in Bangkok!
reviewText: You never wait more than a few minutes for a train  They're spotlessly clean run to Swiss efficiency  no need for a car when you're in Bangkok

reviewTitle: Gets you where you want to go
reviewText: Excellent train service gets you around Bangkok but it is very crowdedWherever you are going buy a one day pass only 150bht and it saves queing up

it was a good way to reach siam niramit show throw the MRT  reasonable price in thailand standards ( though for Egyptian it was very expensive as MRT in Egypt is much cheaper ) any way it has good facility  easy access  and did the job well  recommened

We used the MRT to travel from Hua Lamphong (chinatown) to the Saturday market on the other side of the city The trip of 15 stops cost a very small amount of THB and took about 30 minutes so it's also a very efficient way to travel We also liked the experience  compared to the London underground it was a very calm trip with people giving space to others talking in hushed tones and sharing friendly smiles The system operates on tokens that you buy and place in the turnstiles when you reach your destination due to this you can't buy a return 'ticket' but it's really not a hassle

reviewTitle: Easy to use, clean. Definitely use if you can. Taxi's can take a long time.
reviewText: We used it to get to Terminal 21 really easy And cheap Clean Safe too Easy to buy tickets at the station

reviewTitle: It would be great if they ...
reviewText: I have been using this facility since I live in Bangkok I have seen many change (new station new line etc) and I wish they will connect blue line & purple line together in to one line It would be easier for people who leave out of town using the facility (no need to go down the station and grab a bus for blue line station)  Service team are nice especially the one on purple line
It is a great metro system of Bangkok which offer a convenient travel for all traverlers We used it for visiting across Bangkok city with very low cost if comparing to the cap there

reviewTitle: The less useful metro system of Bangkok
reviewText: The MRT system is very high quality and very comfortable  but unfortunately it's the less useful one compared to the BTS SkyTrain which just happens to run through the more interesting parts of the city But of course if the place you're going to is covered by the MRT line this is your best way to get there  no traffic jams no sun and heat  just speed and comfort

reviewTitle: No views, but equally as good as BTS
reviewText: The MRT train doesn't stop at all (or most I guess) of the major shopping complexes like the BTS skytrain but does stops at places where the BTS doesn't  eg QSNCC Obviously you shouldn't expect any views though Ironically the windows seem bigger than of BTS trains

reviewTitle: try to stay away in rush hours
reviewText: not enough capacity at peak times can be useful to get closer to your destination then get a taxi saves sitting in traffic

The public transport services in Bangkok is indeed very efficient clean and on time too MRT will help you beat the traffic and saves you tonnes of time in your daily commute to work and shopping The network is not so extensive yet but it will bring you to majority of the main places around Bangkok

reviewTitle: Great way to get around the city
reviewText: Given the traffic in Bangkok this is a quick and inexpensive way to travel  The train runs every few minutes and tickets are easily purchased at the stations  The trains have good maps that indicate stations so it is easy to use
Along with BTS this is a convenient and reliable ground transportation system The fare is reasonable The trains and the stations are clean A thumb up for Bangkok
Travelled locally by MRTsuperb service staff budgeted and clean Will recommend everyone to travel by MRT
Great way to get around clean and safe and very cheap I wish it went 24 hours but that is a small concern
The MRT is not extensive but works very well Definitely beats rushhour traffic  it will save a ton of time

reviewTitle: Economical way to go around Bangkok
reviewText: Economical Fast and Reliable we found the MRT to be one of the best and cheapest ways of travelling in Bangkok We learnt it the hard way when we were stuck on the roads in traffic jam and realized we are close to an MRT station So we just hopped in and got to our destination in no time (at a ridiculously cheap fare compared to a Taxi) You must consider this when traveling distant place in Bangkok and even while traveling to the Don Meong Airport (get half way there to the Chatuchak Park MRT station from where you can get a cheap AC Shuttle Bus  A2 I think  costing just 30 THB per personto get to the Airport really fast  see my post on getting to Don Meung Airport for more details) or for going to Suvarnabhoomi International Airport (get to the Phetchaburi MRT Station from where there is a direct and reasonably priced Airport Express Train)  For going to Chatuchak Weekend market  get off at Khamphaen Phet MRT Station which is in the heart of the Market itself
This is sure the best was to travel across the city but unfortunately does not cover a lot of places in Bangkok

reviewTitle: A Major Component Of How I Beat Bangkok's Infamous Traffic Jams
reviewText: I am a lifetime resident of Bangkok I love this vibrant city but I (like all rational people) absolutely hate its horrendous traffic jams Which is why I do not drive in the city any more In fact I avoid road transportation (eg taxis and buses) as much as I possibly can  not totally avoidable but taken as last option Rather I resort to alternative travel routes such as rail transits (MRT BTS and Airport Rail Link) and canalriver ferries (Saen Saep Boat Service Chao Phraya Express Boat)  MRT currently has two lines The Blue Line (the original line) runs in a semicircle around the perimetre of the inner city and the Purple Line (opened in 2016) runs from one end of the Blue Line to the northwestern suburb area of Bangkok MRT and BTS jointly serve Bangkok very well and can get passengers to almost all commercial and residential areas of the inner city The two systems has three convenient interchanges However their ticketing systems are separate which can be quite confusing especially if you purchase a single fare for each time you use a train The best way to overcome this confusion is to purchase a storedvalue card (available for both MRT and BTS) that you can reuse and topup as needed  I am not sure but I think that you can return the card for a refund on the amount not used I have been told that MRT and BTS fares are quite expensive compared to those of other countries but compared to the amount of your precious time saved from having to sit in the road traffic it is more than worth it   Station design of MRT comply quite closely with  the "universal design" concept (although not quite 100%) and so is reasonably friendly to the physically challenges This is not so with BTS While BTS management has put in some efforts and investments to eliminate this shortfall but much more need to be done   Up until 2017 BTS and MRT serve primarily Bangkok's inner city but several more lines reaching out to the outlying areas are scheduled to be completed within the next two to three years
One way of transportation in Bangkok Cheap and Affordable Cooler safer and convenient )  Compared to BTS stations are cleaner and cooler )

reviewTitle: great way to get around BKK
reviewText: I live in Chonburi and I never drive into BKK  I take the bus and then take the skytrain (MRT) and it goes just about anyplace I need to be in BKK  I look down and smile to myself as the traffic is stopped and we are zipping along A wonderful and fast way to get around this big city

reviewTitle: MRT - convenient subway system for tourists
reviewText: From Hua Lamphong we utilized the MRT to travel to Huai Khwang  to visit the night market The Huai Khwang MRT exit is located opposite the said market where the branch of Somboon restaurant where the former prime minister of Japan dined is located

reviewTitle: I'd ride it more often if it ran to where I was going
reviewText: First off I don't ride on the MRT very often because it just doesn't run to places I want to visit Having said that I appreciate getting a 50% reduction on all fares due to my age trains are pretty fast and smooth but the air is kept a little too cold for my taste Stations are well organized and clean Transfers to the SkyTrain are convenient I hope they extend it in the future

reviewTitle: One of the best thing in Bangkok
reviewText: MRT is my favourite for travelling in Bangkok because of its accommodating and facilities for the traveler rather than other public transportation  All MRT stations have lift and escalator so that traveler with luggage and heavy stuffs can travel travel without any problem Also it's connected to Airport Link therefore most of the tourist can access Suvarnabhumi International Airport easilyspeedy without costly  MRT platform system also convenient to roll the suitcase and other stuffs rather than other I think it is faster and cheaper than sky train perhaps
Too bad the service is poorly spread even in the city Still a great way to travel Tickets are issued by machine machines accept coins only Counters are there to change your paper money to coins

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: If the MRT goes where you want to go it can't be beat The only downside is limited destinations Hopefully they will expand the routes in the future It is clean generally uncrowded and fast
The best way to beat the BKK traffic is to make the most of the the MRT and BTS Once you get used to the different lines it is the easiest way of transporting in BKK
I once lived in New York where the subway system is old smelly and unreliable MRT is the total opposite new clean and reliable

reviewTitle: Limited coverage but more spacious and cheaper
reviewText: The difference between BTS and MRT is that MRT runs underground And there is one line It has 18 stations and stretches for 20 km in a horseshoe shape from Hua Lamphong in the South (near Chinatown) to Bang Sue in the north Trains arrive every 57 minutes and connect to the BTS Skytrain at Sukhumvit and Silom stations So that mean you can't get lost taking the MRT just alight and hop over the opposite line you took the wrong line
This was a very good service We felt safe the travel was quick and easy  and the underground service was very clean and good looking Not expensive

reviewTitle: cheap, fast, it just needs a better network
reviewText: What can you say about a subway  Ticket vending machines are in English and are easy to understand if you know where your're going  Great transportation means I just wish it also reached into the old town
Average MRT system but often crowded Should put in more trains during peak hours Install elevators and escalators for the elderly and handicapped passengers
Most efficient way to get around the city at a low cost  Nearest station was close to my hotel and took me directly to the MBK department store
Great way of getting around The stations are clean and the trains cheap quick and easy to use Much better than taxi or tuktuk for the main districts

Very easy to navigate once you figure out where you want to go and where you currently are Have change or smaller bills ready to purchase the oneway chips The chip is your ticket You select your stop at the ticket machine pay the rate and a chip is dispensed You place the chip on the marker above the entrance gate and it opens and at your final destination you drop the chip in the slot and the gate opens Great to use during high traffic time as you can be stuck in a cab for extended amount of time There will be more people using the MRT but it will still be faster
Good way to travel around bangkok city Reasonable ticket price and very comfortable ride Good sign for tourist
its best of best way to travel in bangkok but u have to book everything near to station so u have to walk less and very thing is in your reach its expensive but best

The MRT is the underground version of the skytrain (BTS) It runs to different parts of BKK  with a few major interchange to BTS Since its an underground system once you are in the station its cool and clean As compared to BTS its less crowded My guess is that it is covering the less populated areas of Bangkok  The ticket machine accepts bank noted so its easier to purchase tickets as compared to BTS

The MRT is fast frequent and inexpensive It runs mostly underground unlike the BTS and has a limited number of stations However it is useful for places outside the BTS line like Hualanpong for visits to China Town etc

reviewTitle: anotehr good way to get around bangkok quickly
reviewText: another good way to get around Bangkok if you are into markets (as this is the network that takes you to most of them)  namely Chatuchat on weekends   Fare is pretty decent too for the distance you travel  Clean and airconditioned hence a pleasant ride

reviewTitle: Yes I am still confused at BRT and MRT and Airport Rail LInk
reviewText: Enjoy the adventure  The three systems do not integrate well  And the bus is yet another issue  Traffic is not easy on good days so the options for mass transit are a good thing

reviewTitle: Easy to navigate, staff speak reasonable English
reviewText: It's so easy to use as long as you know where you are going You can use a ticket vending machine or a Kiosk with English speaking staff No eating or drinking on the MRT
best way to move around traffic free easy to access and most of the shopping areas have stations only until 12 midnight
The MRT is much much faster than the taxi's in Bangkok and also is air conditioned Travelling by road would take hours and the MRT just minutes
Excellent service always another train coming along without a long wait at allcould ask for better service
Cheap fare  Its quite impresive though  Efficient and not so bad  Though its crowded sometimes yet i still like it

The MRT is well airconditioned and fast form of transit around the city  Easy and affordable (2040 bahtride)  I wish it was a bigger network as there are only 3 lines so does not go everywhere in the city and you need to change and buy a new ticket for BTS

The MRT system in Bangkok has one line   It is a very clean modern and efficient system During peak hours there are trains every five minutes During off peak hours trains run every ten minutes  The train fare depends on the number of stations you travel For one stop you pay 15 Bahts For two stops  18 Bahts 3  20 Bahts 4 22 Bahts 5  24 Bahts 6  26 Bahts 7  29 Bahts 8  31 Bahts and so on Children and elderly passengers pay half these amounts Tickets are in the form of a plastic token which you tap on the ticket barrier to allow you to enter At the end of your journey you insert the token into the ticket barrier  and the barrier opens up for you to exit The MRT is a very cheap and quick way of getting round Bangkok I visited in May 2017 when the exchange rate GBPBahts was 445  The MRT is connected to the BTS system at Asok station If you buy a day travel card for the BTS system you can only use it on the BTS skytrain system It is not valid for the MRT system I believe that the authorities should try and combine the two systems together  so that one travel card is valid for both the systems
Very efficient and clean easy to use The maps above the doors inside the trains and the station names running on the bottom of the TV monitors help you understand your stop if you are new
If you are in Bangkok i do recommend you to experience this amazing service It saves your cost a lot for traveling from one way to another
I didn't expect to see such modern clean and efficient MRT it connects almost all attraction and it's very close to the BTS use it

The MRT network is more extensive than the BRT and Airport Link which makes it very efficient Also unlike the BRT the MRT issues magnetic coins which are easier to carry The network is clean airconditioned and very helpful The stations have multiple entry and exit points but the security is not that tight All in all an extremely useful method of transport especially if you are a tourist in the city wanting to set off on your own
MRT was the mode we used to travel in the city and it was very good We had trouble getting to few destinations but we managed

reviewTitle: Clean and efficient, but not extensive
reviewText: Just like BTS Skytrain system I am surprised that MRT Bangkok's underground metro system counts as one of the "attractionsthings to do" in BangkokThough it does not rank as high as BTS (which is No 2) at No 19 (as of June 2017) it is still a surprise in a city with so many things to see and do Just like BTS I consider Bangkok MRT merely as a tool to get around to see the real "sights"  Yes it is clean and efficient and relatively new I think it is also more spacious than Skytrains However its network is not extensive enough Several areas of interest to tourists like Kao San Road Royal Palace and Wat Po cannot be accessed by skytrains or underground metro  Also you can not connect MRT directly to BTS Skytrain system Even they are next to each other in several locations (such as SilomSala Daeng) people using one cannot transfer to the other seamlessly You need to get out of the station use a new ticket and get into the other one This does cause some inconvenience
good fast and cheap but packed in English s well trains every few mins and very clean as well would use again
Efficient travel & cheap  Trains are so regular  like within minutes Air  conditioned & clean  Train stops clearly marked above doors

reviewTitle: Clean, Quiet, Easy to Use, Avoid Traffic!!!
reviewText: It's really easy to find your way on the MRT the trains are so clean the people on board are quiet  there are signs in English and Thai and a voice over that announces the stopsattendants were helpful as well and it was easy to get a tickethighly recommend just sit back and observe for a minute or so then just pay attention to the signs the maps and the voice overit saved us so much time that we would have spent in trafficand so so clean

I've been going to Bangkok for 14 years And I've used the Sky Train countless times I've never had a reason to use the MRT until last week and it was fantastic Clean cheap easy to navigate If it's going where you need to be hop on because it certainly beats BKK traffic
Love this service You can depend on getting to where you want on time Reasonably priced air conditioned transport

Change given at the ticket window if needed An English language button is available on the screen Choose the stop you want and the amount to be paid is printed for each stop Only able to purchase one ticket at a time Very busy in the morning

reviewTitle: Fast and cheap travel in Bangkok
reviewText: MRT Underground along with the BTS Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok You beat all the notorious traffic which can hold you up for hours (literally) at peak times even though taxis are cheap and reliable If you plan carefully you can use the MRT or BTS to get to or get close to most of the main tourist attractions in the city as well as the main shopping areas (Sukhumvit Road) MRT and BTS intersect at various points making it easy to use both for a specific trip (though you have to pay separately for each of them) If you have to use MRT or BTS to get as close as possible to your destination then use taxi for the last bit

Ticketing is via a touchscreen which with 1 press can be all in English   You select stops graphically so as long as you know the name of the stop next to where you want to go it's a very easy to use system takes notes or coins
Enjoyed traveling on the rail system as its very efficient qets packed during the work hours  Rail system practically takes you from one end to the next and its cheap
I have lived in Thailand for 6 months and I always use the transit system Cheap clean and easy to navigate Recommend highly I am returning in August and I will use again
Making use of public transport in Bangkok was quite easy And the most affordable way for us to get around The service is great Do give it a try
Skytrain and Metro in Thailand are among the cleanest in the world I have been to many countries but very few of them are clean

reviewTitle: Great Way to get Around Bangkok.
reviewText: Price is reasonable If you are 65 show your ID and you will get an elder card which gives you 50% discount
This coupled with the BTS are great alternatives to Bangkok traffic I prefer travelling by MRT and BTS wherever possible Very easy to use and you can get to most places on it
Bangkok MRT is a great way to get around Clean and reliable and very economical We used day passes to hop on hop off
Always very good air conditioned and on time Great connections to airport and other change to BTS

reviewTitle: easy to do even for foreigners
reviewText: Being a public transport taker myself it felt normal and nice to take the public transport I would suggest it as it is much cheaper and there are no tourist seeking people there trying to rip you off
Good maps at stations to figure out route Quick and very user friendly Have used a few times and never had an issue

reviewTitle: An efficient underground rail system which  integrated with other major transport facilities.
reviewText: Travelling around heavy traffic and congestion city central in Bangkok to variety of tourist attractions and shopping centres is best via  BTS or  MRT  MRT provides quick easy efficient air conditioned underground rail service  you can purchase station to station token daily pass or best value is a 3 day pass for 230 bht  I  found the MRT  easy to navigate Clear signs and very reliable The price to ride was good and ride was conducive The trains are also well airconditioned and a great place to escape the heat even temporarily This rail system  been integrated with  BTS or ARL at some stations  It was fast economical  and air conditoned   Unfortunately the payment system was not integrated with BTS Skytrain Many popular and tourist attraction venues  located with close proximity of  the MRT stations Although obviously some peak times are best avoided due to the crowds most other times there's plenty of room  There is also the airport link for tourist who travel light    MRT uses token and BTS uses card It will further enhance efficiency of both rail links if they are using the same system so that we will not have to change all the time or line up to purchase tickets at the machines which is usually very crowded Public announcement in the trains and the stations  are in both Thai and English   Relevants maps of Bangkok city available  at the stations for tourist     The maps exhibited are also user friendly and easy to understand
I found the MTR easy to navigate Clear signs and very reliable The price to ride was good and ride was nice
I am able to visit the place I want to go thanks to MRT Organise and always on time Safe to travel
Like the BTS this was also a time saver We took the MRT on our way to and back from the Siam Niramit show It was much faster than by road during traffic peak hours

My hotel was near Huay Kwang MRT station so I use it often during my visit to Bangkok The system has been integrated so I can change to BTS or ARL at some stations It was fast cheap and air conditoned Unfortunately the payment system was not integrated with BTS Skytrain so you can't use one card unless you have bank provided card (if I'm not mistaken)
The metro trains are quite fast and comparative cheaper to BTS Good places located around the MRT stations
Depending on where you want to go this is a great option  Coming from the airport there is an airport link also

reviewTitle: very cheap easy to navigate underground tube
reviewText: this was a very convienant way to travel around Bangkok with maps at the stations we chose at random where to stop off at we anded up choosing 2 parks to visit very good choice very cheap 20 baht each so ¬£1 to travel very safe  air conditioned if you can deal with navigating and walking a little this is far better than taxi by far and so much cheaper very clean stations and tubes are about every 5 mins so easy if you miss one
Bangkok's MRT is such a great way to get around the city Although obviously some peak times are best avoided due to the crowds most other times there's plenty of room

Because of the different company that built the metro line ssytem in Bangkok BTS and MRT have different way in buying their tickets MRT uses token and BTS uses card How we wish they are using the same system so that we will not have to change all the time or line up and buy tickets not to be inconvenient

Travelling  around bangkok to a variety of destinations or connecting with the BTs  use the MRT Quick easy efficient air conditioned underground rail service  you can purchase station to station token daily pass or best value is a 3 day pass for 230 bht Avoid the traffic get the MRT or BTS

reviewTitle: works great, air con, and very clean
reviewText: Main thing I like about the MRT on Bangkok is how clean it is especially when compared to the MRT or something comparable in other countries Also it's air conditioned so enjoy it
very convenience to move around the Bangkok city but so many people taking in some time Add more ticket vending machines
MRT works great easy to move around You pay according to the distance or station you are going to at the token machines and use the same token to enter and exit Great AC for hot days

reviewTitle: Clean and efficient way of traveling
reviewText: The MRT is a clean and efficient way of traveling and connects to the Sky Train and the Airport Rail Link fastest and easiest way of traveling around Bangkok

reviewTitle: this is the way to get around bangkok
reviewText: last week i spent 2 hours in a taxi to go 4km  one of the greatest additions to bangkok the mrt is state of the art on time like clockwork comfortable and safe and no gridlock

The train system for Bangkok is great and cheap You can reach lots of places without resorting to taxis or private car The trains are also well airconditioned and a great place to escape the heat even temporarily

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Clean reliable and cheap this along with the BTS are the best and fastest ways to get around Bangkok No hassle with taxi drivers and no traffic jams

The Thais have it sorted with this one Built by an Italian company I think it is quick efficient and the only way to get about in Bangkok in my opinion Half the fun is planning your journey and buying the token The staff help you happily especially if you try to speak a bit of Thai I usually give them their laugh for the day There are route maps everywhere in both Thai and English so it is quite easy The local tourist map shows all the routes and stations too with the links to the BTS the skytrain

Just like BTS MRT lets you travel hassle free within the Bangkok city It's an underground metro unlike BTS and covers good part of the city It do intersects with BTS as well at certain junctions but one needs to exit MRT completely to board the BTS or vice versa It also provides connectivity to the Airport Link at the Makkasan Station which is a big plus It is very convenient efficient and super clean It do gets crowded during peak hours but you can always skip one and get into the other one Highly recommended

during our ride over the small bikepads you have to be carefull and dont take any risks because if you fall into the water is for sure not nice and will give you a "special"perfume smell also watch out for the local motocycles because some off them drive fast on these small pads

There are some places you can't reach by using the BTS that's when you have to switch to MRT There are 3 BTS Stations can be interchange with MRT Mo Chit Sala Daeng & Asok Stations  Only difference MRT is underground & BTS is upperground

reviewTitle: The best way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Apart from peak hours when the trains are overloaded (full) this transport method is not only the best (practically only) way to get around Bangkok it is a very comfortableThe trains are all airconditioned and the stations are announced in both Thai and English The maps exhibited are also understandable
MRT is a great way to commute in bngkok to avoid the city traffic   However it can get very crowded at times so be prepared to get squeezed
Not as nice at the bts because are below ground but great way to get a bangkok experience Watch out during rush hour because it will be PACKED Don't be surprised to find a yummy meal down there

After having travelled the subways in NYC I must admit I was expecting the worst as I was walking into the MRT However it is so much cleaner and nicer than NYC subways They even have shops and restaraunts down there Oh and best of all air conditioning
Good ride  Though the MRT seems a bit expensive but it is a good transport option  took about 20 mins

MRT is a great way to get around bangkok MRT is the underground train they are clean well maintained and importantly for Bangkok great Air con Prices are cheap and everything is well signed and in english Even for a first time user you will find it easy to use This is a really easy way to beat the traffic in Bangkok

reviewTitle: This this public mass transit system
reviewText: If only  if only this type of transit system existed fully for the major cities in the US  Very clean always kept clean quiet travel and courteous riders  Fast moving always climate controlled and cheap (from a westerners standpoint)
Offers quick mode of transport to beat the heavy Bangkok traffic Affordable too But very much crowded during peak hours of the day

reviewTitle: Better than a taxi in traffic
reviewText: to travel in peak times it is quicker to use the MRT I needed to travel from Mo Chit to the FuramaXclusive on Asoke road and the MRT was quick clean and comfortable Highly recommended when traffic is heavy in Bangkok
The train system in Bangkok is fantastic  Always runs on time and a good economic way to get about  It is easy to use it can sometimes be crowded

reviewTitle: Use it whenever you can. It's cheap, safe, clean and incredibly convenient
reviewText: If you use Bangkok taxis you can sit for 2 hours in a traffic jam and pay for the delay Or you can dive down into the MRT and arrive quickly and comfortably (aircon) within 15 mins on the other side of town Used together with BTS Skytrain it's the clever way to navigate the city Take a little time and trouble to preplan your daily itinerary and take advantage of this highly efficient and cheap travel option Bangkok traffic is a nightmare of congestion and keeping off the roads is highly recommended unless you have time to waste

Great efficient way to get around I found when using the MRT or BTS it was easier just to buy a day pass than work out individual stops A day pass for both transit systems is around 140 baht so very cheep and I usually find myself on them at least twice a day so it pays for itself As other have said you cant buy a combined ticket you think that could be worked out but oh well that's the Thais for you Thats why we love them
What more could you want It's fast cheap clean and airconditioned It gets you where you want in a very simple way Avoid the cabs and use the MRT and BTS

We loved using MRT skytrain in Bangkok ) it is very safe and very clean  We will have preferred to be able to buy one card to use BTS and MRT without the need of buying individual token for each trip Besides that it‚Äôs the perfect way to move around in Bangkok Careful last train is around midnight But then traffic in Bangkok is much easier and there is plenty of taxis available during the night

My family and I used the MRT to travel to shopping centres that were a few stations away from where we were staying  I found this form of transport with a pram difficult  and a real hassleThere were escalators going up to a platform but coming down you had to use the stairsWe did use  a lift once butit meant we had to get a security guard to get us in the lift  Something to think about if you were travelling on your own with a pram childbabybag etcNot to mention crowds of people using the MRT

reviewTitle: An amazing and affordable mode of transport in the city
reviewText: A very affordable mode of transport in the city of Bangkok  The tickets can be bought for individual journey  the ticket dispenser is very user friendly with English option for tourists Also One day and three days unlimited travel pass can be bought at the counter which is not very expensive The announcements on the trains and stations are both in Thai and English and very clear  There are good notices in the stations with locality maps and metro maps  The only problem with the MRT is that the service does not cover the whole city    The onl
Very easy way to get around the city All information in English as well as Thai and it is clean and fast

The Metropolitan Rapid Transit or MRT is the underground train  is the rapid transit system serving much of Bangkok  It opened in 2004  Swipe a round black token about the size of a US Quarter to enter the train  Children under 14 and people over 60 get a 50% discount in price  Trains arrive about every 57 minutes  The service hours are from 600 a to midnight  The air conditioning is excellent The trains are clean

reviewTitle: Excellent way to travel around Bangkok but does nt cover the whole of Bangkok
reviewText: Great way to trave around some of Bangkok but does not cover the whole of Bangkok There is also the Skytrain

reviewTitle: Fastest way to go to most tourist attractions
reviewText: Better than take a Taxi This is a fast and cheap transportation in Bangkok Can be overcrowded at rush hour

If you are arrive at Suvarnabhumi Airport then you can use this alternative to commute to down town Bangkok It's easy and the staff will gladly to help you to get you to your destinations People are well mannered they wait behind line and let people come out first so you don't need to rush Although you are first timer you wont get confused with the direction or how to get the ticket Trust me
Can get busy near the ticket machines at certain stations so if you are in a rush allow time Fast clean and easy to navigate around
its easy to travel and convenient no traffic and cheaper as well It links to most part of the city

reviewTitle: Clean, quiet, easy to use once you understand the ticket/coin system
reviewText: Bangkok streets are often clogged with traffic  If the underground rail is near your destination take it  Especially outside of rush hour day or evening  It is clean and feels very safe  Riders obey the 4 yellow arrows on the platform  passengers exit straight out before anyone enters from the sides  So simple so efficient so needed in many western subways  For single rides purchase a plastic coin from one of the machines in the station  When entering there is no slot for  the coin  The coin has a sensor  place it on the turnstile reader and enter  To exit deposit the coin in the slot to release the turnstile   Use the underground rail  So much better than sitting in taxis in traffic

reviewTitle: Brilliant way to beat the traffic
reviewText: Absolutely the best way to get around BKK coupled with the BTS Hectic and quite crammed during rush hour outside of those times it's a great way to beat the Bangkok traffic Staying any longer than a few days and it's a good idea to purchase the MRT card and preload it with 1300 baht to avoid the queues at the ticket and change kiosks
MRT is way more cheaper than BTS (the sky train) very convenience  avoid rush hours as it will be very crowded

reviewTitle: Use the MRT to go to  Thailand Cultural Center
reviewText: I tried all sorts of transport in Bangkok and I used the MRT to go the Thailand Cultural Center to attend the Siam Niramit Show The service is good cheap(40 baht) from  Sukhumvit  but limited and the last train is at 1130 PM
I always take this subway from Chatuchak to Rama 9 Must buy stored card so you can just swiftly go through and no need to que Fast and on time

reviewTitle: Similar to BTS Sky Train, very cost efficient
reviewText: Just as with the BTS the MRT also offers a very low cost transport medium for travelers esp those travelling individually or in very small groups Some MRT stations drop of directly in attraction areas and some have links for transfer to BTS
MRT is a great way to get around Bangkok Easy to use and cheapThere are quite a few transfer stations so getting to your desired area is very easy
This is a great way to get around  quick efficient and clean with announcements in English before each stop we love it
Be a are that a three day pass does not give you use of Purple line 230 THB  Still somewhat cheaper and less crowded than BTS
It was easy to travel around without knowing a single Thai word I rarely use public transport overseas but it was a pleasant experience

reviewTitle: Security Check is Terrible at the ASOKE BTS, Sukhumvit Line
reviewText: I have been living in Bangkok for two years and the have seen the security check at the BTS station go through several stages of security check standards These days they most just check people with bags but the business brief cases are almost never checked  Today I went with my wife to early morning appointment and when it was over went to the Asoke BTS so she could return home and I could travel to work As we were going through the gate we were in deep conversation when suddenly the security guard (young man who looked like he was having a bad day) basically yelled at me to get my briefcase checked If this was the standard for everyone then I would feel much safer but that is clearly not the case  This was pure and simple harassment of a nonThai citizen He even had a smirk on his face when he cleared it with his wand but still had me open my brief case  The MRT should be aware of this happening

reviewTitle: good way to avoid the Sun and dust whilst getting to your destination
reviewText: A very easy way to get around the main shopping malls you need to know where you have to go  get off not the most tourist friendly system But user friendly non the less  Need change coins to buy tickets so a good way to get rid of all the change you collect over time  Clean and orderly

By far this is the quickest and most convenient form of transport in Bangkok While busy it is not as crowded as the BTS and generally we were able to get a seat to sit on Also with this form of transfer we did not have to climb any steps as they had escalators at each station Joins up with the BTS in a number of places so easy to get to most of the sights

reviewTitle: Take a Rabbit card and enjoy!
reviewText: This is the best way to move across Bangkok you should be aware of rush hour and rabbit card is easy to use and is accepted in tourist locations like MBK food court
If most of the sightseeing that you want to do is up and down SUKHUMVIT RD then the BTS Skytrain is a better optionsince it runs along that street

reviewTitle: Excellent transport as long u know where to go
reviewText: MRT is the underground train at Bangkok to bad that google map didnt have the map for this route (since i only see route MRT from sky train(BTS) and bus on there)  but luckily they had good sign system and many people in Bangkok is helpful enough to tell u where or what direction you wanna go (even some of them cant talk in English)  but i kinda confused why does not so many people using MRT subway in Bangkok

The underground (MRT) is separate from the skytrain (BTS) Doesn't appear to be an integrated ticket system Transfers between the two at interconnecting stations relatively close Fares are relatively cheap Note that on BTS you can buy a day ticket for BAHT 140 giving unlimited use A good choice if planning to visit the weekend market since with another couple of short rides you will cover your outlay
MRT is the underground metro in Bangkok Runs a different route to the BTS Skytrain So depends where you want to go which one to use Trains were on time clean and a great way to avoid Bangkok traffic
used the mrt while in bangkok i dont no if it was the time of day but it was very quite compared to the sky train also cheap day ticket available
Once you have the systemof getting your ticketit is tbe best way to get around  Although taxis are cheapthis is so much faster
the fastest way to get to the train market without any jam map is also easy to locate because there's English instructions

Located within a few short blocks of our hotel was our MRT station Great price for travelling around to the weekend markets and other fun locations Great for the adventurer who likes to discover Bangkok Very clean and very safe
Clean cool timely and cheap Usually you can get a seat so that is nice I used it to get to the Chatachuk market
Simple quick and efficient use this to avoid being stuck in a taxi for 40 Minuits at rush hour  If the trafic is to bad they drop you at a MRT station anyway and tell you to make your own way back

The Bangkok MRT combined with the Skytrain BTS are perfect tools to travel visit and explore Bangkok's most attractive sites First impression is the cleanness of the installation No graffities no trash no smell no homeless people lying around and no danger  the exact opposite to the ParisM√©tro For those with cars you have park and ride possibilities on the outskirt stations one of the most popular being "Lad Prao" station Not forget to validate the parking badge and get very reduced parking fee
Perfect to cross the city in the shorter time it is really a needed way of transport They are increasing regularly good it is needed

reviewTitle: Easy mode of transport in Bangkok.
reviewText: Clean fast and efficient  A great way to move  around Bangkok Either this or the BTS  Both are interconnectable

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok!
reviewText: We bought a 1day roverticket and it enabled us to travel around the city for a day and then get to the station to get a train to our next destination The trains and stations are modern and spotlessly clean You receive a swipe card which gets you through the barriers Very impressed It is not expensive
The MRT and the adjoining Sky train are a great cheap ways to get around the city and both connect to the Airport Sky train linkvery convenient
very easy just like the subways in HKG and Shengzen and better than London simple to navigate with English

reviewTitle: The only way to get around Bangkok!
reviewText: The MRT in Bangkok is wonderful Very easy to use purchase your ticket before going through the turnstile There are a lot of people thee that will help even if you speak English There are good maps available of where it goes and the stops Cars are air conditioned they announce the stations so it is pretty easy to use  It is also very affordable
Super for a visit to Chinatown( hua lampong station) and Chatuchak market Super fast clean and without the hustle and bustle of the BTS

You need to line up and be patient to get your token for travel The MRT machines do accept notes There are a lot of steps and not many elevators so if you have heavy bags it is a work out The trains are cool and clean

It's clean and affordable The staff will clean it at the last station before allowing passengers to board It's fast and a cheap way to get around Bangkok You can just purchase a token at the ticket machine and hover the token over to 'tap in' at the gantry
