Good way to get around BKK This is Bangkok's underground with stations mainly in areas that the BTS doesn't go Having said that there are some interchange stations Always clean airconditioned and very efficient Monitors advise of the wait time in minutes If you are over 65 get an 'elder' card and travel at half price As usual in any major city avoid peak time travel if you can
My token did not work but staff soon sorted it out It is clean and easy to use and is Google to miss all the traffic jams

Maps easy to read Interesting place for people watching Cool air con Change from machines only given in coins but you can go to the counter and get change for large bills Exits can be kind of confusing as there are usually more than one coming up on different side of the busy roads Good to check ahead online to see which exit to take I have found though that the people manning the security gates can be quite helpful especially at stns where there are a lot of tourists
MRT is one of the best transits I have been in Covering most of the important locations of Bangkok it is the best way to travel through Bangkok
Recommend it for those with little luggage as it's the fastest and cheapest way to get to the city (if you are a lone traveler)

The MRT infrastructure is spotlessly clean as are the trains It is efficient and easy to use Such an easy and affordable way to get around Announcements are made in Thai and English and the self service ticket machines have an English language option on them too Well done Bangkok

Love the vast platforms and the overall design and cleanliness although the system is rapidly becoming overtaken by passenger numbers At some stations especially near Asok there is a crazy traverse between travellers going up and down the escalators

reviewTitle: Be Sure To Make Use Of It While In Bangkok
reviewText: Along with the BTS Skytrain system the MRT is by far the quickest and easiest way to get around Bangkok and is very cheap to travel on  The trains are clean safe and very frequent  You can make use of the coin operated ticket machines or the counter staff to buy tickets just tell them where you want to go and they will let you know the price  TIP Try to avoid using the MRT and BTS during the usual morning and afternoon rush hour periods as it can get cramped but nothing different from any other train system in major cities around the world
We took MRT because the BTS did not reach the place we would like to go  We like to take MRT was because could help us safe time and money And also easy access

The MRT takes you to the corners of Bangkok unaccessible by the BTS  Built 8 years after the BTS the MRT is brilliantly designed signposted and efficiently run Arm yourself with the map and when in doubt ask for help from the always courteous staff  Ask for and claim you Senior Citizen concessions (often 50%) at the ticket booths  The Thai's have a culture that is truly respectful always show geat self control and have a nonconfrontational attitude Be sure  that as a tourist you reciprocate

reviewTitle: very good way to transport in thailand
reviewText: its very easy to travel if u have metro station close to your hotel  and there are help full staff who guide you which station to go to reach your destination

reviewTitle: hotel are closed to sukhumvit MRT (opposite terminal 21)
reviewText: around 10mins walk to BTS asok right at terminal 21 and sukhumvit MRT  hotel located between BTS Phromphong (right at Emporium mall) and BTS Asok (Terminal 21)
We used the MRT to get to the airport It was quick and had nice strong AC An economical way to get around

reviewTitle: Beat the traffic jam with Train
reviewText: good transportation to various tourist spots Example Hua Lamphong MRT station to goto Chinatown Chatuchak MRT station  chatuchak weekend market Sukhumvit MRT station  Terminal 21 shopping mall or connecting to Skytrain line

reviewTitle: It'll get you where you need to be
reviewText: The MRT (Metro) is very clean and efficient and appropriately chilled (okay you could hang meat in there)  And it extends to many areas you can't reach by BTS    Butyou can't see much from underground and the ticketing system is painful particularly at the interchanges with the BTS  Add to that the BTS and MRT don't play well together so be prepared to have to reticket when you connect and allow yourself a few minutes for this process Similar to some major Japanese cities   There are rumours that the systems will be unified under one transit card some time in the future but not yet
As with the BTS and Sky Train it is a very efficient safe and cheap way of getting around BKK considering the chaotic traffic
Very convenient but if the thai government would build lift in each MRT will be an extra bonus for old folk and disable

reviewTitle: It's a train  ! and it works
reviewText: Sorry a bit of a flippant title but at the end of the day this is a train service that works Working in London I use the Tube and I think that's a great service so this is nothing better or worse

Unfortunately you can not get everywhere on teh MRTIf you are over 60 years old you get 50% discount even if you are not a local you do need to buy your ticket at the ticket counter A shame it is not linked to the Sky train

Cheap efficient and fast and clean  Never had to rush to get to the station waiting time is 5 mins or so  Australia will never have anything close to an MRT or BTS which provides a regular service and efficiency  Do your research before you travel and happy travelling on MRT super subway

If your hotel is located on the MRT line use it The traffic is so huge in Bangkok that such transportation is more than welcome Air conditioning on board fast cheap (huy a card to avoid the queue at the ticket machine) I used it a lot
The Bangkok MRT is clean reliable air conditioned and a comfortable way to get around the city It is reasonably priced and the staff are helpful and friendly The SRT skytrain could learn from the MRT
Depending on where you are starting from traveling around Bangkok is easy on this rail  We only used it one day  but quickly got acquainted  by wrong wayLOL   Once we understood we had no problems

reviewTitle: good mean of transporation. in Bangkok
reviewText: very simple easy to understand the routes and good value for money highly recommend using it to move around shoping centers in Bangkok

reviewTitle: The only way to get around BKK
reviewText: This will save you time and money its fast and easy to use if you can't get all the way on the MRT take it as far as you can then get a Taxi or Tut Tut

Great way to travel when the Bangkok traffic comes to a gridlock The trains and stations are clean and well kept If you are three people or more and can fit into a taxi the taxi may actually be less expensive
This is also a very good transport  Especially senior passenger can get 50% discount on the route Highly recommend this transport
Excellent service cheap and frequent Can get busy at peak times Carry many coins although there are change booths but you will have to queue

reviewTitle: Best way of transportation in Bangkok
reviewText: System is very quick and affordable execllent conditions and clean staff very respecful and helpful
A great way to get around the city Cheap and easy to use Can get busy when it's rush hour Combined with the sky train it gets you to most area's or within walking distance

reviewTitle: Very Crowded but better than a Taxi!!!!!!!!
reviewText: My friend took me all over Bangkok today  I put some money on a card and we took off  It was very easy getting on and off the train but I'm a neophyte in Bangkok and it was a little intimidating changing trains and making sure we got off and on at the proper stations  They do have an electronic board inside the train that lets you know where the heck you are at and where you are heading but I'm so glad I had a native Bangkoker with me to make the proper decisions  It actually was easy and fun but as my title says extremely crowded where bodies touched each other for quite a distance

Never seen any trouble in the subway in my experience Recently passenger no is increased but still ok to go anywhere Hope to be improved to increase train no to prevent cloudy train inside like for small kids old man

Brilliant way of getting around Bangkok clean cheap and air conditioned it offers an affordable way of travelling around the sights of Bangkok It doesn't take you to all the main tourist attractions but will get you pretty close
I took MRT connecting from BTS Very easy Empty seat at the afternoon time But not convenience to use during rush hrs
Tried the Metro service MRT at bangkok Thailand on the Sukumvet LineVery convenient  Cheap and Fastest Mode of transportMust tryis on similar lines of the Metro service in South east Asian nations
Go from one point to an the rin Bangkok can be tricky MRT is a good and fast way However sometimes very crowd and it is really cold So take a jacket  outside 35 and inside 20 oC

reviewTitle: Easy to use and travel the city
reviewText: We normally catch taxi's but used the MRT because its easier to access Terminal 21  it was so easy and cheap
Qiuick efficient relatively cheap and air conditioned Use it especially if like us you're not in walking distance of major attractions

Great chice if you are tired of tuktuk drivers and if you want to travel from further places in bangkok Price is ok we paid for journey from first stop till to destination of the line about 47 baths Only thing is crazy AC and there is super chill But definitely have to recommend Also staff there is helpful and english speaking so they are able to help you how to get to the place where you need to go

Bangkok knows public transportation  When I was there in the early 90s I had to rely on buses and taxis  Between the MRT and the BTS I was able to avoid both my entire trip  Easy inexpensive and gets you where you need to go  fast

We took MRT from Pichaburi to Chatuchak and back The ride was so smooth comfortable and pleasant May be the AC was overworking but was  welcome on hot day in BKK Very economical mode of travel Please do try
The subway makes me travel very comfortable I can travel from Chatuchak to Talad Bang Yai save time

reviewTitle: A great way to get around
reviewText: We stumbled upon Bangkok's public transport system when a taxi we got in to told us we would never get where we were going in time due to traffic he suggested we take public transport and that was the best idea ever  The MRT and BTS are quick clean and efficient with the only down side being they are pretty packed but fear not if you cant fit on you only need to wait 5 min for the next one  Trips are cheap and signage is clear  An excellent transport system
MRT is cleanairconditioned and accessivleNever got lost herebecause it is easy to navigateFare is cheap too
The mass transit system in Bangkok is really very nice both the BTS and the MRT  The MRT runs northsouth while BTS runs eastwest  Clean fast
It's not so crowded as BTS fast and covinient But MTR cannot use Rabbit card it will be good if both MTR and BTS to use the same transportation card
It was a easy way to get around Bangkok and surrounding areas Maps were clear Then if need be got a Tutt Tutt or taxi

This firm has offices on Soi Diana in Pattaya and is the most reliable taxi service I have found in Thailand  I have used them several times now and they have been punctual each time Highly recommend it
It's so easy to get around Bangkok via public transportation If you're heading to chinatown or jutujak market the MRT will get you there  It's clean and easy to use

reviewTitle: Cool Sanity in a hot Bangkok
reviewText: Nice way to travel in a hot and humid climate  god interaction with BST and river boats  I like it a lot
In Bangkok as we all know the traffic is very bad So MRT is the best choice as it could save time money and so energy
Superb facility clean and cool  Along with Airport link and BST great way to get around and visit the essential sites
Yes I used the airport train then connect via MRT before back to LRT line for Sukhumvit  A bit of walking but all under the pedestrian shade  Lots of people so felt secured

reviewTitle: MRT is an Excellent way to travel in Bangkok.
reviewText: I only have positive things to say about MRT system When I used it on occasion it was clean fast cool and effective way to travel It has only one line (blue) and it is a good way to get to the railway station HuaLamphong  I was bit surprised they do not use all the space they have for commerce  but it is a positive for me as it keeps the walkways clean I used the purple line (BST) and blue line and found it a good way to travel The purple line which is operated by BST was very underused n  the blue line MRT was busier  but never crowded They use security gates to enter the station but it is bit too relaxed to be really effective If you need to transfer to purple line sky train there is free shuttle bus at Bang Sue as the connection is not finished yet (As of March 2017)
Efficient on time and a super way to get around the city It runs like clockwork and is clean and safe along with the skytrain a rally fast way to get around and so cheap too
This is the greatest way to escape from the traffic jam in Bangkok But please avoid the rush hours because there are crowded of officers

on a view stations you have a direct link to the BTS (Mass Transport system overground) The MRT brings you to places where the BTS is not going Better choice then standing in slow traffic in a Taxi or BUs Recoomendet
The only problem with this system is that there's not enough track and trains So it only covers a little of Bangkok But where it does exist it's usually much faster than taking a taxi

The operational hours are 6AM till Midnight The signage & announcements are also in English The MRT Underground Train is a great way to get around to many parts of the city Especially when you consider the terrible BKK traffic which can effect taxis The cars are air conditioned During my 8 days in BKK I rode the MRT at all sorts of timeshours and never had a problem This included rush hour I purchased an "Adult" stored value card This saved me from waiting in the long lines for the vending machines which provide the coins used for paying fares And also the long line for purchasing tickets The fare depends on how far you are travelling  Some of the popular stations are Chatuchak & Kamphaeng Phet (Exit 2) for Chatuchak Weekend Market Hualamphong  for train station & Wat Traimit (Golden Buddha) & Chinatown Also for train to Ayutthaya from Hualamphong Train station Sukhumvit MRT  For Asok BTS area Bang Sue  Also for train to Ayutthaya The MRT connects with the Airport Rail Link at Makassan ARL station for Petchaburi MRT station  And also there are intechange connecting points for switching to the BTS  The MRT & BTS tickets are not interchangeable they are separate systems Look at a MRT map on Google

A clean and reliable method of transport in Bangkok Forget the taxis use the trains The staff can understand English to help and the stations all have signs to show you where to go The trains are clean and have air con

reviewTitle: A Great Way to Get Around
reviewText: Our motel was 2 mins from Hwai Khwang underground station This is such an efficient way to get around Bangkok It is easy to use  collect all your change for cheap travel tokens but ticket machines change notes too There is also the option of a ticket counter but the machines have an English screen option and are easy If you are not in a hurry and travel between 10am and 3pmish you will have short wait times In the peak time morning and evenings be prepared for longer queues and being packed like a sardine The good thing is that at peak times the trains run every couple of minutes This is all part of the adventure of Bangkok  give it a go The best rail destination is Chatuchack Flower Market
Using the MRT is a great way to get around this congested city It is close to many of the big shopping centres and comes every 5 mins

I tried their MRT for the first time on my last visit as they didn't have it when I went many years ago I must say it definitely made life easier Didn't have to go through the crazy traffic of Bangkok when going many places It was clean and quite systamised

The MRT is a spotlessly clean efficient and cheap way to get around the only downside is that is does not cover all of the city I could have sat on it all day and just listened to the train announcer what a voice

While the existing MRT line connects both the Silom and Sukhumvit hotel districts with the weekend market it's nice see the line expanding under the Chaopraya and reconnecting with the BTS on the western side of the river which may ease some rush hour traffic on the skytrain
The MRT similar to the BTS Skytrain as clean efficient and easy to navigate We used it several times during our 4 day stay in Bangkok Save money and time avoiding a taxi and use the public transport
Travelled from chatuchak to si lom  Its clean convenient and easy to use  Wasnt crowded when we were on it which was in the night

reviewTitle: Clean and efficient way around Bangkok
reviewText: We used the Bangkok MRT to get around Bangkok in comfort and ease and avoided the traffic congestion that seems to always haunt the city   Cheap and efficient this is the way to travel when visiting this tourist Thailand city

The Bangkok underground system (MRT) is a useful and cheap method of getting around the city There are escalators and lifts to the platform levels(s) it has efficient AC it never seems to get too crowded and it has an interchange with the Airport Rail Link (ARL) and two with Skytrain (BTS)  So what's not to like Not much really apart from it doesn't really go to many useful destinations and there is only one line While there are several lines planned or under construction it will be several years until they're operational  It's worth bearing in mind that Bangkok's three city rail lines are run by separate organisations and consequently use different ticketing systems This is not user friendly at all and requires different prepay cards

reviewTitle: World Class Metro Ride - smooth, convenient, comfortable and enjoyable!
reviewText: We used Metro for travelling from Si Lom to Chatuchak station Neat and elegant stations You can use vending machines for buying tickets Balance amount if any will be dispensed in coins only Since the stations are multileveled check the platform you need to go Since it was a Saturday perhaps it was less crowded and we got seats However on the way the train got filled Found each passenger one minding own business  singles mostly busy with internet browsing social media listening to music through their ear phones and others in groups of 23 persons engaged in conversation among themselves but not louder Found mostly everybody decently dressed grandmother to granddaughter almost same style  Teesshirts and shorts but not indecent Public announcements in the train including safety requirements to be followed by travelers were made in both local language and English and were very clear and could be easily followed by a foreign tourist It was a World Class Metro Ride which was smooth (by avoiding traffic) convenient comfortable and enjoyable

reviewTitle: A cheap handy way of avoiding Bangkok traffic
reviewText: It's an underground metro system  You can go quickly around the city avoiding traffic  There are ticket machines on the wall or you can use the ticket office  if you are staying long term in Bangkok consider an MRT M card which you can top up at the ticket office

reviewTitle: Best way to beat the crazy traffic
reviewText: I caught the train from San Yan station to get to the airport Get off at Petchauburi ststion and take a short walk to Makassan station to connect via Airport Rail Link (ARK) to Suvarnabhumi International airport  Total cost of the train ride was 63 Baht (approx USD 180) Uber during non peak time by comparison would have cost apporx USD 11but you probably get there in half the time

You got to give it to the Thais They know how to put these things together The convenience stems from how at every possibility the stations are connected to buildings and walkways and so on So you are protected from the elements  the mrt and bts systems are very well designed and there is much to learn from them
Absolutely great to use and avoid the traffic jams of Bangkok Very easy to use safe and clean Highly recommended
Easy clean simple it's the 2nd best form of transportation  in Bangkok next to the BTS if your over 55 ask for the senior  price it's  much better

reviewTitle: Quick and easy to get around
reviewText: Always felt safe travelling on the metro quick and easy to get around love the way they actually stand back and let people off before barging on like over in London
Efficient new and clean Europe has something to learn Although that the MRT system is small it's getting bigger and it's connected with the BTS Perfect to avoid traffic

We had a great experience travelling by the MRT It is quite well connected to the city corners and the airport Since cabs can be a bit expensive (if not a metered cab) the MRT is a safe and convenient option

Here for three nights hadnt really looked at travel till we got here stayed in Sukumvit which has the metro and Skytrain stop Found the metro very easy to use as its only one line either way got a three day pass for 230B

The MRT system is quite nice for travel Similar to BTS it is very clean and efficient however the maze of escalators and levels could confuse an inexperienced traveler Be sure to ask for directions if you are unsure so that you do not go in the wrong direction and have to pay more to get to your destination
Great service easy to use with tokens for single journeys  very reasonable and reliable  A really good way to get around Bangkok
Often very crowded We tried the Mrt riding from the Phetchaburi station We had Rabbit cards for the Bts but sadly you can't use the on the Mrt A combined system would be good

reviewTitle: Capacity did not grow with the passenger numbers
reviewText: These days the trains are too short and there are simply too many passengers Often you can't get on the train and have to wait for the next one because there are too many people
Excellent Metro System  very useful for tourists  you can buy a pass for unlimited travel which is very handy for tourists
Western standards at eastern prices offering a pleasant stressfree and spacious environment with the airconditioning an added bonus in the Bangkok heat

reviewTitle: Great way to Travel the city!!
reviewText: We were in Bangkok for 3 nights and purchased the 3 day pass  (230 baht) for unlimited rides  What a value and great way to navigate the city  The MRT route connects with the BTS and the Airport Link so you can get to every location  The only drawback is that the card can only be used on the MRT  That being said the BTS and Airport link are so incredibly cheap it doesn't really matter The staff in the MRT are  friendly and helpful if you have any questions as most people in Bangkok are  So ride the MRT and see the city

(1) MRT links wthe 2 lines of SKYTRAIN   (2) MRT is still constructing  Next stop is Chinatown (3) One of MRT's stops is the TRAIN STATION Hualamphong  Skytrain is currently building a 3rd line  I first came to BKK in the 1980s when there were no MRT subway and no Skytrains  Traffic was worse

The Bangkok MRT is easy to use modern metro with clearly marked destinations and maps If you've used the metro in any major city you will be able to use and understand the metro system in Bangkok It follows what are pretty much standard map systems and destination markings It is the best way to get out to and back from from the big weekend market at Chatuchak
Bangkok subway is really good The tickets you get at the ticket office or at the vending machine with touch screen where you can choose your destination and pay with coins and notes

reviewTitle: One of the better train services in the world.
reviewText: When it can be used it is one of the best train services in the world  The big thing is there is only one line and you need to go up to the BTS to get elsewhere
We really liked this mode of transport for Bangkok it was our first time  Fast and smog free I wish they had more of it
Usefull but a bit overpriced as you don't have a proper connection throughout the city We prevered to grab a cab especially when with more

reviewTitle: One of the most transport in Bangkok.
reviewText: MRT in here is very good It is very clean cheap and convenient You can come to everywhere in Bangkok by it
This underground line covers parts of the city not served by BTS It's fast we'll run air conditioned

reviewTitle: MRT a great way to avoid the traffic in BKK
reviewText: MRT a great way to avoid the traffic in BKK cheap and regular trains that take you around the city  Great to avoid the Bangkok Traffic a must to keep your sanity

reviewTitle: Fastest way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: The best option to travel around Bangkok is the the MRTBTS since the traffic is very bad in bangkok MRT and BTS is very easy to travel saves lots of time You can take a one day pass for 140Baht It connects to all major areas in BangkokFerry service Make sure your hotel is near to any of the MRT or BTS station
Got us to where we needed to go nice and cool clean too great way to travel so cheaply locals very helpful too we thanked any help we received with great gratitude

Luckily had a station right in front of our hotel to commute and connect to BTS Very clean station and cars impressive We like to encourage using public transportation Not able to buy return though so sometimes could get caught in lineups at peak times

When we visit Bangkok we always make sure the hotel is within walking distance of the railway We get a day pass for 140 Baht each and then we can hop on and off where we want Even if there is no station next to an attraction its quicker to get the train to as close as possible the get a metered taxi the rest of the way They are safe very clean and always on time and most important their airconditioners work very well

reviewTitle: Most convenience to Jatujak Weekend Market
reviewText: Most of the route is through residential area to the working places along Asoke Rama 4 and Silom area  I found MRT route and station is very convenient for anyone who want to go to Jatujak weekend market and getting out with no traffice jam

reviewTitle: Fast way to get around Bangkok.
reviewText: Cheap and fast Limited routes so useful only if start and destination are near a stop  Fully air conditioned Cellphones work throughout the network  Have change or small notes to but a ticket  average journey is around 50 baht

I used the airport rail link and the BTS to get to and from airport to my hotel Great value at a total cost of 82 baht and less than hour in either direction Easy to find your way around although it can get really crowded but still quicker than negotiating the roads which at times have to seen to be believed
Fast and convenient means of transport Not many stations though on this line Fares are cheap as well
If in Bangkok for a few days you have to use the MRT especialy during rush hours Buy a 3day pass to avoid having to purchase a token for every trip
Along with the BTS the MRT a fast cheap convenient way to get around Bangkok avoiding the city chaos standstill traffic and humidity

Super easy to get anywhere on this train You see yourself on the map find the location where you are going  punch the location # into the machine and it tells you how much the fare is put the money in & you get a ticket to where you are going round trip Its that easy Even I could do it

Running from approx 6am to roughly midnight in the urban part of the city of Bangkok This transportation is the vein of the city Just like others megacity avoid traveling in the rush hour since it will be packed on weekdays from approximately 7am to 830am especially if you board the train from Petchaburi which connected to the airport link
easy way to travel through Bangkok but its VERY cold Put "a sweater" on if you dont want to catch a cold especially if you are wet after from the rain

The MRT in Bangkok is simple to use has air condition and is very cheap so it is definately a good way to go around Also it is usually not too busy The only limitation the subway has is the fact that is does not cover the whole city

We took the MRT to get to the Chatukchak market  The disadvantage is that the MRT and the BTS aren't linked together  So you would have to walk outside to get to the BTS station  It is fairly similar to BTS except it runs underground
We found this a quick efficient means of travelling from one place to another and it linked with other means of public transport  It can be very crowded
We took the MRT to the weekend market in Chatuchak  It was fast and convenient  Trains are clean air conditioned and safe  It is very easy to use and you can buy a pass
Excellent cheap and reliable transportation throughout Bangkok We used it several times to explore attractions of city
the service is good when you go to the busy places liike rachada during rush hour those places are nearly impossible to get through so MRT is a smart choice
Very good option to move around with full AC It is only one line so if you need to transfer to BTS or RailLink you need to pay for an extra fare
1st time took the MRT and surprised with its services and train standard Must take this train to Chatuchak and not the BTS
Be prepared to have coins ready to buy tickets as there are at times large ques waiting to buy tickets while there are not enough vending machines which take bank notes
Very easy to use even for foreigners Connects to the BTS so makes getting around Bangkok very easy and quite cheap too

We use the MRT around Bangkok as it compliments the BTS  Pros  1) Clean and very well maintained 2) Trains are reliable and fast 3) MRT Kamphaeng Phet station closer and easier access to Chatuchak Market than BTS Mo Chit   Cons  1) The ticket is not compatible with the BTS 2) Does not have as many stations as the BTS  A must use to move around Bangkok

reviewTitle: Connect to MRT for Non-BTS Locations
reviewText: As the maps inside both MRT and BTS will show you MRT intersects BTS at several points for travel to locations touched by MRT  Travel is quick efficient safe and very inexpensive

I am more familiar with the BTS than the MRT but both are great transportation systems while in Bangkok It is cheap easy and has AC ) The BTS and MRT are so easy for foreigners like me because you either go this way or the other You can buy tickets from the kiosk and just follow the signs It is probably the best way to travel while in Bangkok since the traffic is horrible I would recommend the BTS or MRT unless you want to be stuck in traffic and pay more )
All together good travelling by MRT but compare to Singapore MRT this is more to improve it travels very fast and with an nice stations good service

By far the easiest transport system I've ever had to use The station and trains were so lovely clean and fresh smelling that I was really surprised as I'm from London where our public transport is anything but We waited no more than two minutes either end and it cost 37 baht to get from Huai Khwang to Hua Lamphong Wonderful system

reviewTitle: Excellent easy to use subway system
reviewText: This convenient and easy to understand subway was great to use especially seeing as they opened it up for free travel on New Years eve and New Years day
The subway (MRT) is very convenient and efficient although its network is less extensive than Skytrain

We used MRT on our stay n it was one of the fastest n easiest way to commute in this crazy n busiest traffic in Bangkok city  It's clean well maintained on time staff helpful cheap air con n covers most attractions n suburbs

reviewTitle: Get around cheaply and quickly avoiding traffic.
reviewText: Bangkok subway is clean modern and efficient The only thing I can dat against IT is that with a suitcase the gate shuts top quickly so you may get stuck with a beep
So after a couple of weeks travelling with taxis and tuk tuks spending loads of money we discovered this Super efficient saved us time and a way cheaperfaster option to move in this city
MRT is one of the public transportation in Bangkok you can rely on   Along the way to MRT there are many shops you can stop and shop good food Like it )

We used MRT every day as our hotel was very near to MRT station Efficiant way to get from point A to B Prohibited eating drinking in MRT Only thing is very cold conditioning so I always worn a scarf Not so cheep but I suggest to buy 3 day ticket (about 230 BHT)

reviewTitle: Nice and clean station and train
reviewText: MRT in Bangkok are the best way to reach some of destination its linked with BTS and Airport Express or City Trainsport The station are clean and safeguard

Its worth going thru the crowd hassle if you travel light and wants to save the unexpected high taxi fares Only thing be prepared for long lines at peak hours to get the tickets from the automated machines

Using MRT is affordable and convenient means of transportation  You will not miss your appointment instead of using a cab with a heavy traffic in Bangkok in a rush hours  MRT stations are all connected with Malls and shopping centers
fast way to get across the city Very clean very low costEvery 4 minutesIf you can avoid rush hour 17301830

Although I've been to Bangkok many times I've always used the skytrain and never needed to venture underground On my most recent trip the closest public transport station to a market we were going to was "Thailand cultural center" and that's how my first journey on the mrt came about Because the skytrain is newer I expected the underground mrt to be a bit rough around the edges and dingy so I was pleasantly surprised It was modern clean and efficient and I wouldn't hesitate to use again or recommend

We used the MRT several times while we were in Bangkok to avoid the traffic It is amazingly cheap as are taxis but the frequency and fact you don't wind up sitting in traffic make the MRT a great way to get around We used the MRT when we didn't want to get stuck sitting in the back of a taxi not moving in crazy Bangkok traffic but you need to be comfortable with crowds because these trains were packed every time we jumped on Definitely an easy to get around Bangkok option if you aren't afraid of public transport

reviewTitle: the unknown cousin to the BTS
reviewText: Not many tourist use this because its mainly unseen underground The BTS is more popular as it covers MBK Nana Terminal 21 etc but the MRT is just as good
If it is going near where you want to go the MRT is a great way to get around Bangkok Cheap and easy to use and you can get our right in Chtuchak Market

Used the MRT on Sukhumvit Road a few times with children costs about the same price as a taxi for a family of 5   Really convenient and frequent trains make the journey between destinations much MUCH quicker than taxis eg In busy traffic a journey between JW Marriott hotel and the superb MBK shopping centre can take over an hour on the MRT15mins   In the downside it's cramped and I do mean CRAMPED Avoid if you don't like being felt like you're travelling as a sardine in a can but otherwise it's a must for all travellers   Enjoy
This is another way to beat traffic jams and get to places further afield  The fares are very cheap  I don't know why people take taxis during normal hours when there's a good train system

reviewTitle: Efficient transport, especially in rush hour.
reviewText: Traffic is the major problem in Bangkok Especially in rush hour which lasts 23 of the day going by taxi is taking its' time Better take MRT and BTS instead While also overcrowded it allows you to go from station to station in short time Prices are  for tourists  small and you can by timebased passes

The MRT is Bangkok's version the the underground  While Public Transportation is improving in Bangkok each part of it is owned by a different company and very disjointed  With computer technology it should be one pass and let the computer divide the revenues

reviewTitle: Avoid peak hour if you can
reviewText: We have used the MRT extensively on trips to Bangkok  Some times you can't avoid the peak hour rush and if travelling with a few people you may end up on different trains and need to wait a short time at your destination for fellow travellers to catch you up  The trains are clean efficient and good value for money  Getting from A to B in Bangkok depending on where you are staying can mean studying the pubic transport system calculating your best route and changing trains and stations  But it is easy to do no Thai necessary
Good option for travel Easy to oriented there Cheaper than BTS or taxi Need some renovation i think
I used the MRT a lot while I was in Bangkok Make sure you use it from the airport So cheap and quick I was travelling by myself and it was super easy

Taxis are great if you take during non rush hours  Be sure to take only metered cabs and insist that they use the meter These always prove to be better than prenegotiated fares  Otherwise take the MRT It is fast and affordable and easy to understand
small as compared to delhi metro but incredibly clean the connections are not well connected has only 3 lines
Traveling  in Bangkok by MRTYou can go to JJ Market or Central Ladprow  Traffic right around JJ Market is very jam  Convenient to go to connect BTS too

reviewTitle: Terrific except for the idiotic delay in buying a ticket at most times of the day.
reviewText: Better than many subway systems but the bottle neck ticket purchase leaves something majorly to be desired
I use the MRT for going in and out from lumphini park help me a lot to mobile in Bangkok as line as MRT network the price is reasonable and can avoid traffic jam in Bangkok

reviewTitle: The best way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Bangkok is a vast city and at certain times it gets gridlocked where traffic comes to a standstill We have found the best way to get around is with the BTS Skytrain and MRT Underground  This is a cheap efficient way to get around and with a bit of prior research you can access most of the main parts of the city The trains are clean air conditioned on time and normally packed as this is also a popular way of travel for the locals however we have never felt uncomfortable The MRT is cheaper than the BTS and uses discs rather than cards The network is not as extensive as the BTS and caters more for the residential areas and the Chao Praya River and the ferries There are extensions presently under construction which will add additional links to the BTS and previous areas not serviced There are presently four transit stations where one can access the BTS Stations You can buy either single trip tickets or if you are planning to visit Bangkok often or for more than a week then think about buying one of the more permanent tokens which are valid from a few days to longer periods as and when required this can save time during busy periods and takes the need for small change for the single tokens out of the equation

reviewTitle: Best way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Bangkok traffic is hellish however rather than sit in traffic jams many places are now accessible using the MRT which is cheap clean and safe (and air conditioned)  Definitely the best way around the City
One of the best ways to get around Bangkok Service was good during my stay in the city The time spent to wait for the train to arrive was a bit long though
Except for late nights or Airport transfers BTS and MRT is always the most preferred transportation for me in Bangkok the road traffic is intolerable for me

The MRT which s Govt owned is the best way to travel in convenience the city of bangkok and that too at fractionof costThe tariff is very low but the trains are well kept are running on timeTicketing is as and when one travelsNo advance booking requiredIn peak time there is rush
The Bangkok MRT is another awesome way to go around the city allowing one to discover the city more )

reviewTitle: Excellent way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: The MRT subway and the BTS Skytrain combine to serve many areas of Bangkok inexpensively fast and safely I think the MRT is cheaper at least it was for two seniors in January 2017 We went two stops for 11 baht each That is about 30 cents in US money The Skytrain was 25 baht per senior citizen for three train stops Choose the system that comes closest to your destination
Using MRT and BTS is best way to get around in this city Traffic crazy so get as close as you can with mass transit and walk or take a tuk tuk
Getting around BKK was made simple by both the BTS Skytrain and the underground rail system Directions are clear and trains run on timethere isn't much more you need to know
Spend 100 baht on a swipe card and go Definitely the way to get around in a city of millions Combined with the subway trains you are good to go

reviewTitle: Good way to avoid traffic jam
reviewText: The MRT is very clean and is a good transportation to avoid the terrible traffic jam in Bangkok  The fare is reasonable also

reviewTitle: The Best Way to Travel In Bangkok
reviewText: MRT connects Bang sue in the North Bangkok with Hua Lamphong in the South Bangkok and you can interchange with BTS at Sukhumvit and Silom stations and also catch Airport Rail Link from Phetchaburi Station[Makkasan ARL]There is a train every 5 to 7 minutes and the pricing starts from 21 baht to the maximum 42 bahtThe trains are very punctual clean and the best way to avoid Traffic
Apart from being way cheap than taking a taxi the trip was amazingly fast We arrived in no time at all at Chat a chuk

reviewTitle: I love it, modern and clean and not expensive  either
reviewText: The system is clean and the fastest way to get around It's close to my hotel and goes to all the major points worth visiting if you get a hotel make sure it's close to the MRT  or BTS  Otherwise traffic is horrendous at best

One of the worlds best efficient clean transport systems Very easy to use Air con fantastic on a hot humid day Suggest buying a top up card makes life a lot easier not queing for tickets  each time The Rabbit Card is multi functional too able to buy goods at certain outlets

reviewTitle: sometimes the only way to travel
reviewText: Bangkok as we all know is a busy dazziling city  Not to mention the Amazing traffic jamsso if in a Taxi can be very expensive and waste of time Go by MRT as they are fast save and go almost wherever you want Get off near the place you want and walk the rest is easy and cheap

I used the MRT several times and in my opinion it is only worthwhile during traffic rush hours In regular hours it is much faster and definitely much more convenient using taxis Taxis in Bangkok are not expensive and in most cases service is great

reviewTitle: Very reliable and easy to use
reviewText: The trains are clean always on time and go to most tourist attraction areas They are also a cheap way to travel around
Easy and quick way to go around Bangkok Very clean and easy to buy tickets from the ticket machines

To have a shopping complex right beside our hotel was a bonus to be able to find those bargains unique iems and some great food outlets right at the doorstep without really venturing out on to the street Bought some beautiful comfortable sandals at a great price lovely tablecloths and table runners and enjoyed a real milkshake as we Aussies like
MRT is one of the fastest modes of transportation in Bangkok the fares are reasonable and the locals use the MRT specially during the peak hours to avoid the road traffic

This is a modern mode of travel which makes moving around Bangkok a breeze However there is only one like and it does not support all of the areas but does link up to the other transportation options such as the SkyTrain and the Klong Ferry  For those new to this the tickets are priced based on your start and end station and this is published on the way in and then you buy a token for the single trip The officials are all very efficient and friendly and it will cost you around 2050B per one way trip which is reasonable by international standards  The trains stop exactly at specific points on the platform and there are clear places which you need to stand to allow the exiting passengers to get out with ease No pushing and no jumping the queue with everyone lining up correctly behind each other ready to enter  Most of the people are standing but this is not a problem since you may only move a few stations  We used this as our base more of transport given that our hotel was outside of the central areas but was very close to the MRT station Well done Bangkok  a rail system which truly works

Great for getting about quickly and in the cool of the air conditioned and clean trains but they really need to integrate the different lines or provide facilities for a common pass or through tickets

Great subway Clean cheap and very cool Not a lot of stops and only a few transfers to to the BTS Supposedly they're going to have a single fare card for both the MRT and BTS but in the meantime its a great way to get around town
Bangkok traffic is hell especially in downtown area MRT is an easy and good way to get around The lines and destinations are easy to find as all is also in English
Efficient clean and cheap  Highly recommended and much faster than Bangkok taxi's The only downside is that there is only one line

MRT is underground transport with good aircon at all times  Ticket price is comparatively lower than BTS   For the access  it would surely be better with escalators instead of staircases Mainly at all BTS station

reviewTitle: Definitely the fastest travel during rush hour
reviewText: We have traveled quite a bit and this is a good alternative to the Bagkok taxi It is typical rapid transit and gets you to most of the main areas During rush hour it may be a bit crowded but definitely gets you there quicker

Like its sister the BTS Skytrain this is a brilliant way to get around the city  There is only one line but they are building more all the time  Don't suffer the horrible traffic use the MRT Underground

Poor coverage limited by the geology of the city  In sufficient capacity to cope with the demand  Poor interchange with the BTS  Not a world class transport system  But use it to save yourself from traffic hell that is Bangkok
The best way and cheapest way to get around town  Can get quite busy with commuters but it's very cheap

reviewTitle: Good way to see the city
reviewText: Easy and reliable way to see the city If traffic is not bad it is almost always cheaper and easier to use a taxi if you are more than one person (but this is not always the case in bkk) Can get crowded during peak hours
that was an awesome experience very easy to use even for first timers very clean and organized Solo traveler here from the Philippines
Very easy system to navigate with helpful and friendly staff for us none Thai speakersAirconditioned carriages very clean and lots of space
MRT in Bangkok found very helpful to move around the city which also connected to BTS & station are on most populated malls & places Very helpful to local travel

reviewTitle: Cheap way to go farther than Skytrain.
reviewText: Economical lots of stops can be crowded at rush hour comfortable ride Can use rabbit card Inout ease seems safe

The Bangkok Metro is very limited in where it serves but does an excellent job of moving people to those locations  Be aware that it can be difficult to get a token during rush hour and be sure to have plenty of change and 20 baht notes  Otherwise very easy to use but you need to know about Bangkok or have a good map

What can be said it's a train that gets you from where you are to where you want to go Peak times it can be crowded so if using the Airport Link to Makkasan and then the MRT be prepared to push your way through the crowd  Used the MRT from Sukhumvit to Phetchaburi one evening around 6PM and had to wait until the 3rd train before being able to get on
Avoid the queus in BKK and take the quick BTS and MRT  It is very cheap too  I even use it to go to business meetings

as traffic in BKK is a nightmare you can escape it by using the MRT If you start at a big crossing like Sukhumvit the queues for ticketing can be long but all in all you never queue for more than 5 to 10 minutes

Refer to my review of the sky train Same comments apply Cheap and easy to utilize Tickets for this are below street level Once paid the kiosk dispenses a plastic 'coin' that you have to tap on the baracade (gate) in order to walk through to the platform Your large backpack or purse may be searched by security Once at your destination drop your plastic coin into the baracade (gate) to exit There is AC on the MRT and announcements are in both Thai and English
The MRT is a fast way to connect within the inner City It is new and clean and the ticket machines are easy to operate

The best way to get around Bangkok very fast Cheap and clean Only one negative When you go through the gates do it fast I have some blue and purple marks where the closing gates hit me And my husband as well And no we went through asap
MRT is also connected with BTS (Skytrain) and Airport link but no cross ticket available so far Better have coins with you so no need to queue Average price like 40 THB
You can travel around fast n cheap can connect with BTS at a couple of major BTS stations  Easy to navigate around all signs are in english and thai

There's a limited route at present Over 60's get half price travel Unlike Skytrain which is always packed One tip for the Skytrain is to get a 'Rabbit' card to save queuing to get change for the machines or the machines themselves at bust times
Beats getting stuck in traffic I like the BTS better cause you're above ground but this is just as clean and easy to navigate Take public transportation when you can avoid a taxi
It is the best and efficient way to get around most of the places in Bangkok Its fast reliable and cheap
Easy to use and takes you to many parts of the city Although it is often crowded it is also air conditioned and clean

reviewTitle: Quick way to travel accross Bangkok
reviewText: best way to travel in the busteling city of Bangkok regardless of the time of day or weather condition  Suggest to purchase the MRT card for easier commute

reviewTitle: The MRT is a great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: The MRT system here reminds me of the MRT in Singapore If you can figure out the MRT and BTS systems you can get to many places and avoid traffic and delay

I like riding in Bangkok's MRT system It's a far cry from other Asian train systems I've tried before It's very clean aircon is working properly there are protective gates before the rail tracks It can get very crowded though during busy times in the day

reviewTitle: Inexpensive traffic jam busting way to get around!
reviewText: Like the BTS MRT is a great way to avoid traffic jams if you can use it  Cheaper than BTS on similar distances it has less frequent trains though  Some stations allow exchange with BTS but these are separate tickets  Like BTS you can buy a card to avoid line up at machines counters for individual tickets   If there were more lines and an integrated ticket with BTS this would be awesome

If you have used Metro systems before you'll be familiar with this and find your way easily  All signs are in English and easy to follow  The MRT is the underground system and the BTS the above ground system   There are interchanges at various points  A much easier and more comfortable way to get around Bangkok than buses or taxis

MRT was our everyday transport option I can say no bad words Train was always on time names of station were spoken also in english It is similar to BTS I would say almost the same Cheap easy travel Tickets are sold in ticket mashines or in information center in the station Price depend of station where you travel
The MRT is clean conveniewnt and fast Its a great way to get around town without being stuck in endless traffic jams
Cheap clean civilised air conditioned frequenteverything you could want from a city train system The only negative is that coverage isn't widerparticularly to the West of the city

reviewTitle: Like Skytrain necessary to travel Bangkok
reviewText: This is the second best way to traverse Bangkok The subway will take you all over Bangkok or you can travel to a station then finish your journey with a taxi  When traffic above is in gridlock during the day you can speed to your destination quickly The subway is new clean and on time Again when I take the subway the cars are filled with mostly Thais they know the best way

This metro puts all others I have been on to shame This is highly organized clean air conditioned and quiet Cant emphasize enough how nice it is to see a big city with a fully functioning public transportation system This along with the Skytrak you can get almost anywhere easily I do wish the metro was located more widely

reviewTitle: Gets you from A to B as long as your hotel is close to all stations and lines.
reviewText: Service has been around for quite some time Very busy at peak shopping and office hour times Some stations have esculators however stairs are it and only for fit and able
Very easy to navigate  Ensure you have plenty of change to buy tickets or invest in a reloadable card
Efficient Clean and easy to use More locals than tourists The blowing AC is a big bonus during the humidhot days of the city

reviewTitle: Beat the traffic jams with this!
reviewText: We took a can back to out hotel from MBK with our shopping and was stuck for almost an hour next day we walked back using the Skywalk and was in Central World in half an hour Was nice to look down at the jam when using the BTS
A safe fast cheap way to get around Bangkok  If more than 3 are travelling you may consider a taxi  Get a MRT map to plot your travel

We got the MRT from close to our hotel bought tickets at ticket office no problem so easy to use only two lines just check maps on platform for which side you need really clean and no pushing and shoving Would highly recommend giving it a go

Oh yes the dreaded Dehli Belly similar to Bangkok Bottom hit me as we were in the MRT station at Lumpini Park No options but to appeal to the lovely lady with the keys to the toilet  Absolutely amazing to travel on a swift and clean underground I would recommend it to all travellers in Bangkok
this is a good train service runs fairly often and is a quick service easy for tourists to use Covers most of the main areas in Bangkok and those it doesnt are covered by the BTS(sky train)

reviewTitle: Take MRT to avoid stocked in trafic jams
reviewText: MRT with it's tweo lines is a good safe and cheap way to get fast especially during Peak times to lot's of interstuing oints in BKK City Be Aware it's very cold due to aircon

reviewTitle: The best place to get around
reviewText: MRT is definetely the best way to get around It is quite cheap fast and comfortable Easy to understand also in English where and how to go

reviewTitle: easy access to many attractions around the city away from the skytrain route
reviewText: very frequent trains run in a network system serving many parts of the city chatuchak market lumpini park amongst many other destinations
MRT beats Sky Train only because it is less crowded and so much more peaceful I love it Although its connectivity is slightly limited however all popular spots can be accessed through MRT

reviewTitle: Not as well known as the Skytrain but equally good
reviewText: A truly brilliant example of how to shorten your travel time considerably during long trips in BangkokSure tuk tuk and motorcycle its charm but when you want to think smart and effective competition gets bumpy

A very good transport option especially during rush hours Stations and trains are very clean All stations have lifts and escalators internally The exits to ground level might not be wheelchair accessible though (only escalators available) There is a crowd during rush hours which is typical of city subways just like other cities The MRT system stops at many key local attractions like Chatuchak area (Kampheng Phet and Chatuchak Park MRT) Union Mall (Phahon Yothin MRT) Talad Rod Fai Ratchada Train Market (Thailand Cultural Centre MRT)   Lumphini Park  Silom area (same name MRT) and Chinatown  Yaowarat area (Hua Lamphong MRT) It also provide convenient transfers to the BTS sky train at Chatuchak Park MRT  Mo Chit BTS and Sukhumvit MRT  Asoke BTS and also a link to the Suvarnabhumi Airport rail link at Phetchaburi MRT  Makkasan Station of Airport Link
unless you're flush  then you can take a taxi and stay stuck in the traffic  and the heat  The train system is wonderful  and clean
I use this often it's a great way to get about the crowded city smooth and efficient although obviously busy at rush hour Some of the platform are vast but always spotless

reviewTitle: My favorite way to get around the City
reviewText: The MRT service in Bangkok is simply amazing I think I would miss out on half the places I have visted in Bangkok if MRT didn't exist Although the payasyougo ticketing process is a bit more complicated than that of the BTS but one will eventually learn to do it in no time
Nice cheap quick efficient way to travel around Bangkok Definitely recommend this for anyone traveling around Bangkok
We tried using the MRT this trip and found it very convenient to get to chatchuchak and Or Ton Kor market not expensive
Very easy transport system to use and cheap for getting around the city beats getting a taxi any day
Connects with both the Airport Link and the BTS   Here's a hint if you ask the ticket seller for a senior discount (60 & over I think) tickets are half price

reviewTitle: Air Conditioned comfort with nice trains
reviewText: The MRT stations and platformed are all fully air conditioned making for comfortable transit and the trains are quite new and move quickly from station to staion
Easily accessible efficient and pleasant way to discover some of Bangkok's main attractions and much faster than taxis especially during rush hours However with only one line it has limited reach

reviewTitle: Fast, safe and easy way around Bangkok
reviewText: The MRT is a fantastic way around Bangkok fast cheap and safe better to use this than the dodgy taxi drivers that overcharge or drop you in the middle of nowhere

a fast way to transit the city the MRT isnt really used by locals thus is very quiet and unlike any other train system in Bangkok it is easy to grab a seat The prices are reasonable but not as cheap as the bts Very fast and reliable

reviewTitle: You must travel by MRT to save time and see city
reviewText: You must rely on MRT to get around the city its the best public transport you can rely on Taxi in Bangkok are expensive and may rip you off and on the top of that traffic in peak hours is insane so its best to take MRT

Probably the best way to travel in Bangkok The fares are cheap and trains are generally not that crowded compared to the BTS Great transportation service to utilize when going to your shopping destinations like Terminal 21 and Chatuchak

Thailand Metro was pretty easy with the assistance that was given to us from the Help Centers The train was pretty crowded but dropped us very near to our shopping destination and was really pocket friendly

reviewTitle: By far the best way of travelling in Bangkok
reviewText: Forgot taxis uber and Tuk Tuks this is by far the quickes and cheapest way of getting around Bangkok

Great place to shop Some floors are normal stores and then other floors have market stalls where you can barter for bargains Outside there is more market stalls and also plenty of food stalls Great place to go to escape the heat

reviewTitle: good as ever BUT getting more n more crowded
reviewText: increasingly more traincarriages may be needed s there appears to be more  more passengers even not at peak hours ditto with the BTS which appears to be always full esp in popular town stops cheap affordable for tourists  efficient and along with the expansion of lines will provide eve ngreater access thru BKK

The best way to get around Save on taxi fare n haggling with the Tuk tuk drivers Local people n staff are helpful will guide with which station to get off at It's not overly crowded except for the morning office n school rush Recommended mode of travel for Bangkok
Clean convenient inexpensive and easy to use  Not as convenient as BTS but between the 2 systems it's pretty good to great around BKK

reviewTitle: Only covering a small area of the city
reviewText: Unfortunately the MRT is only covering a small area of the city and there s no way you can get to the important stuff in Bangkok by using it This is the only downside The stations and trains are clean you can buy tickets easily and the system is very well explained
useful while switching to reach NANApreferred BTS because of the skyline viewsnot at all crowded

reviewTitle: cheap, fast, very cold from AC
reviewText: its very cheap and you can just Forget the traffic jam make sure you dont sweat before going there or bring something along they cool it down like Northpole
Do not confuse between the MRT and Sky train Both are mass rapid transport but the routes are different Th egirls at the conter are very helpful You can get coins for the ticket machine from them

Like the BTS the MRT gets you around the city in an easy manner  Because it is underground you don't get the views but again it is easy to know where you are because of the signs on the walls of the car  Always announced ahead the stop  Easy system to use  Inexpensive  Can get crowded depending on the time of day

reviewTitle: Some of the stops were rather close to each other because....
reviewText: Some of the stops were rather close to each other because the way it was set up there were some shopping stops only

we like all MRT station                                                                                    its very nice and clean                                                                                you will be enjoy                                                                                 easy to move around bangkok                                                            Now your life is easy Guys
Fantastic and cheap mode of transport You got to queue up to buy the tokens which can potentially take some time All the staff spoke English
There is nothing much exciting about riding the tube The network still isn't anywhere dense enough to cover the city but if there is a line this is usually the fastest way of travel

reviewTitle: MRT is also very good and stations on the BTS
reviewText: a lot of people don't no the MRT only the BTS  (skytrain) De MRT is more for longer distance I use it when i go from Sukhumvit soi 20 to Chatuchak Park its faster and also nice
Modern transportation that we dont have in our country it was clean and nice air conditioner its just the staff couldn't speak in english

reviewTitle: If your confident to use it then it's a great mode of transport
reviewText: If you know your way around and confident of using it then this is a great cheap way of getting around BKK  just remember this is not for tourists only this is general transport for native residents of BKK who are involved in everyday living  so don't expect any airs and graces  don't get me wrong Thais are never rude but this is their world you need to fit in here not the other way around
Still not mature Line is single and serve only a few places Extension is in progress High security checks for entry Safety for everyone

reviewTitle: The cleanest and safest way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: This is the underground subway that you together with Skytrain can travel cheap quick and very safe around bangkok

Extremely clean Puncture You either pay at a computer terminal and select station then receive coin token tap ontop gate to enter put in gate to exit Or get the MRT card and top up the card to avoid queues for  token machine  English language is widely used on signage  Security cards search your bag (briefly) and you walk through airport type metal detector  Value for money some exits only have stairs and others have escalators elevators

reviewTitle: One of the best train systems I ever used
reviewText: I love the train system in Bangkok well run safe clean and convenient It makes getting around town simple and easy The pass system offers good short term deals and makes it easy to get in and out without a long line
the MRT is so convenient and quite reasonable a very fast mode of transportation ticketing system and finding the platform is very easy too overall very good and efficient
bangkok is famous for its ridiculous traffic try to take the MRT if poss as it will save time the taxi costs the same but takes 45min + during rush hour to get anywhere central

reviewTitle: Modern and easy to access metro line
reviewText: very modern and safe way to travel through the city more modern than in all cities I know in Europe or USA Unfortunately there are not enough lines yet

If you plan to visit a few night markets and tourist spots which are accessible from the MRT stations go with the day pass or 3 day pass It gives you unlimited rides for a certain amount and it could be well worth it if planned right and even better if you actually stay at a hotel near a station   Did have a few breakdowns and delays though but didn't affect my trip much
The MRT is so easy to use There are maps showing the various stops This is an inexpensive and easy way to get around the city The train is safe and clean

After many years of visiting Thailand and Bangkok finally decided to try the MRT on this trip  What a good and fun experience  Actually ended up using it on 4 different location since it was easy cheap and much quicker than a taxi  I can honestly say it was much easier than I had imagined  My trip from downtown to the Huai Kwang district was only 40 minutes and 120 baht compared to a taxi a night before for 90 minutes and 250 baht  We used it on numerous evening to get around downtown BKK and it was fun and easy each time

Though I only took it for 2 stations it can be extremely packed and uncomfortable during peak hours And if your group is 2 persons or more might be worth taking a cab Though could be caught in a traffic jam it's still more comfortable and cheaper at times

reviewTitle: Good way to reach your destination...
reviewText: I used the transport from airport to the bangkok city and it was very good and it was not so expensive like other transports Many times i used the mrt for various locations first mrt from airport to the city go at 530 am I am solo thats why i used the mrt because sometimes taxis are not so reliable in a new city We don't know the lauguage May taxi driver take long route to earn more from you

This is the underground of Bangkok The tickets for this cannot be interchangeable with Skytrain which is above ground There are some interconnecting stations between the two like in AsokeSukhumvit and Sala DaengSilom There may be others but I am not sure Overall a nice way to travel slightly more expensive than the skytrain Trust me avoid rush hour Its a mad house

reviewTitle: fast, clean and cheap way to travel Bangkok
reviewText: title says it all only one downside so far there is only one line connecting the train station with the north of Bangkok Several options for Interchange with BTS (skytrain and airport link

reviewTitle: Well organized and readily in English (best A/C in the world)
reviewText: We took the train out of curiosity but it was the easiest thing we did in Bangkok  And the air conditioning is pure luxury
The only way to get around Bangkok is by public transportationMetro Skytrain and boats All easy to use   The traffic is insane
The MRT is very east to navigate and will take a person to the sights within the city of Bangkok that you would like to see It is a great transit system
I was using only the MRT and BTS to move in bangkok The easiest cleanest way to go anywhere is Bangkok

reviewTitle: Very similar to Singapore MRT system
reviewText: This MRT is very similar to Singapore MRT systems it's also to have an experience it's less crowded compared to BTS unsure about the reasoning maybe it's due to the timing I've taken it

reviewTitle: Cheap and great way to see the city.
reviewText: The MRT is the subway of BangkokIt is cheap and efficientI always try to get a hotel near a station if possible to save walking and using a Taxi or Tuk TukGreat place to hide if there is a war or natural disaster as it is underground

MRT is the subway underground of Bangkok I usually stay overnight near Asok so it is the most practical on weekends you can go to Chatuchack Wekend Market which is one of the largest in Bangkok and the world
First time I have used this and found it to be very quick and easy really great way to get round this busy city

reviewTitle: A good way to get round Bangkok
reviewText: Traffic problems in Bangkok can mean that using the MRT (and the BTS which link in two places Asoke on the Sukhumvit line & Sala Daeng on the Silom line) can be a good way to beat the traffic For a solo traveller BTSMRT can be cheaper but for 3 or 4 people a taxi is usually best for price The only downside to MRT ( & BTS) is buying ticketstokens at peak times The queues can be a nightmare
Like the BTS this service is tops Very clean and modern airconditioned carriages  gets quite busy at peak times  but thats to be expected

reviewTitle: EXCELLENT ACCESS TO BANGKOKS ATTRACTIONS EASY TO USE
reviewText: Very user friendly for tourists cheap day tickets provide limitless access to all stations & gets you away from the pollution & chaotic traffic jams at ground level
One of the cleanest and most reliable public transport in the world Limited network but it covers most of the areas a tourist wants to visit

reviewTitle: Great time at the Or Tor Kor food market
reviewText: At the recommendation of a local friend we visited the Or Tor Kor food market and had a great time  It is a huge market full of stalls selling all kinds of local food   fruits spices vegetables sea food staple food cooked or raw ingredients  Also attached with street food stalls where you can sit down to enjoy a local meal  Take the MRT blue line get off at Kamphaeng Phet station take Exit 3 and you are right there
We used this a couple of times as it goes to different locations than the Skytrain Clean fast and comfortable and very well priced You should certainly make use of this if you can

reviewTitle: Great Way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Great System very clean trains and stations they don't allow eating or drinking on the trains or at the stations best to purchase a pre paid M card just keep topping up when you need more credit can get very busy at times
MRT in Bangkok must be the easiest to use cleanest most efficient and well airconditioned subway system in the world  having travelled on many
This is a very good way to travel especially during rush hour when the traffic is at a standstill  Convenient to sights easy to use and relatively inexpensive
Most people use the BTS in Bangkok but the underground metro system can be quicker and less busy It does not have all the coverage of the BTS but still a clean hassle free way to travel

reviewTitle: Expensive if are in a group
reviewText: Efficient the stations are clean Expensive if you are in a group of 3 or more people Taxis are better has the drop to a point The traffic in the city is quite bad at times is when taking MRT makes sense
Very convenient to commute to and from major destinations can transfer to BTS at a few stations thought have to exit MRT first then walk a few minutes to BTS stations but acceptable
another fast and inexpensive form of transport in Bangkok especially in the rush hours a good alternative to taxi

reviewTitle: Great train service around central Bangkok, friendly staff. Even offers discounts for elderly tourists (BTS does not).
reviewText: I have used this for a year cheap FAST travel around BKK I use the prepaid Elderly pass I have used every stop on the line it is crowded during peak travel periods 6 to 10 am 12 to 1300 and 1600 to 1800 last run is at midnight

Airconditioned comfort (so long as you don't travel in the rush hour or at weekends) Cheap too with a oneday SkyTrain ticket costing around ‚Ç¨4 Only a few stations have escalators though and it's a long way up the steps in the heat
This MRT line is pass through many main road of Bangkok and can easily connect to the BTS line it is clean and well maintain highly recommend to use and choosing the hotel nearby
The service is like in all undergrounds but here in Bangkok very clean and save Problem is that there are only 2 lines For a big city like that absolutely not enough

Built some years ago MRT is an important addition to public transport in always traffic jammed Bangkok Facilities and coaches are very clean and signage is in English and Thai and easy to understand Since Thai people are very disciplined about queuing it is very smooth to use

MRT in Bangkok is the fastest way to travel Many of the major attraction are well connected with the MRT   Ticket vending machines help you purchase tickets Day passes are also available Crowded during office hours but a nice experience
Very pleasant sightseeing on MRT love the ambience and mixed with the locals  Enjoy the smoothness and efficient travel here
Similar to the sky train but the MRT is so fast getting you to your destination very quick Easy and highly recommended way to travel around Bangkok Can be extremely crowded though
the subway station is easy to buy token and to understand their map station is spotlessly clean maybe I wasn't there for rush hour but it was empty both times I used the subway love it

reviewTitle: Very easy way to get around the bustling city of Bangkok.
reviewText: We found that the train system in Bangkok is very well run It is very affordable trains run very frequently and are very well presented and kept clean The ticketing system was very easy to use We travelled into Hua Lamphong from the Pratunam area and found it (as foreigners) very easy to use Compared to home the system runs extremely well and is very cheap to travel on We had to change from the BTS to the MRT system and it was easily done with a great walkway linking the two  It's the best way to get around Bangkok without having to battle with all the traffic

reviewTitle: Great way to travel around the city
reviewText: MRT is the fastest way to get around bangkok taking you around the city's key areas it is easy to navigate and use

reviewTitle: the best way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Having been coerced many times by my inlaws to travel through Bangkok by private car or taxi which really just equates to frustration headaches and waiting in tons of traffic we have learned that the smart people use the MRT to get around Bangkok congestion free Stations are plentiful it's cheap and safe The MRT is the only way to travel efficiently in Bangkok

We were visiting just as Rama V died sadly so they busy streets of Bangkok were even busier Thank goodness for trains we used them daily Easy to navigate and staff at each station most helpfultheir main function us providing change for machines Easy to use machines require justca touch of the station you are traveling to and it displays the cost then you feed the coins requiredand ticket delivered Super efficient and easy to follow You get the opportunity to select the language you want the instructions for use in   Brilliant service
As underground trains go this is amongst the best of them Easy to navigate clean frequent and well designed Dovetails quite well with other surface trains
good system on its own but when used in tandem with the sky train you can reach most places of interest in Bangkok

reviewTitle: BE AWARE OF DODGY TAXI DRIVERS
reviewText: Trains where a good option as i got ripped of a few times by taxi drivers tuk tuk to me worked best but it is essential to negotiate and confirm a price

The MRT is great and easy to use avoid the peak periods as the trains are crushed loads and you may miss a train due to not being able to get on Cheap and efficient to use  carry change in multiplies of 10 baht coins or buy a travel card
Bankok has metros both above the ground (BTS Skytrain) and below the ground (MRT) Explore it its so easy and fast to get around
The MRT's are good to travel within BKK Taxis are horrible due to the traffic MRT's are well served and it covers good distance too
If you hate heat and traffic congestion then this is the way to travel Be sure to orient yourself prior to using the system It is very efficient to travel this way

Easiest transport to use in Bangkok You just need to go to the MRT Station get one free transport map at the airport pick your destination go to the ticket machine choose English and put the money (cashcoin) in That's it Then take the ticket to the gate  You can go everywhere by using MRT and BTS in BKK

We used it as it is quick easy and safe  Very cheap too  Highly recommend this form of transport  Trains travel about every 7 minutes so if you miss one there is one coming along soon  It connects to Skyrail too

Very convenient and cheap public transportation to and from central Bangkok and outer areas Great locations of the stations and connections to other public transportations Unfortunately limited possibility for handicapped people to use it due to few elevators mostly none

To my experience for Transportation I prefer to take the BTS rather than MRT MRT looks old & unfurnished When you are at the platform there is no signage for the train direction or infformation & the train is old & a bit dirty

reviewTitle: Clean, efficient and cheap way to travel around
reviewText: Straight forward underground system in Bangkok very clean very efficient   Great way to travel around the city and beat the heat  Its also a better way to travel as opposed to hopping in a cab and having to deal with cab drivers with limited English and avoiding tuktuks and traffic that would just cost you a lot more money  The MRT is cheap We travelled a couple of stations averaging about 19baht per trip

reviewTitle: EXCELLENT WAY TO GET AROUND BANGKOK
reviewText: I highly recommend the MRT  Its cheap always runs on time there are trains every few minutes & you have zero traffic delays
It's similar to BTS just that it's underground If only there is linked walkway from the BTS it will be much more convenient

MRT is easy to use navigate and always clean and punctual  One of the main interchanges with the BTS is at Asok (Terminal 21) which is a good stop off point for some shopping and food  Be prepared and have coins for the machines otherwise you have to stand in line for the cashier

reviewTitle: Fast, clean, safe, cheap and efficient
