reviewText: Excellent way to get around Bangkok Goes to areas not covered by the BTS You can get to Hua Lamphong (main Thai railway station connecting all of Thailand and beyond) via the MRT and the whole of the Thai railway is then at your disposal and very good it is too If you are over 65 get an 'elder' card you get a 50% reduction on the MRT available at all MRT stations Like the BTS trains are frequent clean and safe Good if you can avoid peak times as it gets very busy 18 stations in all running from Bang Sue to Hua Lamphong next to Chinatown Cost is cheap a seven station run cost me 15THB (¬£033GBP) double the cost if under 65 years old

Using Public Transportations in Bangkok While maybe not as enjoyable as commenting in your personal vehicle But if you want to travel in the city centre of Bangkok MRT is one of the best public transportation that can help you to avoid from the traffic jam

MRT was easy to navigate and inexpensive Beware It's crowded at rush hour People are friendly and helpful and with some persistence you can always find someone who speaks enough English to point you in the right direction if you don't speak Thai

A good way to get around Bangkok fast and very reasonable with hookups to other modes of transportation through out Bangkok very clean and on time  one of the best I've used while traveling  recommended
Together with the BTS the MRT have changed Bangkok forever  Spotlessly clean cool fast and economical  Brilliant public transport system
Have used it many times and its a great way to travel around Bangkok If you can get a prepaid card as the ques can be very long to pay Clean fast and efficient

reviewTitle: "Best city transport I have been on in South East Asia"
reviewText: The MRT connects with the BTS at various destinations and you can travel within and some outer parts of the city comfortably and the price is right Extremely clean air condition trains on going information given for each station  what more can you ask for The best way to travel within Bangkok The staff are very courteous and all stations maintain full security at station entrances and on the the trains I feel very safe to travel on either the BTS or MRT  On your next trip use the services you won't regret it

reviewTitle: Easy way to travel, same as skytrain
reviewText: As said in the title this is an easy way to travel If you view my review for the skytrain you can copy this The combination of MRT  skytrain and taxi will bring you everywhere

reviewTitle: Not as corded as the sky train
reviewText: Went to chatuchak this method of transport was fast and easy and not overcrowded as bts infact if you go one train station further than the chatuchak park station to kampung phet you do not have to walk to reach market you are in the middle of it

reviewTitle: A great way to Reach destinations in Bangkok avoiding traffic
reviewText: Together with BTS It is the most efficient way to reach far areas avoiding traffic in Bangkok Trains run punctual every few minutes and they are all kept very clean
good with BTS to connect a fast way to move in town and avoid heavy dirty rush hour with polution and crazy drivers

Was a little bit apprehensive at first but all good We saved coins for the ticket machines but they take small notes too Instructions come in English chose your destination pay your money and get a token which you use to get to the platform then deposit at the exit of your destination Simple fast and convenient Cost 25 baht per person for a 5 stop journey one way
Cheap clean and easy to use A local man was extremely helpful and walked us to our destination Map easy to read
We didn't use the MRT as much as the skytrain but when we did we were happy with our trips  The trains were clean and efficient

reviewTitle: Clean and convenient but train schedules are a little too slow
reviewText: I use the skytrain more often in Bangkok when traveling alone but with elderly parents the MRT system offers the advantage of many more escalators instead of having to climb stairs It's incredibly cheap but the touch screen ticket machines can be hard to use sometimes so I would recommend queuing to use the kiosk especially if you are with a few people the staff are extremely helpfulthey even asked my parents' age to offer them senior citizen discounts The network isnt as extensive as the BTS Skytrain but still it takes you close enough to major areas such as Sukhumvit (Terminal 21 shopping center and Cabbages and Condoms restaurant) Silom (Patpong Night Market) and Chatuchak Park weekend market
On time Reasonable price (BTS is a bit more expensive I think) Clean   Helpful staff You can get to almost every important destinations in city (china town chatuchak market or get to the BTS station)

reviewTitle: Easy to navigate and buy tokens
reviewText: Tap 'English' on the screen then touch the station you want to go to put in the bills and coins get a token Touch the token at the turnstile to enter drop it in the slot to exit People making change are nice Connects to the Sky Train and Airport train It gets crowded at rush hour but still useful and faster than taxis
Buy a rabbit card for stress free travelling and avoid queueing at the ticket booth Quick and efficient service

A majority of our traveling was done on the MRT and BTS systems Both are extremely to navigate and very affordable There is an English option and you simply pick what station you need to go to and the fare is calculated  In hindsight I should have gotten the fare card instead during my stay  The line ups to the vending machine can range from non existent to 12 hour depending on the station You get a token where you swipe to enter the gates and upon existing you insert the token So don't lose your token

reviewTitle: A good way to get around
reviewText: Bangkok subway system doesn't share tickets or travel cards with BTS or airport rail normally 1 station transport is 16thb
Beside the Skytrain the perfect transportation system due to the huge traffic It's cheaper than Taxi and you can reach a lot of destinations

Not the best The queue to buy the tickets were so long they had 2 machines and it took me 25 minutes just to get to the window After arriving on the platform the screen said train arriving and it did but 2 minutes later lol Very busy and packed

reviewTitle: Way to expensive for a city like BKK
reviewText: If you are a family of 4 and above or a group of 68 then this option to travel is pathetic  Its way to expensive You might have to walk also too much to react the train  Taxi or tukk tuk will be much cheaper and comfortable  If there is too much traffic then tuk tuk Or else always take taxi so much better Use grab to book

Very effective and efficient service Try the MRT before you even consider other forms of transportation The rail maps are very easy to follow As a senior I was very impressed with the kindness and politeness of the Thai people I even used to travel on the MRT in busy times and was always offered a seat on a packed train Get a smart card this is similar to the oyster card in London Just swipe in and out of stations very efficient way to travel Highly recommend
well connected to the skytrainwell maintainedit was very neat and proper announcements were there
Most convenient way of travelling in bangkok are the trains especially mrtbtsairport ling You can travel fast and cheap

Stayed at the Centara & whilst it is an amazing hotel I'm not interested in shopping so headed up to Sukhumvit the MRT station was really close by (Phaton Yothin exit 4) our destination Sukhumvit was a mere 8 stations away at a cost of 32 Bahts each or ¬£285 for both returns awesome value for money but get back before 1130 as certain exits close Trains only operate in 2 directions Bang Sue (that is the train you require for your home journey) or Hua Lamphong for our central destination whilst incredibly busy the crowds disperse quickly but unlike Dubai the Thai people are patient (don't have odour issues) & wait in turn what does amuse me is the sheer number on their mobile phones nobody communicates in person with each other any more don't be deterred amazing üòâ way to travel & very cheap Just about every aspect of this country is awesome
Bangkok MRTSubway is one of the easiest way affordable and more convenient transportation for travelers to roam around Bangkok city  They have tickets for 1 day or for a week for tourists
The MRT is clean fast mode to travel in Bangkok but difficult to get a seat ( no issue) i advice using MRT in busy areas during rush hour to avoid BKK mad traffic specially on Mondays and Fridays

pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and efficiency of the metro and trains as well as the well behaved people waiting for passenger to get out before getting in themselves the single tickets is by carrying a coin and gets swallowed on the way out then reused afterwards which avoids any paper consumption  And great addition (and necessary) option which is the very well appreciated Air Conditioning  )

reviewTitle: An easy way to get around Bangkok, a great system MRT
reviewText: The MRT is a great underground rail system that also connects to the BTS Sky rail  You might find your first experience obtaining your ticket a little difficult as it is different to the BTS system the touch screen is the same system as used on the MTR in Hong Kong so if you have used that system it will be easy  The system is in Thai and English so select English and if you know the station where you want to go to then touch that station and you will see your fair come up insert your money and out will come a round disc you swipe the disc as you go through the entrance and when you are leaving you insert the disc into the slot and the gate opens  If you are uneasy about using the system for the first time then go to the office and buy your disc there as the staff are very good and very helpful I would suggest trying to use the system during the quiet time as at peak times there are hundreds of people all lined up waiting to get there disc  If you are going to be in Bangkok for a few days or longer and using the MRTa lot i would suggest you buy a ticket from the office as you can top up the ticket at any MRT office for as little as 100 Baht = Aust $4 the card will cost you a few dollars and is not refundable but the time you will save standing in lines and having to carry change for your ticket then it is well worth while i use the card all the time as it is so easy and quick and very quick to top up  The MRT is a very fast service and if you miss one train there is usually another train with in about 4 minutes the trains are very clean and like the BTS there is no drinking or food to be eaten and do not leave your rubbish on the train take it with you and show respect for the other people  Entering the MRT station is the same as the BTS there are security guards to inspect your bags and luggage as they are there for all our safety When on the station stand behind the yellow line and to the side of the entrance to the train that allows the people to get off and makes it easy to get on that is the same system as the BTS

We got a all day pass to go to the markets but we would have been better off with just a normal fare This transport gets very crowded so be prepared to stand For those who don't like crowds taxis are very well priced

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: This is an ideal way to get around Bangkok Clean efficient and runs every 5 minutes or so  Great addition to the public transport in Bangkok

We used the MRT everyday during our stay in Bangkok multiple times When you visit if your planning on using it a lot get a travel card they are very cost effective   The MRT was very very clean fast you get full phone signal and Internet through every station and tunnel There are also flat screen TVs which play adverts and music   All the machines have an English language button so very understandable Also when entering the MRT all backpacks are checked so very safe

reviewTitle: Excellent - clean and runs on time
reviewText: Very convenient and cheap to use  I used it daily  A very good alternative to taxis  It is well supported by locals as a way to get back and forth to work
It's fast and clean and also reach area that the BTS doesn't reach If you want to go to China town with no traffic like if you use car then MRT it is
MRT subway is very efficient & effective & clean  Easy to learn your way around  Moves much quicker than the cars on the road

Clean and efficient as long as you skip rush hourThe trains are short but with limited correrage of the city this isn't a problem As a tourist MRT can useful to get to between the main areas in combination with the Skytrain

reviewTitle: Great way to avoid the traffic
reviewText: Even though there is only one line (which does connect to the BTS system at some places) it is a fast efficient and clean way to cover some distance outside of the hectic traffic Easiest is with a card to avoid queues at the vending machines and pensioners can get this card with a 50% discount

reviewTitle: ANOTHER SECRET WEAPON AGAINST BANGKOK TRAFFIC GRIDLOCK
reviewText: The MRT system is relatively new It is an undereground train system that compliments the elevated train system known as the BTS or ‚ÄúSky Train‚Äù The two systems share several adjacent locations to ease transition from one to the other most notably the Asoke intersection on the BTS Sukumvit line Best advice find the station closest to your destination in the city and go there via the BTS and MRT Once at that station it will be easy to hail a cab for the final leg thus reducing your total transit time significantly As with the BTS system and ecoworld has blossomed around the street level of most stations where you will find ‚Äústreet‚Äù food vendor as well as flower and various hawkers of goods

reviewTitle: Pricey but clean and not crowded
reviewText: During my visit to Bangkok I have mainly used the MRT to go to Hua Lumphong to Silom after strolling around Chinatown both during the day and in the evening The underground is incredibly clean efficient and cool compared to the heat outside i have also noted it never gets too busy as there are trains very often and given its slight high price (for Thai standards at least) Overall I was very pleased whenever I used it and I suggest it as a safe traffic free means of transportation to everyone

The MRT Underground Train is in good company in Bangkok with the BTS Skytrain  both provide public transport at a world class standard If you're staying within close proximity to one the stations of either service they should be your primary transport whilst in Bangkok  if you're not staying within close proximity I suggest you should consider relocating   If the MRT doesn't get you to one of the mustsee attractions around Bangkok the Skytrain likely will  and viceversa  Skytrain offers the views of BKK whilst perched above the ground in airconditioned comfort but MRT stations provides a reprieve from the heat whilst waiting for air conditioned trains to come along   The MRT and Skytrain each have an interchange station with the Airport Train to and from the basement of Suvarnabhumi Airport  again a great world class service that gets you as close to the airport as a taxi does I'm also a huge fan of the Airport Train (cheap very reliable and avoids horrendous traffic) and there's another airport link being constructed at the moment (Sep 2016) to service BKK's other major airport at Don Mueang
The underground is an easy and cheap way to get around in Bangkok Every station has clear and understandable maps of the train system

reviewTitle: Best transit system in the world
reviewText: It's cheap fast and reliable  Very well connected to buses tourist attractions nightlife and business district  All countries should have an MRT like Singapore

The trains here are very convenient Local residents use it to go to work so in the mornings the trains are usually full There is a security controlling people getting into the train so as to avoid injuries Excellent service I have ever seen in the trains

This train system is less hectic and less crowded than BTS You may find the train frequency is lower than BTS You saves a lot of time using this rail system much better than going on the roads of Bangkok
We used the MRT on one of our private tours and found it to be very well utilised  It is a most efficient way to travel in Bangkok

Similar to the BTS (above ground train) the MRT brings you to areas mainly to the fringe of Bangkok Connection from the BTS and MRT is smooth as they are mainly connected However cross used of train tickets are not permitted This means you have to buy separate tickets to take the individual train Nevertheless it is a great mode of transport  clean and I meant really clean and efficient
I have used the MRT many times  It is very easy to use buying a ticket is simple and there are many stops within Bangkok for travelers to help get them to their ultimate destination

As impressed with Airport Rail Link we are absolutely impressed with the MRT  It is well connected with BTS and comfortable  Thailand government has really done a lot to improve the linkage between locations  Also the price is very reasonable compare with being stuck in traffic

reviewTitle: Clean and nice but covers so less
reviewText: It was quick clean and modern but it didn't cover soo much of the city I wish it went further I always had to hop to the sky train mostly after i was out of the mrt or catch a cab
We found out that you can get tickets for the day get on and off all day very good value we were on it for a day going to different places

reviewTitle: One of the best ways to explore BKK
reviewText: The under ground rail network of BKK is called  MRT and is one of the best and fastest ways to get to many places in BKK  It will save you huge time  much cheaper than taxi   There are several  stations where MRT meets the SKY train (BTS) and one can use BTS  MRT to reach most of part of main city and surroundings area   A bit of study of maps of city and finding out best combination to use BTS MRT to reach closest point to your destination will save you so much of time and money and you can explore much more of this lovely city without getting tired and frustrated with  traffic of the city   Trains and stations are very clean the staff is very helpful and even commuters are very helpful All boards are in also in English and Thai  Announcement of approaching stations are made inside the train So you are sure you will never get lost    great way to live like locals and explore city with time and money saving More importantly time

By far the best way to get around Bangkok  You can even take this from the Airport to within an easy walk of many hotels  I bought an MRT card because the lines  especially at Mo Chit can be a few minutes long  Safe way to get around in my humble experience

reviewTitle: good thing we are near the station........
reviewText: This is very efficient way to move around BKK Friendly to use since area where you will go already indicates how much the fare will be
Avoid traffic with this ease and convenience Traffic solutions in Bangkok saved by both the MRT and Skytrain

Cheap way of getting around bangkok to advoide traffice jamsthis system has connecting stations with the airport train service and the above ground sky train systemcheap point to point fares or check out the vaious passesthe only way to travel

reviewTitle: Clean , fast, easy better than taxi
reviewText: MRT  and sky train interchange help to go around city easily   AC in train give real relief in Hot bkk weather

easy to use and great value with most rides under 150us Many stops located at shopping malls or markets And always a good place to escape the heat   They have a day pass for 475us and 1 week or 30 days Not quite as useful for tourists as the BTS (skytrain) but still very useful

reviewTitle: Very convenient and cheap travel. Seniors get 50 Percent discount.
reviewText: Its a very fast transport mode and clean and comfortable Also the Metro Stations are very spacious and clean Not so freezing cold like BTS but a very good deal Especially cheap for Senior travellers as they get a 50 Percent discount Must buy the ticket or Chip at the Ticket counter
With the BTS MRT is the perfect complement to each other When I wanted to get to the Hua Lamphong railway station I took the BTS to Sala Daeng to switch to the Silom MRT station Easy peasy
MRT is much more cleaner than BTS and well connected for transfers from BTS at ASOKE and SALA DAENG
Easy and cheap MRT really easy for going to anywhere we want and not expensive so for traveller better use MRT

reviewTitle: Bangkok by railway is the best way !
reviewText: MRT is the perfect complement of BTS you can Rich the center of Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi Airport first by MRT until Playa Thai in which you can interchange with BTS just 7 stations away from the start at the airportin 20 minutes you can be in the center of Bangkok no taxi can bring you so fast from the airport  And for the price you will paid almost 6065 bth  Welcome to Bangkok Rail Link

Was not overly impressed with MRT as often the stations were very crowded and with long lines to buy tokens to get around They should really have more ticket machines given the number of people at some of the stations I think Friday night is the worst so I would avoid it all together   However it is straightforward to get around once you get on the train tokens are easy to buy and cheap (you can have screen on ticket machine in English) and the train is clean with aircon
I wish there were more lines highly efficient transportation Access to stations complicated (but not impossible) with cargo or people with disabilities

Pretty clean fast and not to expensive but i suggest that you should not take MRT on rush time which is  0600  0800 and 1700 1900 there are so crowded and awful  MRT will stop in many station for example  Phahol yothin station you can go to Central Ladprao Mall  Kamphaengphet dtstion you can go to JJ Market  Hua Lamphong station you can go to China Town etc If you have so much time in Bangkok you should try once
The best way to get around Bangkok It goes just about anywhere and even to Suvvarnabhumi Airport It's clean air conditioned safe cheap and fast
If you're sick of haggling with taxi drivers or window shopping from the comfort of your mostly stationary tuk tuk then head underground to the MRT It's superfast cheap cool and clean
Buy a travel card to avoid the long queue to get a ticket during peek hours you can refill your card as you want during your stay clean and safe
Great way to  travel around Bangkok and so simple and painless  AC to boot so you travel in   comfort  Be sure and  try  Jim at Maplelag in Minnesota

reviewTitle: We must wait  for MRT rather long.
reviewText: MRT BTS in Bangkok not covered in Ramkhamhaeng road the place where there are a lot of young people students‚Ä¶ We must wait  for MRT rather long Trains are clean  they have airconditioner the staff announced in English and Thai at each station The price is reasonable
Clean and fast and cool Do not take a taxi during rush hour You will experience hell traffic jam Take a MRT

As per the Sky Train system it would great if the MRT covered more places I'm used to the wonderful MRT network in Singapore where no place is more than 10 mins walk from station Buy a token from the machines on the platform Tickets are not interchangeable with BTS trains Trains are clean airconditioned and station announcements are in Thai and English

reviewTitle: Convenient and best way to roam around
reviewText: If you stay near sukhumvit or silom this is the best way to explore bangkok you would need exact amount in coins but there are exchange counters available at all stations If you are going to weekend market chatuchak or most popular malls are connectedyou can avoid traffic and overcharging taxis

What it does is very good ie clean cool and efficient But no interconnection with BTS and the use of old technology such as tokens came as a surprise For an adult family of three this can make the taxi where we met no problems and always on the meter a better offering
This is ok  very easy to use but with the view from the sky train  and just like any metro in  any city

Using the MRT and BTS you can explore a lot of Bangkok without sitting in time wasting traffic   Although the BTS is bigger and has better AC than the MRT I prefer the latter because it has 1 3 and 30 day unlimited monthly passes and you get to wait for it underground where the temperature is much cooler  The BTS and MRT interchange at two stops Mo Chit and AsokeSukhumvit  Like the BTS the MRT does get very crowded during peak hours and I would recommend avoiding Sukhumvit and stops adjacent to it during this time

reviewTitle: Its the best means of transport in bangkok.
reviewText: The MRT in Bangkok is one of the most convenient means of travel as roads are with heavy traffic and traffic jams are frequent Taxis can be expensive
very fast and convenient to go around Off set you cannot buy tickettoken for a group of people instead you have to buy 1 at a time
Fast and clean way to get around Bangkok to avoid the traffic  But the routes are quite limited  Check the map They also have a 1 day unlimited pass

This is a cheap efficient subway service that goes across the city for approximately the last 8 years Very efficient service You can buy a single oneway ticket or a 5 year pass Trains come every few minutes
If you are fed up of rude taxi drivers and pushy tuktuks the MRT is a great way to get to some outskirts of BKK especially if you are far from Sukhumvit
Affordable and easy to use Once you get the hang out of it is the easiest way to get around the city A taxi can be the same price but depending on the hour this will get you there faster

You can't ask for more than getting around Bangkok quickly without haggling with taxi drivers and getting the meter finally put on and then sitting in traffic forever  The MRT (with the BTS) will take you to most places you want to go in Bangkok where you only need to get a cab or tuk tuk for the last bit of your journey  It is super quick super clean has excellent air con and is a great way to get around  You won't be disappointed

It gets you where you need to go the maps in the stations and on the trains are spot on It is so wonderful to have such a luxury to be able to travel with such efficiency The staff at each station is very helpful as well

reviewTitle: It makes getting around Bangkok doable!
reviewText: The subway along with the Skytrain system makes one of the most gridlocked densely populated cities in the world much easier to get around in
Only a few years ago this underground system seemed to be not used by a public at all Since then it grown bigger and better and today it is a great way to move around Bangkok

MRT bangkok easy to use and cheap for the fare very fast some of the MRT can connecting us to BTS line very crowded if using this MRT for busy time because local people there using MRT as the main transportation to go work you can pay the ticket at machine and it can accept not only for coin the Mrt was treated very well good job

My wife & I have used the Blue line several times for both long & short trips  On every occasion we have found it to be most efficient  I even was granted "senior" discounts  The stations are extremely clean with courteous and competent cashiers  Boarding and disembarking is smooth even if the trains are full of passengers

We planned to use the Skytrain and MRT to get to the Thai Cultural Centre to watch Siam Niramit  We took the Skytrain from Siam to Asoke where we change to underground Sukhumvit MRT  This is where the nightmare started  There are several ticketing machines but some were down The remaining had such long queues its hard to believe its an underground MRT stations  The platform which we had to wait for the trains were much too narrow  Its obvious that the station was too small for the Bangkok population at large They are cramped hot and humid  They should not call it MRT (Mass Rapid Transit)

The Bangkok MRT is a very clean safe convenient and efficient way to travel in Bangkok The trains are just minutes apart The connectivity is very good Also the views while travelling are interesting for a tourist Much better to use MRT than get stuck in Bangkok traffic

People are usually surprised to find out that the mass transport systems in bangkok  both the MRT and BTS sky train are both clean efficient and affordable The MRT is the underground version of the sky train and runs to various areas within Bangkok not within the overhead versions routes It goes to strategic stops such as Hua Lampong  where the main train station is Lumpini  where the end of a big park startsends and Sukhumvit  where the connection to the sky train is located Buying a token is easy either at the counter or at the machines and the ride is user friendly There are maps guides and announcements being made prior every stop All in all a very good experience

The MRT is the underground rail the difference between the MRT and BTS is that on the BTS rail system you get a ticket to enter and exit the station whereas on the MRT you get a token  Trains are clean and well worth the small amount of Bth to use them

reviewTitle: A cool and great way to travel
reviewText: A good way to get out of the heat and traffic of Bangkok You basically get out of the horrendous traffic crawl and travel in a fast cheap and efficient way A cool and great way to travel

we used MRT duing our recent family trip when traveling around Bangkok fast and efficient mode of transport clean inside and instructions are in English It was easy for us to commute in Bangkok without getting stuck in traffic with Taxis Will recommend this for going to Chatuchak Market as that is the last station where the market is run and the Air conditioner is very good also so not feeling the heat
Transportation in Bangkok is always good Do yourself a favorforget about a taxi and go MRT or BTS if you can You will be much happier and faster if you do

reviewTitle: Great travel when You r in bangkok
reviewText: No more taxi travel for me when I am in Bangkok unless I land in Don Muemg autocrat where there is no rail services Just make sure u stay in a hotel where sky train n MRT stations r located n u will enjoy Bangkok better
cheap clean and accessible  This is the best way to get to the markets from the heart of Bangkok and is very accessible  Great fun
Absolutely recommend You will not get stuck in heavy traffic When you enter any of the stations you get cooled they too control bags to prevent terroristic attacks
What a fabulous rail service and easy enough to follow when you are an Aussie We got a little confused when we got off however but that's just because we had never used it before Just so hassle free

The MRT here is very similar to what I saw in Singapore even the MRT train smells the same I planned the whole journey according to the MRT map and it's highly recommend to solo traveler especially female to try MRT and BTS

reviewTitle: Dissapointed connection, too exhausted for walking, shittle bus etc.
reviewText: There is new MRT line(purple) serving northwest are (bangkoknonthaburi) there is very bad impression at the beginning BTS victory monument to connect Blue line MRT at Chatuchak station Walking connects to the station is very long and exhausted then I take the MRT to BangSue station and yes long walk to the waiting point for shuttle bus to the purple line Tao Poon station After nearly 30 minute wait I took a 1km ride to TaoPoon station and climbing to the platform which is same level of 3storeyed building How tough then I rode the brand new train to the 4th staton  Ministry of publib health needed to taking the mototaxi to reach my destination Total cost of this trip 120Baht with 115 hour so amazing long time as compared with less time and same cost for taking taxi Bad impression

reviewTitle: Great way to get around the city
reviewText: The stations are extraordinarily clean and security is Omnipresent  I took the MRT from JJ market (Chatuchak Park) to my hotel (Sukhumvit) and it was not real crowed and a very pleasant rideof course it was 10 at night  I think its a little less crowded than the BTS so its a great option   Don't LOSE your token  You need it to get in and out  This is a good option to beat the Bangkok rush hour traffic and still get to where you want to go  I would pick this over a Tuk Tuk and sucking exhaust fumes anyday
Too many customer on train I crushed against door Customer pushing me many times If less customer that best way to travel

reviewTitle: Quick cheap way to get around
reviewText: faster than a taxi and quite easy to get around Used it to get a good feel of the culture and people

reviewTitle: The easiest way to travel around Bangkok city!
reviewText: Subways are the best way to get around Bangkok It saves time more convenient and the fastest to wander in Bangkok BTS (skytrain) and the MRT (underground) provide a link of connection to help navigate your way You just have to make transfers to reach the destination
Functions like any other metro so easy to use Selfhelp machines and counters available Inexpensive clean and air conditioned

This system is currently limited in access to Bangkok We could see evidence of future expansion This was an easy system to navigate Ticket staff are very competent and we found this system easy to use Some of the security staff are more problematic with language and not understanding requests for directions and assistance

reviewTitle: great to get around City - be prepared for walking up and down stairs first
reviewText: convenient when staying in City as traffic is appalling  MRT much better for getting around  we stayed at Renaissance great location near to Chit Lom station so only 2 stops to the famous MBK shopping Centre

reviewTitle: Cheaper than bts and less crowded
reviewText: The mrt is a practical way of traveling around bangkok Prices are cheaper then BTS and the wagons are less crowded

reviewTitle: Like the BTS, quick and easy to use, though with limited stations
reviewText: The MRT is another very cheap and easy way to get around the city You buy tokens from an automated machine which required coins These could be exchanged for notes at the station counter The coins are pressed against the entry button on the turnstiles and collected on arrival at your station of choice Trains are very frequent though with limited station stops

Compared to the Sky Train MRT is less crowded and spaciously built Announcements are in proper English Less advertising billboards and Add Clips then BTS Definitely wheelchair friendly Little bit more expensive then BTS but it's worth the price Whenever MRT is near I prefer using them

reviewTitle: MRT has great fares and decent coverage of the main attractions in Bangkok
reviewText: Combining MRT with the sky train you are able to visit most of Bangkok attractions Add to that the river normal (not tourist) boats and you can visit the best of Bnagkok
Fast and convenient way to go to places Cheaper & faster compare to taxis They have a detailed map all over the place so its easy to use
the most cheapest way to go around bkk on time so clean  so quick  and a very good service at anytime

Easy and quick access to all the top visitors sites in Bangkok We used the MRT to get around Bangkok and to go from one shopping hub to the next  easy to get close to site seeing Save time as you not stuck in traffic and much cheaper than taxi
it's a good choice if you go to JJ market get off at Kamphaeng Phet station JJ market is just next to it

This subway is awesome I really like how on Google you can tell if walking MRT or taxi is going to be faster and usually MRT is faster They're expanding it with a bunch of new lines now I just rode the new purple line and it's even better than the old blue line I recommend you get a card because they're really cheap and very easy to refill

reviewTitle: Cheap easy way to get around
reviewText: Very easy to use clean good price no hassles Can go to chutacuck market all around Bangkok Also can go out to the airport too

reviewTitle: Cool way to travel and avoid heat and traffic
reviewText: It used to be said that if there were more three or four people in a group a taxi was not much more than BTS or MRT fares But that does not take into account the dramatic increase in traffic in Bangkok in recent years Provided your starting point and destination are not too far away the MRT is always going to be a cooler and often faster option But I do wish the ticket machines had the option of buying multiple tickets at the one time I suppose if you are going to use the system a lot it would make sense to get a stored value card I didn't need a toilet when at the station but I don't recall seeing any
although only have few lanes the design interior and everything very similar to singapore one they use token as ticket and accept notes and coins

Very good underground train with good access for people with physical limitations The areas of coverage are mostly for residence areas However if you want to visit the Night Flower market and not be too much in trafic jams you can take this train to its end station and tkae a taxi from there The train and stations are very modern and well organized Discount on tickets for children and seniors

reviewTitle: undispensable when on our way to commute in Bangkok
reviewText: easy to move in and out with escalators amd liftsreliable limiting waiting periods amd fastcleangood valuessafe not to be missed combined with BTS
What can I say I have used the train system in Sydney many times but the MRT leaves it for dead Very clean always on time (every 7 8 minutes) very modern Very cheap

The MRT is underground and old than the Skytrain The MRT has a wider coverage while the Skytrain covers mainly the most busy streets as of now The MRT is cheaper The stations and trains are clean but noisy Ticketing process efficient It is by far the fastest way to travel especially around rush hour (perhaps other than hiring a scooter that can weave between lanes in traffic

Ended up needing to use the MRT between the hours of 6 and 8 in the evening and it was horrible The queues were enormous and actually being on the train was frightening you could barely breathe there was so little space It's obviously cheap and convenient for locals but I would avoid at all costs unless absolutely necessary

reviewTitle: Fast way to zip around the city!
reviewText: And connects to BTS sky train so almost all the places you want to visit are doable with MRT and BTS
Check route on Bangkok map Links with BTS sky train in places such as Makasan Goes from main train station

Going by MRT is definitely more convenient compared to the crowded and poorly maintained BTS Stations are spacious and trains are modern clean and follow international safety standards Only network is more limited but work for expansion is already in progress Don't expect anything like the Octopus Card in Hong Kong the BTS runs a different system to MRT and in case you need to continue by bus it's again another system But frequency of MRT is great even it would be more professional in case arrival and time between trains would be displayed If possible I always prefer MRT over the BTS

This underground system is extremely good clean and efficient Once the new lines are completed then it will be the preferred way of navigating the city (in conjunction with the Skytrain) and have a longer range too
This is a great way to travel around Bangkok  Unfortunately the route is limited but you can link up with the skytrain if need be  The staff speak English and are nice and helpful
train and station is clean and comfortable for tourist But not integrated with BTS station sometime need to across street to reach BTS station

The MRT is a great mode of transportation while in Bangkok My suggestion to visitors is to get the card where you can put a certain amount of money on it so you don't have to keep going to the machines

Have used the MRT a few times over the last few days and it is so easy to use The stations are huge and air conditioned There are signs in both Thai and English and when using the ticket machines there is the choice to have an English screen Travel is cheap and so organized  There are arrows to tell you where to stand or walk  It is funny to see the huge stations when they are empty but during peak hour you can see why they are so big Today I even dragged a huge piece of luggage around on the MRT and did not have any problems There are lifts in most areas although in a few random places you will need to use stairs  Thai people are so friendly and try to help if they see that you are struggling Beats sitting in traffic

reviewTitle: A very good transport option in Bangkok
reviewText: Tired of Bangkok traffic congestions MRT is a very good options for moving around in the city It's easy to use runs frequent easy to orientate cheap and safe Combined with BTS skytrain your choices are even better

reviewTitle: "Mind the gap between train and platform"
reviewText: We rode the MRT subway so many times in our stay in Bangkok that we pretty much had all the notifications memorized  Clean and inexpensive travel  the only problem was during rush hour when everyone was trying to get home  Then it got crowded

reviewTitle: Easy to use and great to get around
reviewText: Really simple to use and when used in conjunction with the boats its a simple way to get around bangkok and experience the city
If staying in Bangkok you could do a lot worse than pick a hotel near an MRT station Just as easy to navigate as the sky train but not as busy A joy to use

Clean efficient low cost fast transportation to many points in the city Generally runs ns vs ew on the BTS Underground so the view isn't s good as BTS but  little cheaper Some great service and transportation   Easy switch over between MRT nd BTW at asoke
MRT is a convenient and easy way to go around in Bangkok  It is also cheap and run frequently  It is also quick and safe

reviewTitle: Convenient to commute in Bangkok city center
reviewText: With traffic congestion in Bangkok MRT is a great way to move around in the city center You can also connect to the BTS sky train which is also convenient

reviewTitle: Great way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Clean easy to use very VERY organized even during extreme peak hours stations are placed in all the major points in the city and of course you get to beat trafficI didn't take the taxi at all while I was there because my hotel was a 2 second walk from the station and the train took me where I needed to go Of course once you go shopping and need to take the train back to the hotel with a gazillion bags it can be interesting hahaha but I managed
IT s an underground rail network and has good connectivity it saves your time and operates till 1130pm

Not all station are strollerhandicap friendly but the ticketing counter staff are definately friendly and helpful Fees are relatively cheap and most important punctual People are nice there where they won't hesitate to offer seats for you Purchasing tickets at the machine are easy and fast too
Great way to get around BKK on the MRT and BTS beats sitting in trafffic Can get to most well known places in BKK via these quicker than taxis and other PT
We used the MRT to get to the Bangkok train station at Hua Lampong Just about the best way (combined with the BTS) to get around Bangkok

reviewTitle: Let's check the newly opened MRT Purple line
reviewText: This is the 4th route of mass transit system in Bangkok named Bangsue (Taopoon station) ( Bang Pai and) Bang Yai a large community on the  outskirt west of Bangkok which exactly is another province (Nonthaburi) My wife and I catched the train from Tao Poon station which is only 5 minutes walk from our home  to Bang Yai the second last station on the other end It takes sround 30 minutes which cost 42 bath for one trip the highest rate for the entire route ride The train is new (ofcourse) but(1) ticket vending machine is not enough especially at Bang Yai station which is a large station with lots of commutor (2) It also difficult to insert  onebaht coin into the slot as it always go down to the changebin not into the right path in the machine thus take a long time for each passenger to complete ticket buying(3) The electronic gate enteringexit the platform is also not enough (some of them are out of orderboth at Tao Poon and Bang Yai station) (4) The train braked quite hard when entering station as if they had not enough time to train the driver (5) Electronic sign board indicating station on lefthand side of the train did not work properly in both train we rode (6) The signage indicating point to get a transfer bus to Underground MRT Bangsue has to be visible easily and sufficient I wonder how hectic it would be in rush hour on working day if passenger have to wait in long line to get a ticket or even to get out of the station (7) Last but not least the government should enforce MRT to operate the blue line connecting between Tao poon station and Bang Sue station as soon as possible as it is not practical to transfer to bus to connect to underground train to ride downtown (which would take more than 20 minutes when the traffic is bad ) Hope to see improvement soon
Fastest way around if you're near a station that is Get a prepaid card and avoid the throng of clueless sexpats and gapyear students

The MRT covers most of central Bangkok Although taxi's are relatively cheap (it may be cheaper to take a taxi if say there are 4 people when compared to individual MRT tickets) the MRT is fast and punctual On one occasion we actually got out of a taxi  which was going no where due to the traffic  so as to catch the MRT
I love the mrt and bts comfortable cool and fast way to travel in Bangkok Like the pictures of our royal family in the HuaLampong station too

Bangkok City is well planned and has excellent facility to travel by train to avoid the traffic congestion The BTS and MRT are linked in such a manner that you dont have to take any pain in interchanging the same as per your need

What is there to say about an MRT line Rather than that it is quick affordable and clean Even in the morning rush hour the ride was pleasant thanks to the exemplary pleasant polite and disciplined way the passengers behave

Link this with the skytrain and you have a great integrated system for central Bangkok travel Leave the tuk tuks to the impressionable and the rip off taxi drivers in your wake This is the way to travel around Bangkok

reviewTitle: Best way to travel in Bangkok!
reviewText: MRT is one of the main train lines on Bangkok It's clean effective and cost efficient It's one of the best ways to move around Bangkok Again it's cheaper They do offer 1Day pass 3Day Pass and 1Month Pass for unlimited use If you are staying at Bangkok go for the 3Day Pass you will save money  Be advise during the evening and night the MRT will be very very crowded Remember it's one of the main transportation of Bangkok thousands of people use it every day

reviewTitle: Clean, quick and easy way to get around BKK.
reviewText: Use this subway to get from one side of BKK to another and also to link with the Skytrain It is a cheap and quick way of moving around the city You can't go wrong

The MRT or underground is excellent when compared to the Above Ground BTS but will always depend on where you are travelling from to but if I can use the MRT I do as there seems to be less people and no need to change at stations like SIAM where you have many thousands of people at times and you have wait for several train before being able to get on
Bangkok's answer to the tube or metro  Its cheap and efficient and generally not overcrowded  Its a far simpler way of getting ahead of the traffic and out of the heat for 30 minutes

This is my favorite transportation option when heading the weekend market (jj market) from sukhumvit area The trains are in good condition and the stations are kept clean Trains come and go every 5 minutes and the queues are tolerable

Get a map from the manned counters at any station  watch the locals how they pay for tickets via the machine OR at the counter Determine where you want to go and Bangkok is at your beck and call for very reasonable travel costs
2 lines that are very easy to use Ticket Machine are easy to understand in english Just press the station you want to go to and pay They have aircondition inside )
This is the best way to get around Bangkok Much safer than the taxis Very clean and easy to use Easy to buy tickets in the machines Kids over 120 cm are charged as adults

reviewTitle: Cover some distance, fast and affordable.
reviewText: In my travels to Thailand I use the Skytrain more often but the MRT works well also  I used it this trip to help move around to photograph some temples

a brilliant way to get around You can see thailand as it should be seenyou wont be dissapointed  a very cheap way to get aroundI think you can buy a special ticket (rabbit)  to get of on train as many times as you like So you see a place you like get off have a loo round get back on to your next place
clean mtr trains run underground and accessible w fully travellerelevator assisted (unlike BTS many stations are manned by flights of stairs)

reviewTitle: TRANSPORT FOR LONDON COULD LEARN HERE
reviewText: Fed up battling with taxi drivers who refused to use their meters and dangerously driven tuk tuks I took to the Metro I'm glad that I did   Everything was spotlessly clean and that included the helpful staff Other travellers were happy to help the dithering European in front of the automatic ticket machine My change included a ¬£2 coin size plastic disc and this was my ticket   The platforms are sensibly marked with queuing spots for passengers getting on leaving space for passengers getting off Ok I was not travelling in the rush hour but it certainly works when there are not too many punters   It's a great system and the staff and other local travellers are charming and helpful It costs a pittance and you should try it Remember it's an underground so no views You'll need Skytrain for that

reviewTitle: Be careful when buying tickets because No refund
reviewText: I bought a 37baht ticket when I needed to buy a 15baht ticket I tried to make refund but according to regulation they do not refund us in the case

reviewTitle: Another way to get around town inexpensively
reviewText: This is a great way to get to JJ Market (Chatuchak Market) I think it was 35 baht from Asok area to JJ market Far less than a taxi and far less hassle trying to find one that uses a meter

I have lived in Bangkok for 11+ years and find that these convenient subway trains connect easily to the BTS (skytrain) to move around this heavily populated environment  Do it and I am SURE you will thank me for the suggestion
This was an excellent way to avoid Bangkok traffic it was quick and very inexpensive  It was clean and easy to find your destination

reviewTitle: good way to commute in city
reviewText: Although Skytrain is more popular in Bangkok but MRT is also doing pretty well A lot of people have started using it Network is not very big but its very efficient Runs very frequently Good thing is that its route network is different from skytrain You can save a lot of time in traffic by using the MRT rather than using a taxi

Safe clean and cheap public transportation in a city famous for the traffic chaos  young riders will usually yield seats for older riders which are not common in other cities  Senior over 60 ride half price
It is easy to take and not expensive to take a train But  I prefer to Singapore MRT  No food allowed to eat at the train station

reviewTitle: Great way to get around in Bangkok
reviewText: The subway is designed as a loop line for inner city of Bangkok Best of all it has elevators for wheelchair access

reviewTitle: Can be overcrowded but still fast and cheap
reviewText: The underground is the fast and cheap way to go around Bangkok Maps are displayed almost everywhere with clean and understandable displays of how to get where you have to be

the train journey is fast and it notice the station and safei always use it from hualamphong station and got seat alwaysit is crowded at rush hourthe price is cheapmainly use coin for buying tickets and all station has staff to exchange you coin if you do not have the coinIf you have luggage with you the staff help you to come through other side and help you to get coin type ticketIt is really a cheap option and best among bangkok for a solo travellersThe escelator is really fast to get downstairs and not reccomended for vary old personsome station have lift

It's always fun for me to try this transportation in every city You just have to make sure of your route than open your map to know at what station you have to go Not every station have a non coin ticket vending mechine and if you don't have coin just go to the counter to buy I was on Friday afternoon trip which everybody is on their euphoria welcoming weekend Looooong Qeue small space to stand and very noisy situation but I enjoyed Don't worry to try it the local people (which could speak English) will openly help you to give any info Oh ya always becarefull of pickpocket It was funbelieve me

reviewTitle: cheap, fast but can be tiring
reviewText: if you are getting on from somewhere in the middle then it can get a bit challenging to get on board usually the trains are packed during rush hour better to avoid at that time overall still fast reliable and most preferred option to travel

This is a great way to get around Bangkok It connects with the LRT so you can easily get around the city   It doesn't go out around the Grand Palace though (same as LRT Skytrain) But hopefully one day

The MRT system was easy to use and ran smoothly we didn't experience any delays Much cheaper than using a taxi if you're there in Bangkok for tourism I recommend planning ahead and taking advantage of the MRT system
nice way to see bangkok very cheap and if you happen to travel on weekends its not much crowded avoid rush hours

reviewTitle: Clean and efficient way to travel
reviewText: Easy to get about the city Always use the Skytrain to the nearest point you can then get a tuk tuk or taxi for the last bit of your journey The city centre is grid locked most of the time so it is the fastest way to get about
I bought a one day pass it costs 120 Baht I used this train from Chatchuk to Si Lom 2 round trips because my hotel locates in Si lom and I went see JJ market on Sunday

reviewTitle: Avoid the traffic.  Take the MRT and connect with the BTS.
reviewText: Modern subway system with good locations  Clean new carsEasy to find and use  Connects with BTS at Asoke Station

reviewTitle: Good connectivity through maximum part of city
reviewText: MRT is good oprtion to travel faster and hasslefree to maximum locations of interest Also there are many changeovers to BTS which allows flexibility to roam maximum part of city through MRT and BTS swiftly They have passes available in different options can have one day pass also refundable prepaid card Troughout the city map of city and MRT BTS available for complete guidance including at hotels Just get one map and start exploring Ticket prices from 19 Baht
To avoid time fly in transportation in Bangkok it is a one of a choiceCompare price to the sky train I think that it is cheaper for a distance ride
I always preferred to stay near MRT it is connected to almost all tourist and shopping destination in Bangkok
A great way to travel across Bangkok Just pop up and connect to the Skytrain to get the most out of your city travel Quick clean convenient and cheap

reviewTitle: Good mode of transport to beat traffic jams
reviewText: Good mode of transport to beat traffic jams  Ticket booth queue can be Long at peak hours at stations that are interchange with BTS
Takes you everywhere the BTS doesn't Not as easy as the BTS but would definitely use the MRT over a taxi any day

When you approach Thailand overhead in your aeroplane you're reminded of Thailand's tropical roots ponds of water and coconut trees lace the city  Then when within Bangkok you're just overcome wTuktuks zig zagging thru the exhaust of buses and the aroma of sliced papaya  Need to regroup  To find shelter  Go Underground  Laid back Thais  They just have everything

After falling for the SkyTrain we were hesitant to use the underground  But we were happily surprised by the neatness and ease of use  Sure there are crowds from time to time but all is very orderly  As new BKK residents we like the different areas that this subway goes and plan to use it frequently

reviewTitle: MRT stations are very packed during weekdays from 5pm onwards
reviewText: MRT stations are very packed during weekdays from 5pm onwards many people qing to buy single trip tickets at the booth I have tried on a weekday evening about 5pm and the crowd was too much to handle we have to wait for the 3rd train before we can board But late evening about 8pm onwards there are not much crowd and feels better

reviewTitle: Short distance, long time to move.
reviewText: Short distance long time to move  One good point is cleanliness  Good air  condition  But very slow  So much to improve
Great was of getting around combined with the sky train is clean and fast plus the price is super cheap

reviewTitle: MRT is better than Sky train
reviewText: The MRT network is limited but quality wise skytrain is cramped hot and humid inside In comparison the MRT is very well placed and cool
Jumped on the MRT to get around places a few times found it cheap and easy to use and quick to get places Happy days

The hard thing like everywhere in a strange country is the communication Find yourself a helpful Thai person to explain how to pay for your ticket  Once you get use to the system and the layout its all good We found that the people were very considerate of each other  they wait till everyone has got off the train before they get on and of course lots of smiles from the locals Parking is a hassle so the train is the best way to go if you want to go shopping

reviewTitle: ideal for chatachuk flea market visit
reviewText: simple  regular  on time  very convenient and a must for budget and happy go lucky travellers  do try and you maje local friends on the way
its a good way to travel in Bangkok if you want to save your time from bad city traffic Also its neat and clean Runs very frequently
Very high frequency of the trains Neat and clean stations Ease of access Connects busiest and tourists places in Bangkok Have intermediate connections with BTS (sky train network)
The MRT is very easy to use There are 2 lines and you can transfer to the Skytrain You can get to the river boats as well
I used it to get to the parts of the city that the skytrain does not reach and it was safe and very easy to use
Long lines during peak times better to take the BTS if you can other than that good way to get around

reviewTitle: Not perfect but still a good way to get around
reviewText: There are too few trains running on the underground and during peak times you need to be prepared for rather long queues which will see you 23 trains arrive and go without you having a chance to get on  The MRT is still a good and fast way to get around BKK
We only used it once (as not close to our accommodation) We found it clean modern and easy to use Would have used it more if the stations were closer to where we were staying

If you are in Bangkok for a few days do buy the MRT card For seniors over 60 you can purchase a senior card which entitles you to 50% discount fare during nonpeak period It became a cheap way to travel around the city The MRT is clean efficient and station has multiple exits Do check your exit point so that you don't land up on the opposite site of the road To get across on the road is madness with Bangkok's traffic You can return the card and your unused balance will be reimbursed in cash to you You have to signed on a piece of paper that the station master will fill up for you There is also a 30B rental of the card being retained

We love using the MRT system in Bangkok  Multiple use cards make it easy to use without worrying about payment every day The trains are airconditioned which certainly helps in the humid Bangkok air  They run mostly on time or very close to it so you can plan your trips quite well It would be nice if it could reach more places but that is obviously coming in the near future
Public transport like the MRT and the BTS are always our means of transportation when we are in Bangkok It is very convenient clean and not congested
MRT in Bangkok just normal like others country MRT nothing special MRT in Bangkok is only 1 line so it is quite easy to use Better to use MRT and BTS than Taxi or Tuktuk
Expensive but good  Best part I never knew that there is a station inside chatuchak market The Booking clerk told us )

reviewTitle: one city, three system, three kinds different tickets.
reviewText: BTS was the first mass transit system in Bangkok and MRT are later Therefore I lower my score to MRT because of the nonunion system with BTS Passengers need to by 3 different cards for three mass transit in BKK MTS MRT Airport Link That is not friendly for all passengers citizens Compare To Asia's near cities as Singapore Taipei Hong kong that one card for all MRT and BUS especially Taipei smart card that one card almost for all life you need  BKK and KL Mass transit are behind and second grade of service

Using the MRT Skytrain and ferries is a wonderful way to get around Bangkok  Although taxis are inexpensive there is a lot of traffic so consider this inexpensive easy to navigate airconditioned system of public transport

reviewTitle: The best transportation line in bangkok!
reviewText: MRT is by far my favorite way to travel around bangkok as it is the most efficient Gotta give it to the Japanese as always Its the fastest coolest and cheapest way to travel Underground gives it + over the BTS as its much cooler then being above the streets next to the large billboards

reviewTitle: Took this for a short distance but had to walk a bit after
reviewText: connecting at Sae Dalongwalk through a metal detector just to get to the ticket and window gateAlso have to take a lot of stairs just to climb downI like to walk up and downstairs when having the option I know there are escalators but you get a little exerciseAfter the driver and police inspect the trainI get on at Hua Lamphong Train stopBangkok has very clean trainsand the people follow the rules by lining up to get in and allowing the people to disembark first

reviewTitle: clean efficient and reasonable cost - beat the traffic
reviewText: very well run service  Excellent for avoiding traffic jams If  in a group it may be cheaper to catch a taxi
Good service  cover almost all the city and you can travel with ease  Due to the security measures the security guards will check your bag at the entrance
It was the first time I took the MRT from JJ Market to Sukumvit where the shopping mall Terminal 21 is located The ride was comfortable with good airconditioning  It's also less crowded than the BTS
MRT route passes important places around Bangkok and i can travel very fast from North Bangkok (1st station) to Head office of Railway station (last station) within 1 hr

Easy to use clean and well signed Buy tickets at the station use change in the machine if you have enough or go to the counter to get change for the machines Select language and use the map on the wall to see how much the fare is select the fare and put your money in not forgetting to collect your ticket Best of all is the fact that the air conditioning works so well on the trains Only problem is that the trains done go into the old city
Train tickets come in the form of coins and can be purchased from ticketing counter Trains are clean and fast

You can go to major sight seeing and shopping locations in Bangkok by combing MRT and BTS Saves time energy and probably money if you travel solo or as couple if its more than three the ticket price might add up to taxi fare (depending on the distance though)
Bangkok is always have traffic and MRT is really helpful I don't have MRT back home and was amazed by them But I think the stations are limited Overall it's a great transportation
In a City with high traffic and bad infrastructure in within the mayor areas a connection of Subway and Train system gets you moving It‚Äôs cheap clean and efficient

reviewTitle: Goes to the "Out of the Way Places"
reviewText: Great for getting out to the suburbs and into the northern part of the city It's actually quite usefuly for going up to JJ Market

reviewTitle: Connecting to places using the MRT
reviewText: The combination of the MRT and the BTS and the Express Bus Service dramatically increases the destinations you can get to when you are in a hurry  This is especially true when it rains  The combination of these three systems of mass transport cover most of the city  Good to know when the road traffic comes to a virtual stand still you can still move across the city using the there systems

The Bangkok MRT (as well as other connecting train lines) were oh so very much appreciated during my stay in Bangkok Whenever I took a taxi I regretted doing so as we inched along in the traffic The MRT saves you from that traffic mess and gets you where you're going quickly and efficiently The vending machines are also very easy to use for us clueless foreigners

Bangkok has many ways to get around the city but the traffic is busy in most places After visiting Chinatown I took a taxi to the end of the MRT line at Hua Lamphong and six stops later was at the Asok Station (Terminal 21) The ride was very fast quiet and airconditioned I can't remember the exact price but it was cheap Highly recommend using the MRT and avoid using taxis where possible

reviewTitle: Beat the Bangkok Traffic and Heat.
reviewText: I worked in Bangkok for a couple of years and go back frequently Getting around the city is the same kind of art as most major cities You have to learn to mix and match different kinds of transportation to get exactly were you want to go As in most cities traffic can get unmanageable Bangkok also has some intense heat which needs to be considered The MRT Subway system is a key part of the options available and stays cool year around    To my knowledge there are no plans to build anymore subway tunnels in BKK  because of some of the challenges which were found building the current tunnels Future expansion will be above ground and involve the BTS SkyTrain System Still the interconnectivity of the single MRT line with the two BTS lines works well to get you generally close to where you want to go in most parts of Central Bangkok   The MRT is very clean and runs very efficiently Did I mention it is always cool There are security check points at each station and restrictions on things which can be brought onto the train plan ahead    Modesty needs to be set aside during commute times in the morning and the evening The MRT is heavily used and physical contact on all four sides at the same time is not uncommon Personal hygiene is appreciated by everybody     I can no longer image Bangkok without the MRT Did I mention it is cool year around

I've used Bangkok's MRT system for a number of years It's amongst the best in the world The trains run on time even during peak periods and all stations are spotless A great way to get around this busy city
A good way of getting around without worrying about the traffic very efficient although admittedly not a vast network Thats the reason I didn't give it 5 stars
MRT is the underground trains running around Bangkok Trains are clean and waiting time is short However the train fare is higher than BTS
Stations are located accros bangkok on keypoint locations Very accessible and cheapcheap rates Good way to get around town

The MRT is a great way to get around central Bangkok It's fast efficient and inexpensive They run quite frequently and have numerous stops along their routes Well maintained and stops are situated close to most of the shopping centres They don't operate close to the temples so other modes of transport should be used
this link is within citygood to save time and cost connectivity with BTS and airport link fast and convinient to avoid traffic

every 8 minutes a train during peak hour is definitely not enough to transfer all passengers to their destinations We needed to wait for 45 trains pass our station before we can get on one In this case i recommend not to take the MRT if possible

The MRT is a great way to get to places the BTS does not It connects with the Airport Rail Link (ARL) system as well as the main train station Unlike the BTS seniors can buy a discount fare card Tourists can ride the ARL to Makkassan Station and use the skywalk to get to the MRT station at Petchaburi then take the MRT either north or south as needed Great time and cost saver

We found that the MRT was a good way to get around but you had to line up every time for tickets There didn't seem to be a good and easy way to get them but to line up behind 10 others to buy a single ticket each time you want to ride Still cheap and fast but you sometimes annoyingly miss a train waiting in the ticket line
Always crowded Buy a multi trip ticket if you can as they are not cheaper but are much easier to use
This train is also good compared bts however it more confusing then bts And not so many access there But it can connected with the bts to wandering the bangkok city
The sky train is the best way to get round Bangkok quick and easy  always buy an extended ticket to last your visit as it can be a pain queuing at the station for tickets

reviewTitle: A great way to get around
reviewText: We live in Hong Kong so we are truly spoiled by our MTR (or MRT in Singapore and Bangkok)  Hong Kong gets 5 stars  every timeI give this 4it's not quite as timelybut all in allexcellent  I highly recommend

reviewTitle: Transport for London....Eat your heart out!
reviewText: This is clean reliable inexpensive and safe Much more pleasant than sitting in traffic jams Of course it gets very busy at rush hours but people are very politethey wait for passengers to get off before crowding on Many stations have multiple exits which can be a bit confusing so it is best to do some homework first
i have used this service many times and had no problems what so ever been too rama 9 several times easy to use and hand service staff all polite and is good to get around anywhere around thailand

reviewTitle: The only way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Forget the taxis hop on the BTS the get yourself around Bangkok it is by far the easiest way  Even if you destination does not have a BTS travel to the nearest one and continue on from there you will save a heap of time It does get a little crowded during peak times just relax and wait for the next one to arrive in 35 minutes you may find it less crowded

reviewTitle: The only way to get around
reviewText: The Bangkok underground is great for getting to somewhere closer to where you want to go The traffic at most times is so bad that you can spend 1 hour going 100 metres So if you know generally where you want to go you get the MRT or the skytrain to the closest point and then grab a cab or tuktuk or as pillion on a motor bike As a senior citizen the MRT has half price tickets as  well but you have to ask at the ticket office and show ID The trains are clean the service is efficient and the staff are helpful

I've taken the MRT once and I was surprised at how empty it was Which is great It was weird receiving a black token that you have to hold on to until the end of your ride and then insert it at the turnstile I didn't know that Luckily I kept the token and my ride was quick and easy
We found this a great way to travel around Bangkok  Easy to navigate Can purchase tickets from a machine which has an English option and is fool proof
Getting around Bangkok must use MRT system  Always clean reasonable prices and always on time A+

reviewTitle: Cheap and quick way to travel
reviewText: This is the same as the BTS cheap and safe to travel  There is security everywhere so you are safe here  Just get your tickets to avoid rush hours when the trains are full and the ques are long  They connect to some underground malls so you can find things to eat and buy
Fastest service Need to walk a bit to reach shopping malls but I personally felt walking is good for health

reviewTitle: great way to move around the city (with BTS and Airport Link)
reviewText: I have always found the metro system in Bangkok a great way of moving around convenient on time no fuss and very easy especially if you use the "card" system No arguments with taxi drivers or risky journeys on the back of motorcycles
Great easy way to travel Cheap and very fast Much better than the roads Quite a bit of walking inbetween but easy cheap and fast

reviewTitle: Between the MRT and BTS you can see much of Bangkok
reviewText: Before the MRT there was the BTS aka the Skytrain  The BTS which is above ground is a relatively modern train line that covers a reasonable amount of the city  More recently the MRT a subway (or underground) added a number of stops where the BTS did not go  The MRT is also relatively modern very clean and fairly easy to figure out  Particularly given the number of "shady" taxi and tuktuk drivers in Bangkok getting an MRT and BTS map and then using both systems during a visit to Bangkok is almost essential

If you are deaf you will have no idea which station you are at There are no dynamic route maps onboard The elevators for disabled persons or for people using prams with babies usually require one to make a telephone call from street level at your own cost There is no intercom and the elevators are locked Very inconvenient indeed I think this operator needs to think very carefully about how difficult they are making it for some travellers to use their facilities One the plus side the MRT is usually less crowded than the BTS
This might be the best way to get round Bangkok but it is crowded and pushy for most of the day If you are going out you need to know that trains do not run after midnight
Excellent transport option to beat traffic Inexpensive and very reliable with good connectivity Highly recommended
Excellent way of getting around especially if you want to go to connect to trains travelling to international destinations This service is quick ceheap and airconditioned

One of the best ways to get around here in Bangkok It would be better if the BTS and MRT were one instead of them being different train lines but despite that they are a better option than trying to get a taxi and going through the trouble of negotiating with them on a fare

Next to the skytrain this is the most convenient way to get around Bangkok Especially if ou need to go to and from Hua Lamphong station andor Suvarnabhumi Airport (change at Makassan for Phetchaburi MRT Station)
During rush hour when traffic blocks the busy streets this is the best way to get some where Depending on the direction you are traveling the trains can be packed
Really easy to travel around Nice and cheap and much quicker than taxis Always use when we are in Bangkok

reviewTitle: Another excellent mode of transport in Bangkok
reviewText: We started our journey from Chatuchak terminal and went to our destination Union plaza but again it was awesome moreover the staff was very cooperative with the tourists

Clean and not crowded during early hours of the day but it can get really busy in the evening Get a daypass if you want to travel to different places all day else the ticket counter queue can eat up valuable time from you vacation It's fast cheap and reliable as the traffic on the streets can get mad so easily all day
As far as subways go the Bangkok MRT rates as good as anywhere in the world  Decent prices efficient and clean
Cheap as chips and very easy to get around town with Very safe too and lots of english so u really cant get lost

Considering never ending traffic jams in Bangkok MRT is a blessing Crowded during peak hours however manageable as locals do not try to push and get in People typically wait her for the next one to arrive Connects most of places well Extremely cheap compared to AC taxis and comfortable compared to being stuck in traffic jams

reviewTitle: Puts New York Metro to shame!
reviewText: Yes I know it's much newer than the New York Metro so you might expect it to look more modern  but when you compare other heavily used metros (such as London Paris Moscow) with New York you really wonder why they can't even attempt to keep up with the standards achieved by other major cities (Rhetorical question  I assume the answer is mostly down to politics) So in Bangkok the metro is pristine  so clean you feel you could almost eat food from the floor The platforms have security screens to prevent accidental falls to the lines and the other side of the glass on tunnel walls are movie screens for advertising reminiscent of Blade Runner Announcements on the train are both in Thai and in English as are the signs Easy to navigate and great connections with the Skytrain (BTS) The MRT and BTS have made getting around Bangkok so easy
BTS and MRT together makes the best connectivity in Bangkok Unfortunately they dont have a combined day pass for tourists

A previous reviewer mentions the expense A three day pass costs 230 baht Less than ¬£5 and for this you get a reliable hassle free way of getting round the city and to shopping areas  Its airconditioned too  My only gripethe automated announcement system starts to grate after a while

Using it for going to the work place in my internship trip I very like it It's so fast and convinient The train is large and clean Everyone is folow the rules so there are no trouble during the time using it

First time in Bangkok the MRT is so easy to use Better than sitting in traffic Like how they all queue to get on Can be crowded at times  There are loads of security check points but they rarely check your bags  The trains are clean and so are the stations
Traffic in BKK is some of the worst I half seen in the world  Seemed to take an house to get ANYWHERE  I suggest using public transport whenever possbile

reviewTitle: A Great Way to move around
reviewText: A Great Way to move around if only of long waiting times and a little expensive The air con was great comfort from the heat of the city

reviewTitle: Nice Way To Get Around Bangkok
reviewText: The Bangkok underground MRT system is a great and convenient way to get around Bangkok given Bangkok‚Äôs notorious traffic during peak hours It‚Äôs fast economical and reliable  Upon entrance to the stations there‚Äôs an electronic scanner and security personnel would manually check bags and other suspicious items  We bought a 3 day pass for 230 bahts and it‚Äôs very convenient to go to other places in the city We took the MRT from Sukhumvit to Hua Lamphong station then a short 15 minutes stroll to Chinatown in Yaorawat We also took the MRT to Kamphaeng Phet and upon emerging from the station viola‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs the Chatuchak Weekend Market  Really a nice efficient and economical way to travel around Bangkok
