We used this traspo for easy access to BKK Really crowded and cheap and can get you around Beware of pickpockets they are all around and you travel shoulder to shoulder most of the time

An excellent way to get around the city Due to Bangkok's heavy traffic road travel in Bangkok is to say the least uncertain On the other hand the MRT is certain safe convenient fast good value and reliable

reviewTitle: It gets you there...get a mrt card to save time
reviewText: MRT is the underground subway system for metro bangkok  Here is a few things you need to know   great for single travelers or even small groups to beat traffic especially when the destination is very close by to the station  During peak traffic times it is sometimes faster to take MRT to nearby destination and then take taxituktuk or local bus from there   air condition is strong inside train like the SRT  You can take a light jacket but it is only for a short time  Good way to beat the daytime heat though   Unfortunately the rabbit card is not compatible with MRT so you will need a separate card for MRT  Like BTS the MRT ticket queue can get quite large and it could mean waiting 1520 minutes just to get a token  So MRT reloadable pass or multiday passes might be more convenient   connects with lots of popular destinations especially Hua Lamphong which is the SRT main station (ground level interprovince trains)

reviewTitle: Great way to see the city
reviewText: Always love catching the MRT whilst exploring Bangkok its cheap as chips clean and always on time

reviewTitle: Why sit in the traffic jams, when you can enjoy fast and easy travels with MRT through the city
reviewText: Just like BTS Skytrain MRT (underground) train is a convenient and easy way to travel to many parts of Bangkok It also has connection points with BTS It also offers special price for Children and Seniors
This was another way to get around in Bangkok I used it a few times to go out further in Bangkok A must use

We travelled by MRT from Lad Phrao near Mall Bangkapi to Petchburi MRT and found it so clean convenient and quiet Very reasonably priced too  Unfortunately the transport systems in BKK (MRT skytrain bus etc) are not integrated thereby requiring separate ticketscards for each mode of transport The 3 day MRT pass is quite cheap too One can switch over to the Skytrains at few designated MRT stations
Terrific get around system Well done Bangkok We travelled efficiently across the city with ease Ticket system was simple

There is just one route of MRT underground So check at one of the stations where you are and click on the station you want to go Ticket vending machines can be operated in English Pay (coins and bills) get your chip and change To enter the tracks hold the chip in front of the reader and keep it At your destination station you must trough it into the exit hate to get out  Easy to use und quite cheap
I took the MRT between Silom and Lat Phrao several times  It is fast and easy  With Bangkok traffic I was to my destination in 20 minutes for what would be an hour drive if not more

reviewTitle: Quick, clean, comfortable and affordable mode of travel.
reviewText: It easy to get tickets Is helpful if have change ready  The staff is helpful It saves a  of time Great way to travel in Bangkok
Connects easily and convenient  I used this to connect the Airport link at Makkasan Saves me time and easily accessible

The MRT and BTS are the only way to get around Bangkok Forget taxis and tuktuks which just sit in grid locked traffic Yes the trains get crowded but they're cheap fast and easy to navigate Get a Rabbit Card for the BTS to avoid queues for tickets

reviewTitle: Clear indications at each station and exit sign with numbering
reviewText: Easy to buy tickets and clear information to the tourist very helpful staff at the cashier well airconditioning

reviewTitle: Great way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: MRT provides you a great way to travel in Bangkok as it not only saves time it also saves money One can travel from one corner to another in less than hour Most importantly it has connections with BTS Skytrain to Sukhumvit as well as Silom line

reviewTitle: Why can't we have this in Melbourne?
reviewText: This transport system is so efficient clean and safe If you miss a train you may have to wait 4 minutes for the next one
We've been to Bangkok four times and always us the MRT It's clean and efficient and other than the everpresent video ads quiet
the MRT is a very efficient mode of transport around bangkok especially to Chatuchat weekend market it is cheap and comfortable to travel in

If only London had a similarly modern and user friendly service Of course the MRT has the supreme advantage of being modern and thus designed fit for purpose with its air conditioned tries and vast platform concourses Gets very crowded at peak times but otherwise is a joy to use
Very convenient way to get around town Sad they have only line Hopefully they extend more routes Interiors are clean compared to many european metro

Firstly Bangkok traffic is notorious no matter where you go no matter what time of day Only drive or use taxis as a last resort The subway system is very easy to use You buy the tokens at one of many touch screenseither in Thai language or English Use the MRT in conjunction with the BTS (elevated train system) the local Chao Phraya River EXPRESS boats  the canal boats andor motor taxis and you will negotiate 90% of Bangkok properthese forms of transportation crisscross one another in many places in the city Do your research and print out some maps and you're good to go Avoid Bangkok city traffic  MRT operating hours are from 06002400 hours

Bangkok are now supper hot hotter than the ladiesbest way to traveler around the city to avoid supper hot burning sun with connected station in some areas plus some underground shopping at the station and most important to avoid the horrible trafficthis is highly recommended transport
MRT is very easy to use Ticketing and destination announcement are in English also hence good for those who do not understand Thai Cheap and no irritation of traffic jam

reviewTitle: An excellent way to avoid surface traffic
reviewText: The MRT trains are well maintained and a wonderful AC option during the warmer months often less crowded than the BTS  those less so during the morning and afternoon rush hour commutes
MRT is clean and cool The train is puncture that you can fix the  commuted time  to other places  The MRT line is not  complicated due to  one line
It was safe and easy to use however it doesn't go into the city and is quite small So it depends where you want to go

reviewTitle: Fast way to travel and avoid traffic
reviewText: Will take u  near ur destination in no time with zero traffic Best way to travel across BKK if you know where u r heading

reviewTitle: MRT gives senior discount to travelers, but not Skytrain.
reviewText: The underground is a lot cooler while waiting for the train No need to change at Siam depending on where you want to go Best Example is from Asok to SalaDaeng on Skytrain vs Suhkumvit to Silom is actually similar two stations

The service is fast and cheaper than the BTS Seems to be a good system however there is only a couple of lines and the stations are not necessarily closer to where you want to go Need better info on connecting with buses
As in ANY country DO NOT travel during peak hours It can be a nightmare Other than that I enjoyed the experience
mrt or bts or the chao praya express boat service are the fastest ways to get around the city just avoid the high traffic times morning until 9 am and evening from 5 pm
Easy clean safe used it all the time while in Bangkok Never crowded people very nice Very simple to navigate and follow drections
they know how to run MRT on time and excellent and efficient way to get round one of the best system I have been on
Clean  punctual  not so crowded  lots of escalators to reach your platform be careful read directions you might end up in wrong platform n in wrong direction
Good transport to Chatuchak Weekend market Stop at Khempang phet MRT station instead of Mochit station as that will lead you straight to the heart of the market

reviewTitle: Convenient and highly necessary given heavy jams
reviewText: The MRT doesn't take you everywhere in Bangkok there are still a few interesting spots that have to be reached by boattaxituktukwalking but it takes to most of the central areas near several malls touristic spots and places to hangout dine drink party  Given how horrible traffic jams can get in Bangkok take MRT as much as you can

reviewTitle: comfortable , cheap and easiest way to travel .Each MRT stations has comprehensive guidance to our expecting desti.
reviewText: comfortable  cheap and easiest way to travel Each MRT stations has comprehensive guidance to our expecting destination
So easy clean fast and trouble free At commuting times its busy but that's to be expected Along with the BTS it's a great way to avoid the bangkok traffic
If you are exploring Bangkok you will also have to use the MRT I hope that in near future the tickets from BTS and MRT are compatibel

reviewTitle: This or the skytrain...you will go everywhere
reviewText: Sometime you can get to an attraction by MRT or by the Skytrain both are complementary and very easy of use Don't take the cab too quickly

reviewTitle: They got nothing on the MRT in Hong Kong
reviewText: Its not seemless travel from the BTS to the MRT or the BRT Need different tokens for each Long lines at rush hour Not enough trains It will get you close to most destinations but if traveling with more than two people UBER is better most times

reviewTitle: Fast, efficient and needs more of it.
reviewText: The service is fast efficient and cheap The trains are clean and regular The route is limited at present but is being extended A great way to travel in the direction of Chinatown or to the weekend market
I used MRT lot whileim staying in BKKit was 2min walk frommy hotelthe trains are very cleanall are connected with BTS & Air port rail linkmuch  cheaper than going with Taxi
Must not miss try getting on an mrt and you will forget all the traffic can get you to most places of interest 55555555
If you want to head to Chatucha market or the main city  MRT is the option Convenient  comfortable and quick

reviewTitle: City tour using MRT and BTS
reviewText: it was fun experience using MRT for the city tour and also for the airport transfer  Safe and reliable transport service
easy to use  they do not print tickets  you get tokens everything very economic  never a new  friendly people  just choose your destination

reviewTitle: BTS and MRT will save time
reviewText: I stayed in Sukhumvit area in Bangkok Therefore for visiting various places around Bangkok as well as for travelling fromto the airport MRT BTS and Airport rail link combinations saved a lot of time  MRT is cheaper than BTS but both the train services are equally crowded and fast albeit BTS runs with better coaches As road transport is worst in Bangkok with heavy traffic jams choose MRT and BTS combinations
Easy way to travel in Bangkok It is quick and easy to use Signs are all in English and Thai which makes things simple you can pay per trip or but a pass

reviewTitle: connects where Sky train can't reach
reviewText: Again fast comfortable & dependable mode of transport Coupled with sky train gives quiet a reach across bangkok city

with the bad traffic  MRT & BTS is best possible way to travel Its easy when you have a city map Good news is  this time I saw new trainways are coming up soon  making traveling to outskirts of city easy  to pattaya will be really fast and cheap

reviewTitle: Excellent Option to Commute with Bangkok
reviewText: The MRT is great to get around Bangkok This is mostly underground and has two lines  The only issue is MRT Pass cannot be used on other public transports If a single Pass could be usable across BTS MRT BRT RailLink and Ferries it would be great  You needs bank notes to buy machines from Vending machines or you can get it from counter I would suggest to go for the Pass which you can get for 180 THB 30 THB is the issuing fee and will not be refunded and 50 THB is the deposit If you are going to travel extensively ON MRT (remember MRT does not cover all the major attractions and the pass is not usable on other transports so this may be costly) for 3 days you could go for the 3 day pass which would be cheaper

Travel by MRT is the most convenient way to travel across the city Very well connected When traveling solo it is cheaper than traveling by taxi as well as one saves lot of time The staff at the stations is also very helpful

I hate the jams and the need to haggle with taxis or tuk tuks cause once they see you're a foreigner it's all out to scam you The MRT and BTS while not perfectly integrated transports me most every where I need in the city MRT more of outskirts transfer to BTS for the more shopping and eating areas of town Just be aware that some stations are extremely quiet  can be scary for some lone travelers and the connections to the BTS can be quite a walk But in the bkk jam I bet you I still got to my destination faster
It's not the first time to Bangkok so not emphasize on sight seeing Relax trip doing spa and shopping in malls and night markets
Any where you go by MRT it will be perfect BTS and MRT in Bangkok are the best in whole worldNo Lacking helpful staff

reviewTitle: Effective and Efficient, and it is Economical (EEE)
reviewText: We love the MRT in Bangkok It is not only EEE it is also very clean and safe mode of transport The staff are professional and helpful too

reviewTitle: Brilliant but the air conditioner is set at arctic freeze
reviewText: Love the MRT but coming in from the heat of subtropical climate the freezing temperature can be uncomfortable
I've been coming to Bangkok for 12 years and 2 years ago discovered the MRT system It is clean modern inexpensive and so easy to navigate Now I travel all over the city by train  can't beat it
Very good way to travel as it is easy clean safe and cheap I never felt at risk in the MTR whatever the time was

reviewTitle: Cheap and easy way to travel around Bangkok
reviewText: Definitely a cheap way to travel and see the sights of Bangkok Although the trains were very busy we found them to be very clean and well organised with trains departing on a regular basis We had no problems getting around with maps available on the platform and a clear and audible display of train stations next destination etc displayed inside the train

The MRT is a great way to travel round Bangkok It's easy to get a travel card from the ticket office so you don't need to keep buying tickets each trip Trains come every few minutes and are well signposted in Thai and English so it's really easy to navigate the system It's well worth trying to  stay near an MRT station to make traveling convenient

reviewTitle: Quick, cheap and easy to navigate
reviewText: Quick and easy to navigate and get from a to b Windows are frosted so you can't get a view of city if that's what you afteryou just need to know where your going ) we guessed a couple of times which was half the fun Can be crowded but didn't bother us

reviewTitle: Fine if you need to go that way
reviewText: Been in Bangkok many times but never had the need to use the MTR  Did this time as wanted to get to Jim Thompson shop's near Silom from Asoke  MTR clean and fast and cheap  The only problem is that there is only one line and does not cover many of the areas that a tourist would want to go  BTS is rather better as has 2 lines but again covers a rather limited area but good for trips up and down Sukhumvit in air conditioned luxury when its 40C outside   The BTS does provide a good link to the express river buses to get you to the Royal Palace  Wat Poo & Aran and adds to the travel experience  All three modes of transport are cheap too

in Bangkok there are many options to get from one place to another and this is one of the best ways to do soits cheap and easy to use and extremely cleanif you plan to stay longer then a week in Bangkok I suggest you buy the top up card it will save you time of standing in a cue

reviewTitle: use MRT and BTS when in Bangkok to get around
reviewText: Both the MRT (underground) and BTS (skytrain) are ideal ways of getting to most places in Bangkok try to time trip outside of rush hours Only use Taxi's when you need to and stay away from TukTuks unless you just want the experience They will almost certainly suggest a souvenir massage or sea food restaurant that will certainly over change you
MRT was the fastest and easiest vehicle to use But for me there was a big confusion between changing the transportations like from MRT to SkytrainLOL

reviewTitle: An economic and efficient way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: We used the  MRT a lot while staying in Bangkok It was only 2 mins walk from our hotel (Centre point Silom hotel) There are attendants at the station who speak very good english and they will point you in the right direction The trains are very clean but a bit packed most of the time

I've been taking the MRT for about a month now Have to say Im impressed It's never too overcrowded and it's FAST Seriously make sure you hold on to one of the straps when you get in because this sucker takes off I also like that the internet works perfectly underground This and Skytrain are great ways to get around the city without being in so much traffic

MRT is tops  Great way to get about BKK in larger terms as opposed to the BTS which has limited scope (although it too takes you to lots of destinations) MRT is fast regular all day until very late Great way to get to Chatuchak Weekend Markets  (I love this place )
MRT is the underground version of the Skytrain  Just as well run clean and on time with helpful staff Tickets are cheap maps are available  Busy and crowded at rush hours other times are fine

reviewTitle: Best way to go around Bangkok
reviewText: MRT (and BTS) are excellent ways to explore parts of Bangkok very clean no graffiti fearsome airconditioning fast and easy to use (better have small change for the BTS) MRT gives 50% discount to all people over 65

reviewTitle: MRT is not Mass and not Rapid at all
reviewText: If you don't mind wating upto 5 minutes (hell FIVE minutes) for something called RAPID half day dangerously overcrowded so passengers has to que to wait another train (mass ha) quite expensive for such short distances watching poor girls standing a the Security Gates without even chance to sit and lean on anything  Airconditions barely working at 50% of stations some entrances do not have elevators  so old people have to do 100 steps walk down   Again some stations in the Asoke Silom area are dangerously overcrowded it is dangerous gathering of too many people in single place if you can understand whats the treat  Bangkok MRT is the best example how to build something on shoestring budget Great it exists great respect to hardworking staff of MRT and hope ther would be more trains running faster and more frequently

reviewTitle: Good service and not so crowded.
reviewText: A good mode of trasportation with lesser crowd It has lesser stops too You can get a seat off peak hours

reviewTitle: Easy, inexpensive way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Wow my city should take lessons from this metro system  Fast clean efficient and cheap transportation system  Don't be intimidated  Look at the metro map figure out what station you need to get to then look up the price on the chart located at the cashier  You will get a small black coindisk  Simply swipe this on the screen at the turn stall  At your destination you need to use this coin to get out of the station  Easy
Quick clean cheap way of traveling around BKK although not all areas are covered  but this can be used with a taxi

reviewTitle: By far the most organised and reliable public transport in Thailand!
reviewText: Vastly superior to the BTS (which frustratingly STILL doesn't accept bank notes in its automated ticket machines) the MRT is the best public transport in BKK  Try to get a hotel on or near the blue MRT line is my advice  It still irritates me how the BTS and MRT intersections aren't actually in the same physical location A serious lack of forward planning especially notable in 35+ degrees andor torrential rain let alone if travelling with luggage
combined with skytrain transporation system to get around is cheap fast and convenient  With air conditioning best way to safely get to where you want to go
The station was literally 5 minutes away from my hotel and it was a very clean and quick way of travelling Cheap as well

reviewTitle: Best way to get around in Bangkok
reviewText: Clean on time and cheap This is the best way to be mobile in Bangkok due to the heavy traffic Can recommend

Like the London Underground but without the strikesthe dirt and the litter Easy to use and easy to follow instructions on the ticket machines Like the BTS the trains have aircon so even if the train is packed its still nice and cool
Ticket machine provide English menu so you can buy tickets easily But avoid commuting hours not to wait so ~ long time to buy ticket and to ride
Well connected to the malls in the tourist area Nana Siam Chitlom Tanya plaza MBK all are connected through MRT Once great aspect is skywalk which connects MRT to malls in the Siam area
Find a location close to the MRT because it allows you to travel easily across the central locations in the city It is typically 50 baht a trip so good idea to get a weekdaily pass instead

reviewTitle: Moving around the city! Easy and cheap.
reviewText: Best way to move around the city Combine it with BTS and you can move even more places Airport Link also connects to MRT and is pretty fast and much cheaper than going with Taxi

Bangkok has a great mass rail transit system  Between the BTS and MRT you can travel just about anywhere without needing a taxi or tuk tuk and arrive at your destination with ease  There is very good signage and directions at each station  Be sure to carry coins but there are change machines or operators who can help out  Review the maps and make your selections you will need to know the end points of each station in order to make the right selection  A great way to get around a large city with lots of people
Bangkok trafiic is wellknown to most i believe That is what makes MRT kind of mandatory for travelling within city The service is trustworthy

One of the most efficient mode of transportation in Bangkok (the others are BTS Skytrain and airportlink) it interconnect with BTS Skytrain and Airport link  If you use it often either you buy 1 3 or 7 day pass for unli ride if not just buy the MRT card for ease of use and less hassle on the ticket vending machine

The addition of the BKK metro system has been wonderful for both locals and visiters Running between Hualamphong Railway station and Bang Sue Railway Station it services many important places in central Bangkok ie China Town Silom Sukhumvit Pratunam Ratchada Lat Phrao Chatachuk etc Quick efficient and cheap (Half price to over 60's) Also links with Airport Link Service and BTS  Will save you time and money

reviewTitle: Much better then the BTS Skytrain
reviewText: Halfprice fare for people over age 60 and claim may be accepted at face value at the toll booth  Use the term "ELDER" because you will get blank stares if you claim "senior" status  Seat possibilities are higher since the BTS always is jammed full and I much rather wait on an air conditioned platform for a train then the heat baked platform waiting on BTS  BTS seems to be a local favorite as it grows further and further out of Bangkok

reviewTitle: Very clean and safe way to travel
reviewText: This remind me of London underground tube but a lot cleaner and security guards Highly recommended

reviewTitle: Quick, cheap way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: Runs on a  pay as you go basis You pay at the machine for your required destination and receive a token  This only allows for travel within the MRT network however it was easy to use and cheap
Everything is interconnected I love the train system Cant ask for anything more A bit pricey though

reviewTitle: Better than taking a taxi any day
reviewText: I used the MRT for the first time even though I have been visiting Bangkok for 10 years (I normally used the BTS so felt comfortable with that system) It was very convenient and easy to use the only issue is that during rush hours (morning and evening) there are so many people using the MRT that you may not make the first train when you wait in line but will have to wait for the next This is a bit irritating but still much better than taking a taxi during rush hours or any time of the day in Bangkok

reviewTitle: The best for traffic in bangkok
reviewText: If you dont like the roush hour in Bangkok take the skytrain It may be full also in roush hour but youre faster than by car Very safe and clean

it is an easy way to Yaowarat when comes to getting there by taxi during most time of the day where traffic is always a jam there Actually you can reach one end from Yaowarat to Mo Chit (Chatuchat weekend market)  Yaowarat chinatown of Bangkok is full of eateries  from the famous Kueh chap and pork leg rice to bbq and seafood along the street at night
Always runs smoothly have yet to experience delays it's easy to buy a ticket and orient oneself and it is not as crowded as BTS
is an underground not an attraction by the way is clean frequent and fast if you to take you take otherwise not is not an attraction

Despite being more crowded than the SkyTrain (really) this is just as good Aircon  and easy to follow maps on every train It would be nice if you could use the same ticket for both but it's simple to get a one time use coin Go to the machine or a worker at the counter   Note the train has to be inspected at the end of the line for us Chinatown before boarding Despite everywhere else being civil  people were really crowding in to be the first on the train I think these were probably more tourists than locals though
The MRT trains run very frequently and never get stuck in traffic jams They are quite cheap though not for the locals They are clean and fast only the ac is always freezing

One of the most efficient ways to get around Bangkok Coupled with the BTS this makes traversing Bangkok a breeze on time clean air conditioned and cheap Of course it can be crowded entering the stations and on the train in peak hours

reviewTitle: Very clean and easy to use
reviewText: I was surprised how modern clean and convenient this public transport is  The lines are quite small and limited but if there is stop near where you are going then it's faster than going by taxi for sure
It will take you most places you wish to go fast It goes to the Saturday Sunday market chatuchat get off at bang sue

Traffic jams are a nuisance in Bangkok The best is to travel by MRT OR Sky Train to save time and hassle The pick hours are also crowded for MRTs but still best They are usually clean and well maintained Ticket purchasing steps are also easy and quickly accessible

By using the MRT in combination with the BTS you save precious time in going up and down in this big city The lines are crossing at the Sukhumvit interchange giving you options for using the best route to avoid the traffic on the busy streets of Bangkok

reviewTitle: This is a first rate public transportation system
reviewText: This is a marvelous way to get around  It is air conditioned and comfortable  You can interchange to other modes of transport

reviewTitle: Took it from Sukhumvit to Kampong Phet (Chatuchak)
reviewText: First time using this comfortable in the early morning with few travellers but packed after 730am  Cool airconditioning and easy access  Tickets pricey for single trip
Excellent cheap and reliable Clean & efficient Much better than subway in Toronto I felt safe and people were friendlyhelpful
Weekly passes work well anytime travel very frequent and fast  but often full with standing room only

The MRT is the underground part of the Bangkok transportation infrastructure and currently has only one line running between the Hua Lamphong inter city train station and Bang Sue It covers downtown Bangkok in addition to China town Lumpini Park Cultural Centre and Chatuchak park It is connected to the other transportation networks in Bangkok like the Skytrain and Airport rail link Unfortunately for the commuters it uses a different kind of ticket from the Skytrain So travellers need to break the journey and purchase another ticket if they want to change from the Skytrain to the MRT or vice versa Fortunately tickets can be bought easily from the automated machines at the stations  Other than this small inconvenience it is a very fast and comfortable way to get around Bangkok The system is world class and comparable to any other MRT system in the world The stations are clean spacious and well maintained and the entire system (including the stations) is airconditioned which offers a respite from the humid Bangkok heat outside  The MRT offers a great way to get around Bangkok attractions and nightlife areas and is not too crowded except for peak times It is the best way to travel around Bangkok if your destination lies on its route

reviewTitle: Truly the best and safest transport in Bangkok
reviewText: MRT subway is truly the best and safest mode of transport in Bangkok Its network though not extensive goes to main strategic places and the fares are more than reasonable Elders can even get a discount if you are native travellers Its security system at the entrance to the subway could teach a thing or two to some in the west

reviewTitle: World Class Train System in Bangkok
reviewText: Absolutely fantastic a truly Worldclass Train System in Bangkok A modern wonder of Marble and Stainless Steel Everything (the Trains Train Platform Train Stations etc) are clean The best way to travel around Bangkok Cheaply Easily and Quickly  Ticketing is easy using a Touchscreen which dispenses a Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) Token and you can pay both in Coins and Paper Bills The machine only gives changes in Coins though The menu is available in Thai or English and you can choose either   Lots of Foreigners take it sometimes with their luggage probably either coming from or going to the airport since the system now integrates with an Airport Line  Foreigners tend to slow down the ticket queue a lot though and the Tokens and Coins are dispensed around your knee area so sometimes kind of hard to reach around and look for the Token and Coins  There is only one line now the Blue Line but as I understand more are being planned Interconnects with the BTS Skytrain seamlessly at certain stations

If the MRT is going near your destination  it is often a much quicker and cheaper route since taxis can get bogged down and take a long timethe MRT usually travels quickly and is convenient and clean and is a preferred mode of travel if one has a choice it also offers senior discounts and it's very cheap

reviewTitle: Quick, frequent, cheap and very clean
reviewText: What a great way to travel to various parts of Bangkok Quick frequent services cheap fares vary by the distance you want to travel and spotlessly clean You can buy a disc to access the terminal at a machine or at an attended counter\It also connects to some BTS Sky Train stations Really runs so smooth and highly recommended

This was our first time using the MRT and thought is was great It was massive clean well lit for an underground facility and the directions were very good Between the BTS and MRT any traveler should be able get around Bangkok with ease Surprisingly it was not crowded We are annual vacationers to Bangkok and look forward to using this mode of transportation again
This is a great way by on seen BangkokPlan you visit and use this to save moneyThis is very regular and it is very safe and clean Totally recommend

If you are looking to buy a few gifts and go quality Knock offs this is the place to shop  Try not to get overwhelmed by the size of the mall  Take at least half a day to shop  Bargain with the shop owners for the best price possible

Very nice and convenient Although not many stations but it connects the center of town Asoke and Silom with the northern outskirts of Bangkok Lad Prao and Chatuchak  Nice trains with good AC Travel durin NON rush hour is perfect
used MRT daily very cheap travel great if you have coins  The service people understand English Use if travelling
Bad  Can be busy during busy rush hour  Good Air conditioned quick cheap easy to use clean and safe I use this service to get to China tow or Or Tor Kor market   Would I use again yes

Traveling by public transportation is the most efficient and economical way to travel in Bangkok Since Most taxis and tuktuk drivers dont speak English the easy to read maps of the subway makes it the best option to reach your destinations It connects easily with the BTS  their above ground train system Clean efficient AC always working stops easily recognized as they are announced both in Thai and English Definitely the best way for getting around Bangkok

Bangkok has only one line  And it gets you to places where tourists do not usually go so if you want to see another side of Bangkok take the MRT get off at any random station  I went to Lumphini Park using the MRT and it was fast and convenient and certainly cheaper than going there by tuk tuk or taxi
Im an expert travelling on the MRT safe clean well airconditioned it the best way to get around central bangkok
MRT is more reliable and faster than the BTS However they do not go to a lot of places like BTS It is very efficient and very clean as well and a great way to get around Bangkok
MRT and BTS are very helpful and time saving for tourists in Bangkok especially in hot weather but MRT is more crowded than BTS
This is Bangkok Metro wich goes all through Bangkok Very modern and you cant get lost all so well announced You can reach even the farthest parts of the city with it

reviewTitle: Clean, nice and very quiet MRT
reviewText: I said very quiet because not many people using MRT Each station is big and very spacious Plus it is clean Not many station master can speak English so must use the name of the place you're going to then they understand Use the vending machine you choose English first on the top right hand side Press the name of the station you're going to and pay the amount by coins or paper Then there is black plastic coin comes out hang on to it don't loose it because this is your MRT ticket So the black plastic coin comes out then your change Look carefully for your change don't left it there Then you go the gate with the green light and there is a place to tap your black coin Hold on to your coin just tap it but still hang on to it When you exit from the station you just put the black coin on the slot just drop it then the gate will open   Have a nice ride
The MRT is the Metro of BKK and a great way to get around Easy to jump to the skytrain the Airport rail link and to numerous busses and trains

reviewTitle: Very easy to use and cheap
reviewText: Travelling on my own I found this really easy to use clean and efficient Very easy to get between the airport and city centre  although beware you'll need a taxi to Siam from Khao San road area

Fast cheap clean air conditioned and not usually busy What is not to like about this Use it whenever you can and avoid sitting in the Bangkok traffic for hours An absolute no brainer tickets are easy to buy just have some change (coins) handy
Way cheaper than taxi believe me Take it traffic is unpredictable even when its not rush hour Download the MTR and BTS maps online

reviewTitle: The only transport you need to travel
reviewText: What a convenience to travel around the city in a hot heavy traffic of Bangkok It is easy and cheap You can only buy a one way ticket per trip The cab is cool with AC and a map inside the train to track your location

reviewTitle: clean, fast and save way to cross the city
reviewText: Easy cheap fast way to cross the city Is connected with the other subway make sure you got your 10baht coins
MRT is quick way to travel especially to many of the shoping malls sharp turn of the metro going to MBK mall was nice

reviewTitle: What do I do with 19 stops?
reviewText: On my last day in Bangkok I decided to try its other modes of  transportation such as the MRT BTS and Bus #53 i did not have happy moments with either my tuktuk drivers and taxi drivers ( overcharges)  From my hotel near Khao San Road I took Bus 53 to Hua Lampong Station where the MRT line starts I bought a day pass for 120 bahts unlimited rides  My goal was to see how the various stations look like They don't appear to have any shops or restaurants at these stationsI stayed in the train from Hua Lamphomg to Bang Sue where all passengers had to get off Took the train on the other side of the tracks and got off at the Chatuchak Park Station  This station has a beautiful park near by the Chatuchak Park Clean public restrooms are free at the park I bought my day pass for BTS train at the Chatuchak Train Station  Please see my related review of BTS Note that there might be some attractions near the MRT stations I just did not stop by due to time constraints
I actually prefer the MRT to the BTS even though it is older A lot of times the MRT is less crowded Waiting on tokens can be the only downside so have correct change ready
You can travel to city centre of bangkok by MRT or tube in Bangkok  Such as Sukhumvit station Saladang station (Silom road) or Jatujak station (Jatujak park)

This is by far the best transport system we have travelled on in any city in the world It is fast cleaninexpensive & extremely efficient 1000's of people use it all the time & it is rarely overcrowded as the next train is only minutes away The BTS System covers most of the City & also is an inexpensive & fast way to get to the Airport on time  particularly in peak traffic times which are a constant in Bangkok If only Melbourne had installed a similar service from The Airport & around the City instead of the inefficient & expensive Myki
the hotel is very strategically located to the BTS station and the MRT station network  Travel is very convenient

reviewTitle: Great transportation without getting ripped off
reviewText: This is the best way to travel If you tried the tuk tuk already  this way to travel is the best No need to argue or negotiate prices or get frustrated Prices are set and the ride is smooth with air con Lots of space even for luggage

reviewTitle: I wish Australia had transportation like this
reviewText: Frequent cheap comfortable and reliable Take note Australia this is the way it should be Can be used to access most of the tourist sites

reviewTitle: Fast and Good mode of transaport
reviewText: This is the underground equivalent to the BTS system Clean quick and no traffic jams this is one of the other preferred transport systems when i'm visiting
With the every increasing number of vehicles clogging Bangkok's roads it makes sense (and saves money) to use the MRT system whenever possible It's cheap air conditioned and reliable

reviewTitle: The only way to travel in Bangkok
reviewText: The traffic is unbelievable in yet he city The metro is easy for foreigners to navigate It is reasonable and there are signs in English
Travelled all the way back to Bangkok in 1 day  it took about 11 hours  not a lot to see  would have used the sleeper if I had known

I found MRT very quite during night it is way too down from ground level and in night it becomes scary because of quite and empty platforms Very secured staff presence on all level throughout the MRT running hours

reviewTitle: Very handy to get away from Bangkok's bad traffic
reviewText: Use the MRT to get top places quickly and cheaply especially if travelling alone The system is easy to use and efficient It can get busy at peak hours however The mian negative is that tickets cannot be used in conjunction with the BTS system
Ideal to get very fast from A to B Cheap and easy Can be busy some times Better then taxi or tuktuk
While I primarily end up using the BTS skytrain to move around in Bangkok the MRT is a good complement to that for areas not served by the BTS It is as efficient as the BTS
Safe for travel price is great very smart to ride clean securities are friendly helpful Save time

reviewTitle: Safe Efficient way to travel across the city (and cheaper than BTS)
reviewText: This trip had cause to use MRT turned out to be cheaper and in some ways more efficient for my travel requirements than BTS  Also when I traveled seemed less crowded than what BTS can be at times  When in BKK consider MRT as a transport option  You will not be disappointed
As with BTS you can get day and multi day passes I prefer being above ground but you usually need both to get everywhere
If your destination is on the way of the subway it is a fast clean and convenient public transportation One way ticket are expensive
Quick clean ride  Helpful ticket staff for directions Easy signage Trains arrived on time and cars not overcrowded

waited for Skytrain broken already broken for 3 hours everyone still getting onto stationary trailno announcements security guards don't stop people from getting on train train stopped 8 hours still letting people get on train and train don't go no information from train staff
Excellent system  on a par with Hong Kong's subway but no as developed Easy to use convenient clean and ultra safe Saves so much time as apposed to Bangkok taxis
Another mass transit option if you are visiting Bangkok  Also very simple to use  Runs to different areas of Bangkok than the BTS Skytrain
We stayed in a hotel only a 3 minute walk from the MRT  We found it to be cheapreliable fast and pretty easy to figure out  It also goes to most parts of Bangkok
Convenient fast and economical  public transport mode for all in Bangkok with connectivity to city buses and sky train
Another great way to get around Bangkok  The MRT connects to the BTS and some stations  Don't waste time in traffic jams use the trains

Easy to use and easy to get around BangkokThe tickets are cheapbut advice if you are stopping for a few days and plan to use itbuy a day cardso if u stop for three days buy a thre days cardit means you do not have to stand in line to buy a ticket every time you want to use it and on some stations the lines are real longIt is safebut you will find if it is busy everyone will press up against youso more people can get into itTry not to travel at rush hour

reviewTitle: Good clean fast but not the most economical
reviewText: MRT is cheap fast and clean option But if you are travelling in a bigger group then taxi turns out to be more cheaper option Also you dont need to walk a lot or climp updown the stations if you use a taxi BTS network is not too extensive and the entryexit points are not too close to the major sites
I took the MRT train from Chinatown to Terminal 21 (the Hua Lamphong MRT station to the Sukhumvit MRT station) on February 2016 It was nice and clean It was easy to use

This transport system underground is an adjunct to the raised BTS or Sky train system and tends to run East West whereas the BTS is mainly North  South  There are many access points to and from the BTS system and the two together cover most of the city running efficiently as well as economically until midnight or just beyond starting at 5 am every morning
Save loads of time and stress by avoiding the Bangkok city traffic travel by MRT On time clean and efficient safest form of travel in Bangkok for sure
Tried once the train station is humid The aircon system seem not to be working The train is comfortable It can compete with BTS if the route is longer I suppose

There is only one line so the routenumber of stops is limited  However there are some good stops  The MRT goes through the Sukhumvit area which is where I stayed  If you go in one direction to Hua Lamphong you can get to Chinatown and the Gold Buddha  If you go the other direction you can get to the weekend market (a shopping must visit) at the second or third to the last stop at Mo Chit or Kamphaeng Phet  There is more shopping here than you can imagine and if you only spend a full day here you missed half the shops  Note  Some of the shops are outside = SUN and most are under HOT tin roofs
it is the best way to get around Bangkok the trains run frequently and are well airconditioned the fares are quite cheap
An easy convenient and cheap way to travel Bangkok Buying tickets and working out where to go is quite easy and you can get to most popular places in Bangkok
its realy nice and quik to go from a to b sadly there is only one line ( but if you can use it it keeps you away from the bussy streets
The MRT like the BTS is a marvelous way to get around Cheap efficient cool what's not to like Get one of the top up pass cards to save time at the machines
Good for travellers and Thais but whenever you still visiting places in the centre of Bangkok BTS is better
Takes you from one part of the city to another in no time at all Taxi could take one hour but MTR takes 15 minutes

I used this many times and love it  This time I used more because of the hotel I stayed  It is an excellent form of transportation to the heart of Bangkok  It is clean and the booth and other travelers are helpful  So just ask and you will get help If you buy a single trip you will get a plastic black coin touch it at where travelers touch the card  Keep the coin with you and put the coin in the hole on your way out  This time I took advantage of "Senior Citizen" value  Great way to go around Bangkok

The MRT is reliable clean and you feel safe  the maps and ticket pricing system are easy to understand and the ticket machine worked well too (you can switch to an English version of the screen) At Hua Lamphong station there is also a nice exhibition at the walls on the way to the trains explaining the history of Bangkok public transportation and the metro which is worthwhile to study even if it means that you will miss the next train

Even though the MRT in Bangkok is not a huge system like London and other cities there are some great locations to visit  Cheaper and quicker than any tuk tuk or taxi   I recommend you buy a day 3 day or 5 day passes depending on the length of your stay obviously The reason for this is it will save you queueing for tokens during busy periods

reviewTitle: Not quite as good as SkyTrain
reviewText: The lines for token machines in busy stations here are often way too long They need to fix this The easiest way would be to create a single storedvalue card that can be used on this service AND SkyTrain (right now they're not compatible) Also seems to run with less frequency than SkyTrain

A useful transport option if you stay near one but transferring from the MRT to BTS would be a hassle as it involves exiting one station and going up and down escalators and stairs to the other station You have to queue again to buy a separate ticket The ticket machines at each station is limited and may be out of order too It accepts coins 20 50 and 100 thb notes  One useful tip is to buy your return ticket when you arrive at the station esp when there's no crowd yet
Great way to get around central Bangkok It's cheap it's clean and only crowded during rush hours Makes many stops at all the places you want to see Great shopping and great places to eat

reviewTitle: Great choice of transportation in Bangkok
reviewText: Specially when you live in heart of Bangkok like Asoke   This is the best way to escaped all those traffic on Sukhumvit Ratchada Roads   It's reliable and on time   Buy a prepaid reloaded ticket to avoid long Q at rush time   The price for prepaid reloaded ticket for adult is 180 THB which will deduct 50 THB deposit and 30 administration fee The money left in card is 100 THB For 2 bucks you save a lot of time to Q up
Another good option for transportation in BKK to avoid traffic during the day this is recommendation

reviewTitle: travel when in Bangkok by MRT
reviewText: As I reside in the Kingdom of Thailand I find this to be a safe and good way of travel in the city Stored value ticket holder

When i'm in Bangkok i like to use the MRT to go around If you like to know more about the MRT go to Hua Lampong station and take the train station exit Many photos and information about the MRT I can not wait till the new lines (purple line and extension of the blue line) are available

reviewTitle: The ideal way to travel in a busy city
reviewText: A great way of moving around Bangkok very cheap in comparison with European metro systems always very clean and fully airconditioned it interlinks with the BTS system and also offers a discount to senior citizens they are very strict about food and drink being consumed on board and your bags will be searched prior to you entering the station free maps are available to help you plan your journey
This is the easiest way to travel in and near Bangkok to beat the traffic jam and overcharging taxi and tuk tuks  Buy a card easy
These subway services are good but the problem is the subway trains are too old and it feels depressed when we're going to somewhere by using this subway trains but it's convinient for traveling
Just like their skytrain this is clean cool and really convenient A much better solution to taxis n tuk2s

I think the most easiest and cheapest way to travel around bkk would be the mrt and BTS The trains are very clean and easily accessible If you staying for a Long period of time  you can purchase the mrt card which is slightly more cheaper

When there is no Skytrain station nearby in Bangkok then hopefully there is a MRT station available In most other countries or cities the subway systems are dirty rundown areas where people feel uncomfortable In Bangkok however the MRT is very clean very modern and very comfortable and convenient Excellent

reviewTitle: Very easy efficient way to travel
reviewText: Cheap easy accessible clean and well networked Definitely worth it especially with the traffic in Bangkok

This is the way to go if it meets your needs I use the MRT every chance I can It is cheap easy to useclean and fast Transfers to BTS Avoid rush hours if possible as it does get crowded There is English announcements as well as video screens on the train showing the stops upcoming  And let's face it you can't get lost if you miss your stop just come back Get a pocket map of the transit system and ride

I use the MRT when ever I can It usually runs on time and is cheap It also links up with the BTS at some of the bigger stations If your staying for more than a week and you know you'll be using the MRT or the BTS quite a bit it may pay to buy a pass and put some credit on it to save trying to buy tickets in peak hour

Even though they are planning and constructing at the moment there is just ONE MRT line that offers high comfort air conditioned to the max and reasonably priced From Hua Lamphong (central train) station it might take you as far as JJ Market (Chatuchak) There is tokens you get from a machine for each trip If you stay longer there is various possibilities of value stored cards or period passes

reviewTitle: Great way to beat the traffic
reviewText: Inexpensive fast reliable clean the MRT is a great way to get around the city and avoid traffic It can get really busy at rush hours but still much better than sitting in traffic   Highly recommended

reviewTitle: Used MRT for fewer connections to my destination
reviewText: We needed to travel to Lumphini station a couple of times and the MRT was the quickest option to get to this location The cost was only 21THB and the trains were less crowded compared to the BTS Skytrain and having to make connections There are escalators and the ticket machines can be easily switched to English by pushing one button and all you need to do is push the station on the screen where you would like to go and it tells you the price of the ride It‚Äôs easy to maneuver around the system on the MRT
If you are going from Silom to sukhumvit or vis versa the mrt is a better option as you avoid changing trains at Siam which is always packed
I tend to use this for all of the areas that I cannot reach by the BTS  It is easy to understand and get around without needing to speak Thai

reviewTitle: Use this system.....it works quite well!
reviewText: If you're an American traveling abroad do not be intimidated by this system  Take your time  Everybody is incredibly polite and they will help you  "Very safe lady  It ok" Virtually everyone speaks rudimentary English if you speak slow enough  They want to help but you have to ask  They're all in a hurry and there are masses of people everywhere so just keep pace with them Sometimes the turnstiles got stuck but most were helpful

reviewTitle: Clean and efficient means of transportation
reviewText: An easy way to get around the downtown area Clean inexpensive and easy to navigate Ask for a subway map at the ticket office Has several links to the skytrain but  each has separate fares

I've been using MRT more than the BTS Skytrain to get around Bangkok but the combination of the two is very powerful  I wouldn't consider staying anywhere in Bangkok that is not a short walk from one of the systems' stations  The alternative to using the two public transit systems is sitting stalled in Bangkok's traffic  MRT is just as clean and efficient as BTS  Unfortunately it uses a different system of payment though they are talking about using a universal card 'any year now'  If you will be riding more than a few times I'd strongly suggest getting a prepaid card It will get you into the system much faster at rush hour when the singletoken machines have long queues  A few downsides to the MRT 1) You can only by a single token from your current station to elsewhere You can't buy a round trip 2) The MRT and the BTS (currently) has two separate systems for multitrip cards

reviewTitle: Cheap and great way to travel around Bangkok!
reviewText: I think for the day to day get around Bangkok you either take taxi or take the train  In fact for 90% of my travelling is by using the MRT  Its cheap clean and efficient  The instructions are very simple and easy to read as it has sufficient English for directions  Although one little comment would be that its sadly not connected with the Sky Train as some stations need to interchange that means need to buy tickets separately  Whether its fast its really hard to say in some cases taking a taxi will be much quicker (subject to traffic condition)

reviewTitle: Finally! An efficient, clean and quick way to get around Bangkok
reviewText: I can't wait for the completion of the additional sections to be done but for our group  this was an great welcome for travel into Bangkok It's clean secure and inexpensive compared to other cities with subway systems It's well complimented with the BTS Skytrain It's easy to use with great signage and verbal announcements I applaud the safety considerations and modern subway
Quick and cheap way to get around BKK Very clean and you get relief from the heat Easy to read maps and very good English over the intercom system so you don't miss anything
The best way to get around Bangkok inner city at the moment new routes are coming on line in the next few years  Fast and efficient airconditioned coaches to take you around the city

reviewTitle: Value added underground tube in Bangkok
reviewText: We recently did our 4th trip to Bangkok in as many years We love Bangkok for its public transport trains Though the major lifeline for us tourists is its BTS skytrain service the MRT is another value addition to reach areas in central Bangkok where there is no BTS We stay at hotels a short walk from MRT Silom (& BTS Saladaeng) and simply love the SilomSukhumvit area With Bangkok's very heavy road traffic the local taxis & tuk tuks overcharging foreign tourists & local buses not very convenient for non Thai speakers hence the importance of this value added skytrain service All instructions are bilingual Thai & English with tourist friendly signs The trains have very good air conditioning so it acts as a dehumidifier There are escalators at many stations too for travellers with bags Can get crowded during peak hours though the crowd discipline is excellent The only negative is the absence of return tickets 1 3 or 7 day passes so beneficial for tourists

reviewTitle: Fast & easy way to travel around
reviewText: We stayed at silom where we can access both BTS & MRT within walking distance The BTS card cannot be used for MRT

We used this to get to Chinatown from the BTS line which we are usually on  It was our first time using this mode of transport and we marvelled at how clean and efficient it is  Staff were friendly and helpful

Bangkoks subway is a great way to get to places if you don't like sitting in traffic jams for decades It's safe clean airconditioned and pretty cheap The downside is that it is just one line in a very big city So if you don't live near a station or are headed somewhere near a station it's kinda useless and you are stuck in traffic again
We used the subway to get to the train station and the experience was easy modern maps were easy to read and exits were easy to read and follow

The MRT is fine for what it does if what it does is what you need  By that it is not an extensive subway system a la those of other great cities of the world  NY Paris London or Tokyo It is a couple of lines alone high travel routes  There is a chance it might start near where you are and go to where you want to go  If so you are lucky as it is clean and efficient and reasonably priced  But it may require you to change from MRT to BTS the skytrain and as those are not part of the same system you have to exit the MRT and buy a new ticket for the BTS a foolish aspect of mass transit in Bangkok  Probably the result of some idiotic political issue of which Thailand has many

reviewTitle: The MRT is Bangkok's underground rail service
reviewText: With only one line that was completed around 2004 the MRT is clean reasonably quiet and cheap It is of course used heavily during the rush hour I believe weekly or monthly tickets can be purchased which would help avoiding the queues The trains are about 5 minutes apart and everyone queues to get on There is no real pushing or shoving During off peak times it is a joy to use

reviewTitle: Cheap and convenient way of getting around
reviewText: Bangkok train system may not be as extensive as compared to NYC subway but it's a cheap and quick way for getting to other parts of the city plus our hotel was by the station making it very convenient The stations are air conditioned which was a relief from the heat and humidity The only downside trains stops running by midnight

Yes they are crowded at times but the thai people are so polite it really is a pleasure to get around this way It becomes methodical  insert coins get bingo chip (lol)  go through security insert ticket find right direction of train catch train to stop It's SO easy Much easier than I even thought it would be  and all the stops are so clearly labeled Many even have (Exit 3 example xxx mall xxx attraction this way) clearly marked signs telling you where to find what you need  making it so easy for tourists to get around It's cheap it's a bit of walking but no worries it's mostly air conditioned )   TIP see something at an MRT stop but on the other side of the road Go back into the MRT and take a  different exit Ta daa You're now on the other side of the road You're welcome It took us way too long to figure that out lol Also MRT is less busy than the BTS in general Not by much but it is noticeable  And there don't appear to be any garbage cans or food allowed at MRT so pack it in pack it out Same with BTS Though BTS has shops near ticket booths

The undeground railwayor subway in Bangkok is fantastic Clean efficient and all at a reasonable cost It is quickestway to getfrom say Asoke to Hualumpong Railway station near Chinatown  Staff at the stations are helpful and accommodating  Probably the greatest shock was how civilised the queues were at peak time Used to the rush and push of everyday life in Bangkok it was a pleasant surprise to see people line up properly and wait as passengers got off and they themselves got on I could hardly believe it

reviewTitle: Convenient and rapid means of transport
reviewText: Hassle freeclean and rapid mode of transport around central BangkokHas connection to airport shuttle and BTS tooInstructions and signages in English along with Thaiso tourist friendly

Just like the BTS skytrain the MRT is a smart and convenient means to travel around central BKK The MRT is essentially a subway so you wont see anything interesting But it is nonetheless clean reliable

Hassal free transport in the centre of Bangkok that is cool and fast with an ever expanding network This has interconnecting station with the BTS and even the airport link but the walk is a little long if you have lots of baggage Travelling at peak times ie early morning for workers and again in the early evening with workers going home it can get very crowded If you are staying in Bangkok for any length of time pick up a multi pass that you only need to top up as required its saves time lining up for tickets A very clean safe effective and cool option to transport yourself
MRT is one of the fast  public  transporation in Bangkok   The only negative  think of Bangkok transportation is  that we cannot  use  one card for all transportation I hope  it will get better soon

My friend and I utilized this transportation option many times during our trip While it is true that the line might not drop you right at some attractions it will get you close enough to cut your travel time in half and allow you to experience walking on some local streets As of September 2015 (perhaps as a result of the recent bombings) before entering you must walk through a metal detector and present your bag for a quick inspection This does not seem to slow down your travel at all There is a ticket desk but also self service kiosks with an "English" option Very simple to use just indicate your destination stop and the amount charged will display Most machines accept 100 baht notes or under and most coins We rode for an average of 2025 baht (less than $1) per ride A token will dispense that you touch to a pad to get through the "gate" At your final stop when you exit the station you put your coin through a slot to open the "gate" The subway is clean and efficient Stops are announced in both Thai and English Make sure to mind the queue indicators on the floor As another heads up train direction is indicated by the final (terminus) stop in each direction
quite a good system but sometimes the access to the stations involves a lot of stairs which sometimes deters using the system but overall a cheap way of getting around

reviewTitle: Convenient connection to the BTS and to various attractions
reviewText: For solo travelers the MRT is very convenient to get to many attractions It takes you right to Chatuchak (weekend) market near the stalls It also acts as a good connection to the sky train if you're staying close to an MRT station For instance we were near Phra Rama 9 and we took the blue line towards Bang Sue to get to Chatuchak You can't club the passes for the MRT and BTS though  they use separate ticketspasses The stations are announced in both English and Thai The carriages and stations are neat We found it a convenient alternative to get to many attractions that required connections to the BTS
